senses.definition: v. אבה.
n.m. fruit (BH; √ אבב);—sf. 3 ms. אִנְבֵּהּ (K§ 11, 4b)) Dn 4:9, 11, 18.
vb. perish (BH);—
Impf. 3 mpl. יֵאבַ֫דוּ (not -וּן v. K§ 26, 1) Je 10:11 they shall perish, pass away.

(Old Aramaic האבד Lzb205 Cooke189) destroy: Impf. 2 ms. אַל־תְּהוֹבֵד (K§ 41c) Dn 2:24 (c. ל pers.); 3 mpl. יְהוֹבְדוּן v 18 (indef. subj.; acc. pers.); Inf. לְהוֹבָדָא v 12, 24 (both c. ל pers.), -דָה 7:26 (abs.).
(K§ 41c WCG 225) be destroyed: Pf. 3 ms. הוּבַד 7:11.
(assumed as √ of foll.; v. p. 3).
n.m. father (BH אָב);—
lit. father, sf. אַ֫בִי Dn 5:13 (v. Behrm Marti), אֲבוּךְ (K§ 53, 2 a) v 11(×3), 18 אֲבוּ֫הִי v 2.
pl. fathers, ancestors [אֲבָהָן Dl.c.
n.f. Dn 2:34 stone (BH id.);—abs. א׳ Dn 2:34 +; emph. אַבְנָא v 35;—
a (the) stone Dn 2:34, 35, 45; 6:18.
stone, material of idols 5:4, 23; of buildings Ezr 5:8; 6:4.
(K§ 50, 3) n.f. letter-missive (late BH אִגֶּ֫רֶת, Old Aramaic אגרת, Palm. אגרתא Lzb207);—abs. א׳ Ezr 4:8 (van d. H. -רָא); emph. אִגַּרְתָּא 4:11; 5:6. אדרגזר

adv. then, thereupon (so Egyptian Aramaic (S-CPap. H 1, J 1), not 𝔗: the usually Aramaic forms are הֵידֵין, ܗܳܝܕܶܝܢ, Mand. האידין (NöM 207); from [אֱדַי] = BH אֲזַי (v. אָז) + determ. affix n (as in דִּכֵּן, תַּמָּן; in Sab. = post-pos. art., HomChr. § 57: cf.WCG 115), NöGGA 1884, 1020: אֲזַי, [אֱדַי], prob. from same demonstr. √ as זֶה, דָּא, דִּי, etc., إِذْ, إِذَا, lo, إِذًا well then, in that case, Ethiopic ማእዜ when? ይእዜ now (Di Lex. 197, 1072), Syriac ܕܶܝܢ (enclitic) but);—then, thereupon, Dn 2:15, 17, 19, 25, 48; 3:24 +, Ezr 4:9, 23; 5:4, 9 + (always, except Ezr 5:5, at beginning of sentence, introducing new stage of narrative with some emph.); so c. בְּ, בֵּאדַיִן (3 times Ezr., 26 times Dn) Dn 2:14, 35, 46; 3:3, 13, 19, 21, 26, etc., Ezr 4:24; 5:2; 6:1; מִן־אֱדַיִן from that time †Ezr 5:16.
(K§ 57a) n. pr. 12th month (BH id.);—Ezr 6:15.

n.m. threshing-floor (𝔗 id., Syriac ܐܶܕܪܳܐ, cf.Chr-Pal. SchulthLex. 3; hence Arabic أَنْدَرٌ as loan-word Frä136; conj. on etym. LagGes. Abh. 10 HoffmLCB 1882, 320 JenZA vii (1892), 210);—pl. cstr. אִדְּרֵי־קַיִט Dn 2:35.

n.m. counsellor (Pers. loan-word = andaržaghar NöCOT Dn 3:2, Tabari 462 AndrM 51* Str42* Dr Scheftii. 57; MeyEntst. J. 25 questions, and thinks military title);—pl. emph. אֲדַרְגָּֽזְרַיָּא Dn 3:2, 3.

adv. correctly, exactly (according to HaugJBW 1853, 152 f. Scheft 68 f. from Zend derez, make firm, whence Skr. ptcp. pass. dṛḍha, firm, sure, suitable, Zend dereśta, holding firm, Pers. durust, whole, complete, correct; > NöKAT2 617 from אַזְדָּא, q.v.);—Ezr 7:23 יִתְעֲבֵד א׳.
v. דרע.
(√ of foll.; v. BH אוֹת, II. אוה).
n.m. Dn 3:33 sign (always as wrought by God, and always c. תמהין wonders);—pl. abs. אָתִין Dn 6:28; emph. אָתַיָּא 3:32; sf. אָתוֹ֫הִי v 33.
(√ of following, BH II. אול, איל).
(D 138) n.m. Dn 4:7 tree (𝔗 אִילָן, Syriac ܐܻܝܠܳܢ; cf.BH אֵלָה, אֵלוֹן, p. 18);—abs. א׳ Dn 4:7; emph. -נָא v 8, 11, 17, 20, 23.
vb. make hot, heat (𝔗 id. [rare]; cf.Arabic أَزَّ kindle, burn);—
. Inf. לְמֵזֵא (K§ 11, 3b) Dn 3:19 (ל acc.), sf. לְמֵזְיֵהּ v 19; Pt. pass. אֵזֵה (K§ 15e) v 22.

(so Gi, with most MSS.; Baer אָֽזְדָא) adj. sure, assured (Pers. azda, Skr. addhâ, ‘certain’ (Kern ZDMG 1869, 220); so first NöKAT2 617; confirmed now by Egyptian Aramaic (RÉS 361, B 3) הן אזד יתעבד מן if it is made certain (certified) by, etc.; > 𝔊 KiAV al. (v. Thes) as vb. is gone, or (אָֽזְדָא) is going, from Talm. אֲזַד (= אֲזַל) go away (LevyNHWB i. 50); so ScheftMGWJ 1903, 310 from Zend *azda ‘gone,’ ptcp. pass. of azaiti ‘go’);—Dn 2:5 מִלְּתָה מִנִּי אַוְדָּא, v 8 דִּי־אַזְדָּא מִנִּי מִלְּתָא the word is assured on my part (the thing is fully resolved upon by me: cf.𝔖 ܫܰܪܺܝܪܳܐ; IE קַיָּימָא וֶאֱמֶת); + 3:14 (v. צְדָא).
vb. go, go off (BH [rare]);—

Pf. 3 ms. א׳ Dn 2:24 + (אֲזַ֑ל v 17; 6:20); 3 pl. אֲזַ֫לוּ Ezr 4:23; 1 pl. אֲוַלְנָא 5:8; Imv. ms. אֵֽזֶל(־אֲחֵת) v 15 (for אֱוַל K§§ 15 e); 38, 1 c));— 1. go, go off, c. ל loc. Dn 2:17; 6:19, 20 Ezr 4:23 (+ עַל pers.), 5:8; go and say Dn 2:24, go (and) put Ezr 5:15.
(√ of following; BH II. אזן, מאֹזְנַיִם).

(Baer Gi Str) n.m.emph. scale, balance (cf.also Mand. מוזאניא NöM 148, Egyptian Aramaic מוזנא S-C G 24, Chr-Pal. ܡܘܙܢܝܐ SchulthLex. 5 NöBSW 56 JacobZAW xxii (1902), 90);—Dn 5:27 (van d. H. du. emph. מאֹזְנַיָּא, v. K§ 51, 1, Anm. M 33*).
(√ of following; v. BH אֶחָד).
adj. one, a;—ms. ח׳ Dn 2:31 +; fs. חֲדָה Ezr 4:8 +;—

one side Dn 7:5; n. om. 6:3; חֲדָה 2:9 = one and invariable (inevitable); כַּחֲדָה v 35 as one, altogether (so S-CK 3 𝔗, and late BH כְּאֶחָד Ezr 2:64 +); = ordinal, שְׁנַת חֲדָה first year 7:1; Ezr 5:13; 6:3; ח׳ = a certain one (τινὰ) Dn 7:16 (c. מִן partit.).
a (indef. art.) c. subst. Dn 2:31; 6:18; 4:16 (v. שָׁעָה), Ezr 4:8; 6:2, חַד שִׁבְעָה Dn 3:19 = seven-fold (as Syriac: Nö§ 241 PS 1194; cf.Ex 16:5 𝔖), v. K§ 66, 2.
(assumed as √ of foll.; cf.BH אָח p. 26).
n.m. brother;—pl. sf. אחיך Kt (? יִךְ—ַ֫ K§ 53, 2, Anm. b)), אֶחָךְ Qr (K§ 63) Ezr 7:18 thy brethren, i.e. fellows, associates.
v. [חוה].
v. חוד.

(orig. -תָן or -תָנָא Nö in StreckZA 15, 368) n.pr.loc. Ecbatana, Ezr 6:2; capital of Media, captured by Cyrus (b.c. 550), and then summer residence of Pers. kings; mod. همذان Hamaḏân, Spieg244 Margoliouth Hast. DB Achmetha, especially Brugsch Reise n. Persien (1862), i. 360–392 (OMed. Agmatana Dl Calwer Bib. Lex.; OPers. Hañgmatâna (= place of assembling) Spiegl.c., Bab. Agam(a)tanu Beh 60, Bez p. 26, etc.; Ἀγβάτανα Herod i. 98; 𝔊 Ἐκβατανα 2 Macc 9:3 +; MeyGesch. d. Alt. i. § 485 Streck l, c. 367 f.).

pl. c. אַחֲרֵי, prep. after (Cappad. and Egyptian Aramaic אחר afterwards (LzbEph. i. 361 S-CPap. C 8), prob. Nab. אחר after (Lzb212 SAC 16); Egyptian Aramaic אחריכם (S-CPap. C 8 +); 𝔗 (sometimes) אֲחוֹרֵי; BH אַחַר);—אַחֲרֵי דְנָה after this Dn 2:29, 45; c. sf. אַחֲרֵיהֹן 7:24. Usually Aramaic syn. בָּאתַר, q.v.
adj.f. another: v. אָחֳרָן.

Dn 4:5 Kt, וְעַד אחרין עַל קֳדָמַי דָּנִיֵּאל; very dub. (v. Comm.); usually and unto the last (= at last) came in, etc.; but word in this sense unknown: Qr אָחֳרָן; read perhaps (Bev) וְעֹד אָחֳרָן (or? Kt אַחֲרִין; cf.ܐ݈ܚܪܺܝܢ) and yet another came in before me.
n.f.cstr. end (Hebraism; so (cf.JacobZAW, 1902, 84–6) Chr-Pal., Schulth 6);—Dn 2:28 בְּא׳ יוֹמַיָּא (from BH בְּא׳ הַיָּמִים p. 31 a).

adj.m. another (Egyptian Aramaic אחרן S-CD 11 +; Nab.Palm. id. (Lzb 212); 𝔗 אוּחְרַן; cf.Syriac ܐ݈ܚܪܺܝܢ );—Dn 2:11, 44; 3:29; 4:5 Kt 5:17; 7:24. The f. in use is אָחֳרִי (Egyptian Aramaic אחרה, RÉS 246; 𝔗 Talm. אוֹחְרִי (D§ 20. 5); cf.K§ 61. 5 M§ 87 d Nö Beitr. 51), Dn 2:39 מַלְכוּ א׳, v 39 7:5, 6, 8, 20.
n.m.pl. satraps (BH -נִים; cf.M 52* );—emph. -נַיָּא Dn 3:2, 3, 27; 6:2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8.
Ezr 5:15 v. נְחַת.
v. אול.
adj. terrible (𝔗 אֵימְתָן, from אֵימְתָא = BH אֵימָה, q.v., √ אים);—fs. abs. אֵימְתָנִי (K§61, 5)) Dn 7:7 (on form v. PrätZMG lvi (1902), 156 Nö BSSW 51, Anm. 3).

(Baer אִתַי, except bef. sf., v. Baer Dn 2:10) part. there is, are … (proposes a subst. foll. by a gen., v. BH יֵשׁ: Egyptian Aramaic איתי RÉS 361, S-CPap., Nab. איתי, Palm. אית, 𝔗 Talm. אִית (Dalm § 44, 4), Syriac ܐܻܝܬ, Sam. ࠀࠉࠕ, Mand. אִית, עית (NöM §§ 213, 272): v. further BH יֵשׁ);—אִיתַי Dn 2:10, sf. אִיתָיךְ 2:26 Kt (Qr אִיתָךְ K§ 53, 2 b), אִית֫וֹהִי 2:11, איתינא Kt (i.e. prob. איתַ֫יְנָא: Kl.c.), Qr אִיתָ֫נָא 3:18, אִיתֵיכוֹן v 14, 15;—there is (are) …, abs. Dn 2:28 אִיתַי אֱלָהּ בִּשְׁמַיָּא there is a God in heaven, v 30 not by wisdom דִּי־אִיתַי בִּי that is in me, 3:12; 5:11; sq. ptcp. or adj. 2:26 הַאִיתָיךְ כָּהֵל art thou able …? 3:15, 17; sq. דִּי, Ezr 5:17 הֵן אִיתַי דִּי if it is that … With neg. לָא אִיתַי (so S-CD 10 +; 𝔗 Syriac Mand. לַיִת, ܠܰܝܬ, Zenj. sf. לישה (Cooke 184); cf.sub BH יֵשׁ) Dn 2:10 לָא אִיתַי אֱנָשׁ דִּי …, 3:29; 4:32; after the subj. 2:11 a; 3:25 וַחֲבָל לָא א׳ בְּהוֹן, Ezr 4:16; sq. ptcp. or adj. Dn 3:14, 18; with pleon. sf., 2:11 דִּי מְדָֽרְהוֹן עִם־בִּשְׂרָא לָא אִיתוֹהִי.
vb. eat, devour (BH);—
Pf. 3 mpl. אֲכַ֫לוּ Dn 3:8; 6:25; Impf. 3 ms. יֵאכֻל 4:30; 3 fs. תֵּאכֻל 7:23; Imv. fs. אֲכֻ֫לִי v 5; Pt. fs. אָֽכְלָה v 7, 19;—
eat, of beast, Dn 4:30 (acc. rei).
devour, of beast in vision, 7:5 (acc. rei), abs. v 7, 19; hence fig. of kingdom, devour, devastate, v 23 (acc. of earth).
in phr. א׳ קַרְצֵיהוֹן 3:8 eat their pieces, i.e. slander them, cf.6:25 (v. קְרַץ).
adv. of prohibition, do not …, let not …, sq. impf. (= BH I. אַל; Zenj. אל (Had 22.23.29) Cooke 160 f.; cf.Pehlevi (NöGGA, 1884, 1016); not 𝔗 Syriac);—Dn 2:24 אַל־תְּהוֹבֵד, 4:16; 5:10.
demonstr.pron.pl. these (v. אֵלֶּה infr.), Ezr 5:15 Qr (Kt אֵלֶּה).

n.m. god, God (= BH אֱלֹהַּ (p. 43), v. also √ I. אלה p. 41);—א׳ abs. Dn 2:28 +, cstr. v 18 +; emph. אֱלָהָא v 20 +; sf. אֱלָהִי 6:23, -הָךְ Ezr 9:14 +, -הֵהּ Dn 6:6 +, -הֲהֹם Ezr 5:5; 7:16, -הֲהוֹן Dn 3:28(×2), 29, -הֲכֹם Ezr 7:17, etc.; pl. abs. אֱלָהִין Dn 2:11 +, emph. -הַיָּא Je 10:11, cstr. -הֵי Dn 5:4, 23, sf. -הַי 3:14, etc. [c. pref. לֵאלָהָא Dn 5:23, לֵאלָהָ֯יךְ 3:14, etc.; but not in sg. abs. or cstr., e.g. לֶאֱלָהּ Ezr 5:12, etc.];—
god, in gen. Dn 6:8, 13; heathen deities Je 10:11 Dn 2:11; 3:15 + 15 times Dn (made of gold, etc. 5:4, 23), + בַּר־אֱלָהִין 3:25 (v. בַּר).

73 God (of Isr.), Dn 2:28 Ezr 5:2 +; phr. אֱלָהּ יִשׂ׳ Ezr 5:1; 6:14; 7:15; א׳ יְרוּשְׁלֵם 7:19; א׳ אֲבָהָתַי Dn 2:23; א׳ שְׁמַיָּא Ezr 5:11 (+ וְאַרְעָא), v 12 6:9, 10 Dn 2:18, 19 + 6 times (v. שְׁמַיִם 2 a); א׳ רַב Dn 2:45; א׳ אֱלָהִין v 47; אֱלָהָא עִלָּיָא 3:26, 32; 5:18, 21; א׳ הַיָּא 6:21, 27; also בֵּית אֱלָהָא 5:3 Ezr 4:24; 5:2 + 16 times Ezr; עֲבִידַת א׳ Ezr 6:18.

demonstr.pron.pl. these (Nab. אלה (Lzb 264 Cooke 241), Cappad. and Egyptian Aramaic אלה (LzbEph. i. 323 RÉS 361 A 3 S-CPap. E 13, K 13): prob. therefore not, as used to be supposed, a Hebraism, but a peculiarity of the dialects of Je 10:11 and of Ezr (in which the usually Aramaic form אִלֵּין does not occur): v. further אִלֵּין);—these, Je 10:11 Ezr 5:15 Kt.

interj. lo! (der. uncertain: usually regarded as by-form of אֲרוּ, q.v.; cf.Egyptian Aramaic הלו, Cooke No. 73, RÉS 492 B = S-C M b);—וַאֲלוּ Dn 2:31 חָזֵי הֲוַיְתָ וַאֲלוּ, 4:7, 10; 7:8, always in description of a vision.

(אִלֵּן Dn 2:44; 6:7) demonstr.pron.pl. these (pl. of דְּנָה, q.v.: Palm. אלן (Lzb264 Eph. i. 343. 345 Cooke 26); 𝔗 אילין; Mand. עלין (NöM 89 f.); Talm. (with emph. hâ prefixed, WCG 109) הָאִלֵּין: v. further sub BH אֵלֶּה, and add Egyptian Aramaic אלו Cooke 26);—these, only Dn: Dn 2:40 דִּי מְרָעַע כָּל־ אִלֵּין, v 44 כָּל־אִלֵּן מַלְכְוָתָא, 6:3 אֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנַיָּא אִלֵּין (so v 7), 7:17 אִלֵּין חֵיוָתָא.

demonstr.pron.pl. these (pl. of דֵּךְ, q.v.: Egyptian Aramaic אלך (Cooke 207 RÉS361 B S-CPap. E 6 +): with hâ prefixed, OSyr. ܗܠܘܟ, f. ܗܠܝܟ, Nö§ 67, M § 82 Burkitt Evang. da-Mepharreshe ii. 42, Chr-Pal. ܗܠܝܟ (m. and f.) SchwIdiot. 24; cf.Arabic أُولَاكَ, Ethiopic እልኩ Di Lex. 1057: the demonst. affix ך as in דֵּךְ, ذَاك, etc.; WCG 110);—these, גֻּבְרַיָּא אִלֵּךְ these men, Dn 3:12, 13, 21, 22, 23, 27; 6:6, 12, 16, 25 Ezr 4:21; 6:8b; also Ezr 5:9; 6:8a.

n.m. 1,000 (= BH II. אֶ֫לֶף);—abs. א׳ (n. pers. precedes) Dn 5:1; n. om., emph. אַלְפָּא v 1 the thousand (just mentioned); cstr. + pl. abs. אֶ֫לֶף אֲלָפִ֯ים Dn 7:10 a thousand thousands (< Qr אַלְפִין K§ 51, 2).
n.f. Dn 3:1 cubit (= BH id.; v. p. 52; Egyptian Aramaic (pl.) אמן RÉS246 S-C C 44);—pl. אַמִּין (so 𝔗 Syriac) Dn 3:1(×2); Ezr 6:3(×2).
n.f. nation (BH id., late);—abs. א׳ Dn 3:29; pl. emph. אֻמַּיָּא 3:4, 7, 31; 5:19; 6:26; 7:14; Ezr 4:10.
vb.
trust (BH);—Pf. 3 ms. הֵימִן בֵּאלָהֵהּ Dn 6:24; Pt. pass. מְהֵימַן trusty, trustworthy, of pers. 6:5, interpretation 2:45.
vb. say, tell, command (BH אָמַר);—

Pf. 3 ms. א׳ Dn 2:12 +, אֲמַ֑ר 7:1; 3 fs. אֲמֶ֫רֶת 5:10 (K§ 38, 1 a)); i s. אַמְרֵת 4:5; 1 pl. אֲמַ֫רְנָא Ezr 5:4, 9; Impf. 3 ms. יֵאמַר (K§ 41) Dn 2:7 +; 2 mpl. תֵּאמִרוּן Je 10:11, etc.; Imv. ms. אֱמַר Dn 2:4 +; mpl. אֱמַ֫רוּ 2:9; Inf. לְמֵאמַר v 9, לְמֵמַ֑ר Ezr 5:11 (K§ 41 a); Pt. אָמַר Dn 2:5 + often, pl. אָֽמְרִין 3:4; Ezr 5:3 +;—

say (often in phr. answer and say): sq. orat. rect. (only), Dn 2:7, 10 + 13 times Dn, Ezr 5:11; + ל pers. Dn 2:5; 3:14 + 14 times Dn [pl. c. indef. subj. for pass. 4:28], Ezr 5:15; + קֳדָם pers. Dn 2:9; 5:17; 6:13, 14; + כֵּן 4:11; 7:23, כֵּן c. ל pers. Ezr 5:3; Dn 2:24, 25; 6:7, cf.7:5; + כְּנֵמָא c. ל pers. Ezr 5:4, 9; + כִּדְנָה c. ל pers. Je 10:11; sq. acc. rei + עַל pers. against whom Dn 3:29.
relate, tell: sq. acc. rei Dn 4:6, 15; 7:1, + ל pers. 2:4, 9, 7; 7:16 (acc. rei om.), + קֳדָם pers. 2:36; 4:4, 5.
command: sq. inf. 2:12, 46 + 6 times Dn; sq. vb. fin. 5:29; 6:17, 25; sq. ל pers. + or. rect. 3:4 [pl. c. indef. subj., for pass., K§ 76 e, so 4:23].
n.[m.] word;—cstr. Dn 4:14; Ezr 6:9.

n.m. lamb (Assyrian immeru (also = child; immertu, girl; conj. as to etym. DlProl. 28 JenZMG xliii (1889), 203; ZA vii. 216 SchwallyIdiot. 114), 𝔗 אִמְּרָא; Syriac ܐܶܡܪܳܐ, Pun. אמר, Palm. pl. emph. אמריא Lzb 220 Cooke Inscr. 120. 337; Arabic أَمَّرٌ (loan-word? cf.Frä 107, but also DHMVOJ i. 24));—pl. אִמְּרִין, lambs, as sacrif. victims Ezr 6:9, 17; 7:17.
(Norzi) v. אֵימְתָן.
Dn 2:8; Ezr 6:12; 7:21 in common edd.: v. אֲנָה.
v. אֵב.
v. יְדַע.

pr. 1 s. i (= Heb. אֲנִי, q.v.: Zenj. Cilic. Egyptian Aramaic אנה (Cooke 182. 194. 202; S-Coften), Nab … נה (Lzb 221); 𝔗 אנא, Syriac ܐܶܢܳܐ );—I, Dn 2:30; 4:6, 27; 5:16, before a ptcp. 3:25; 4:34, after a ptcp. (K§ 76, 2 b) 2:8 מִן־יַצִּיב יָדַע אֲנָה, v 23 4:4; sq. a n.pr. 4:1 אֲנָה נבוכדנצר שְׁלֵה הֲוֵית, v 15, 34; 7:15; Ezr 6:12; 7:21, as nom. pendens, Dn 4:31; 7:28; emphasizing a sf. (K§ 87, 3) 7:15; Ezr 7:21 (cf.S-C B 8, J 12, K 3. 5).

pr. 3 mpl. they, those (pl. of הוּא: 𝔗 אִינּוּן, f. אִינִּין, e.g. Gn 3:7; 6:2; Syriac ܗܶܢܽܘܢ, ܐܶܢܽܘܢ, f. ܗܶܢܶܝܢ, ܐܶܢܶܝܢ; Talm. אִינְהוֹ, אִינְהֵי (for אִינְהוֹן, אִינְהֵין); Mand. הינון, הינין;—all from הוֹן, הֵן, with demonstr. syll. אן, הן ‘lo,’ prefixed, WCG 98, 106 NöM 86);—they, those, Dn 2:44 מַלְכַיָּא אִנּוּן those kings, 6:25 as accus. רְמוֹ אִנּוּן, 7:17 Kt דִּי אִנּוּן אַרְבַּע (Qr f. אִנִּין) which are four (Dr 1 S 10:19 K§ 87, 3), Ezr 5:4 מָה אִנּוּן שְׁמָהָת … = what are the names …? (Dr§ 201, 3, Obs., K l.c.). cf.הוּא.
(Ezr 4:16 אֲנַ֫חְנָה) pr. 1 pl. we (Egyptian Aramaic RÉS361 S-CPap. אנחנה; BH אֲנַחְנוּ; WCG 100 f.), Dn 3:16, 17; Ezr 4:16 (after ptcp.), 5:11.
they (f.) Dn 7:17 Qr: Kt אִנּוּן, q.v.
vb. oppress (BH [late] constrain);—
Pt. אָנֵס לָ֑ךְ Dn 4:6.

n.m. only du. (SchulthZAW xxii (1902), 164) face (BH אַף, √ אנף; Aramaic of Têma אנפי SAC23 Lzb 222 Cooke 69, 1. 14, so S-C G 19 and (usually) 𝔗J; אפין 𝔗 Onk Jon, ܐܰܦܺܝܢ Syriac Chr-Pal. (SchulthLex. 13); also אפי Palm. Lzb 222 Cooke p. 339, Chr-Pal. c. prep. ܠܦܝ SchulthLex. 14, etc.);—pl. sf. 3 ms. אַנְפּ֫וֹהִי Dn 2:46; 3:19.
(√ of foll.; cf.BH II. אנשׁ, ii. אֱנוֹשׁ).

n.m. man, mankind;—abs. א׳ Dn 2:10 +; emph. אֲנָשָׁא v 38 +, so Qr 4:13, 14 (> Kt אנושׁא K§ 57 f); so Nab. אנוש often Lzb 222 Cooke 219 SAC 22): pl. אֲנָשִׁים 4:14 (Hebraism, M 53* proposes אֲנָשָׁא);—
man, human being, Dn 2:10; 3:10; 4:13; 5:5, 7(×2); 6:13(×2); 7:4(×2), 8; Ezr 6:11; so בַּר־אֱנָשׁ Dn 7:13 a son of man, human being (v. especially Dr Dn 102; DBSon of Man).
coll. men, people, Ezr 4:11; Dn 4:14 a. 22(×2), 29(×2), 30; 5:21, cf.pl. 4:14; זְרַע א׳ 2:43 i.e. human off-spring; בְּנֵי אֲנָשָׁא sons of men, = men, 2:38; 5:21.
(√ of foll.; BH III. אנשׁ, אִשָּׁה).

n.f.pl. wives (so Zinj. (Cooke 62. 8) cstr. נשי, 𝔗 נְשִׁין, Syriac ܢܶܫܶܐ, Heb. נָשִׁים, Arabic نِسَآءٌ: on sing. v. BH אִשָּׁה, and add Aramaic of Nineveh cstr. אשת (CIS i. 15), and Egyptian Aramaic אנתה S-CPap. D 10 +);—pl. sf. נְשֵׁיהוֹן Dn 6:25.

Kt14 (i.e. אַנְתָּה, peculiar to Biblical Aramaic; Qr אַנְתְּ) pr. 2 ms. thou (BH אַתָּה p. 61b; Cappad. and Egyptian Aramaic אנת (LzbEph. i. 67; S-C A 11 +, f. אנתי ib. D 9, 11, 26 +), Nerab את (Cooke 186. 190), Palm. אנת (ib. 308); 𝔗O את, 𝔗J אנת (D§ 16. 1); Syriac ܐܰܝ݈ܬ );—thou, Dn 2:29, 31, 37, 38 etc., Ezr 7:25.
pr. 2 mpl. ye, you (BH אַתֶּם p. 61b), Dn 2:8.

n.pr.m. Asnappar, who transported peoples to Samaria Ezr 4:10; Ασενναφαρ, 𝔊L Σαλμανασσάρης; prob. = Assyrian kg. Ašurbanipal (b. c. 668–626), i.e. אס(רב)נפל, Gelzer Äg. Zeitsch. 1875, 78 COT ad loc. MeyE. Jud. 29 f. ZimKAT3. 351 Berthol ad loc. Ency. Bib.342.

adv. thoroughly, RV. with (all) diligence (Zend aspĕre, asperenõ, Pers. siparī, asperī, all complete, Castell [1669], Thes Haug JBW 1853, 154 LagSem. i. 48 AndrMarti, Gl 53* ScheftMGWJ 1903, 415 (correcting Arisches im AT. 73 f.));—Ezr 5:8 א׳ מִתְעַבְדָא, 6:8, 12, 13; 7:17, 21, 26 (cf.Old Aramaic אספרן, on a weight, complete, correct: Lzb 223, Cooke 193).
(√ of foll.; BH [אָסַר] bind, אֵסוּר bond, אִסָּר binding obligation).
n.[m.] band, bond (𝔗 אֲסוּר, אֵיסוּר, Syriac ܐܶܣܳܪ, ܐܰܣܽܘܪ );—abs. א׳ Dn 4:12, 20 (of iron and bronze, for stump, in Neb.’s vision); pl. abs. אֱסוּרִין Ezr 7:26 bonds = imprisonment.
n.m. interdict (as binding);—א׳ abs. Dn 6:8, 13, 16; cstr. v 13; emph. אֱסָרָא v 9, 10, 14.
n.m. Ezr 5:8 wood (so 𝔗, for עָע; Egyptian Aramaic עק S-C H5; BH עֵץ, √ II. עצה);—
abs. א׳ timber, for building Ezr 5:8; 6:4; beam v 11.
emph. אָעָא wood, material of idols Dn 5:4, 23.
conj. also (BH אַף; Egyptian Aramaic, Palm. אף (S-CPap. Lzb 224); 𝔗 אַף, 𝔗J also אוֹף; Syriac ܐܳܦ );—also, always וְאַף Dn 6:23; Ezr 5:10, 14; 6:5.

(K§ 52, 2 d)) n.pr.pl.gent. Ezr 4:9, 𝔅 Ἀφρασαῖοι, A Ἀφαρσαῖοι; Ges Lex. Man. RödThesAdd. 107 HoffmZA ii. 55 MeyEnst. J. 38 Persians; Dl Baer Ezr ix Scheft75 Parsua (in Media) [v. Streck ZA xv. 308 ff.]; yet v. COT ad loc.); Marquart 64 (א)סָֽפְרַיָּא secretaries (א dittogr. of preceding); often identif. with following, so AndrM 53*.
Ezr 5:6; 6:6 = (according to most)

4:9, n.pr.pl.gent., so most hitherto, and still MeyEnst. J. 38 ff. (Persians), but many moderns think official title (HoffmZA ii. 54 Marquart64 JenThLZ. 1895, 509 Ency. Bib. 190 f.; plausible explanations are: AndrM 53* = Assyrian šuparšaḳ (v. Muss-Arnolt Assyrian Dict. 1098 šāqū 3, general, idAJ Sem. Lang. xx (1904), 186 ff.); Scheft76 = OIran. aparasaraka, lesser ruler; id MGWJ 47 (1903), 315 f. expl. -תְּכָיֵא as OPers. aparaƟrãka, lesser governor).

or אַפְּתוֹם (so edd.: > Gi Baer [v. p. 102 f.] from MSS, אַפְּתֹס) Ezr 4:13 וְא׳ מַלְכִים תְּהַנְזִק; of uncertain meaning: Thes Haug JBW 1853, 156 in the end (from Pehlevi afdom, Pers. فدام end); Scheft 79 treasuries (from Zend pathmā, pl. of pathma, treasury, √ path, to fill up), will endamage the treasuries of kings.
v. צבע.
v. רבע.
n.m. purple, red-purple (BH id., אַרְגָּמָן);—emph. אַרְגְּוָנָא Dn 5:7, 16, 29.
(√ of foll.; BH I. ארה, אַרְיֵה).
n.m. Dn 6:25b lion;—abs. א׳ Dn 7:4 (sim.); pl. emph. אַרְיָוָתָא (D 153) 6:8, 13, 17, 20, 21, 23, 25(×2), 28.

interj. lo (of uncertain der.: only Biblical Aramaic (? Nab., v. CIS ii. 186); אֲלוּ, p. 1080, and NH הֲרֵי see! here ! Ab 3:4 al., are perhaps allied), וַאֲרוּ Dn 7:2 הָזֵי הֲרֵית … וַאֲרוּ, v 5, 6, 7, 13, always in description of a vision (cf.אֲלוּ).
n.[m.?
v. ארה.
n.pr.m. in Bab. (BH id., cf.Dl Baer Dn ix);—Dn 2:14, 15(×2), 24, 25; Αριωχ(ης).
(√ of foll.; BH [אָרַךְ, אָרֵךְ]).
(Baer Dn 4:24 K§ 54, 3. 2) n.f. a lengthening, prolonging (𝔗);—of time Dn 4:24; 7:12.
(√ of foll.; according to most, weakened from ערך (cf.BH) Be Ry Ezr 4:14; but אַרִיךְ loan-word from Pers. (OIranian) āryaka, worthy of an Aryan, Scheft 79).
adj.vb. fitting, proper (אַ׳ Baer K§ 16, 5 M-A§ 82, Anm. 2; van d. H. Gi Str אֲרִיךְ, cf.DWB 39; 𝔗 id.; orig. Pt. pass. K§ 57 b) r));—Ezr 4:14.
Dn 5:6, v. ברך.
n.pr.gent. people of Erech (BH אֶרֶךְ; so also MeyE. Jud. 40);—pl. emph. Ezr 4:9 (Qr אַרְכְּוָיֵא; cf.K§ 61, 6).

n.[f.] earth (so 𝔗 Syriac; = BH אֶרֶץ, q.v.);—emph. אַרְעָא Dn 2:35, 39 + 16 times Dn, Ezr 5:11; Je 10:11b; אַ֫רְעָא (D§§ 9, 5 a; 44, 1 n) = אֲרַע + א—ָ of direction, earthward, i.e. downward, אַרְעָא מִנָּךְ Dn 2:39 Kt lower than thou, i.e. inferior to thee Qr אֲרַע (cf.𝔗 אֲרַע מִן Ru 4:4);—Je 10:11a v. [אֲרַק].
n.f.denom. bottom (so 𝔗; cf.also 𝔗 אַרְעָאָה lower);—cstr. אַרְעִית Dn 6:25.

n.[f.] earth (= [אֲרַע]; ארקא Egyptian Aramaic S-CPap. B 15 + often (sometimes also ארעא, as ib. 16), Ninev. and Bab. Aramaic Cooke 192, also Mand. Nö M § 66, Zinj., Lzb 227 Cooke 166 (cf. 183); ק = ע, as Zinj. מוקא = מוצא, רקי = רצה, Cooke 166, 185; cf.K§ 7, 2 and Anm. 1 and reff., Cooke 185 NöZMG xlvii (1893), 100; M § 66 Gunk Schöpf. 18 Lzb Eph. i. 223 SACJQ, 1903–4, 273);—emph. אַרְקָא Je 10:11a.

n.pr.m. of king, Ezr 4:8, 11, 23; 6:14 = -שַׁסְתְּא 7:12, 21 (BH -שַׁשְׂתָּא; Egyptian Aramaic ארתחשסש RÉS 438, S-C B2+; v. also Andr M 54* Scheft i. 79);—Αρσαρθα, Α(ρ)σαθαθα, Αρθασαθα; 𝔊L Αρταξερξης.

n.m. Ezr 6:3 foundation (prob. loan-word from Assyrian uššû, id., √ אשׁשׁ (v. BH), so Zim KAT 3. 649; 𝔗 f. אוּשָׁא, NH אוּשָׁה, Chr-Pal. ܐܘܫ, ܐܘܫܐ, SchulthLex. 19; Arabic أُسٌّ: Nö M 99);—pl. emph. אֻשַּׁיָּא Ezr 4:12; 5:16; sf. אֻשֹּׁהִי 6:3.
n.[f.] fire (BH אֵשׁ; K § 55, 5. 2 b thinks emph. from onomatop. √ אשׁשׁ; D 161 Buhl √ אשׁא, cf.𝔗 אִישָּׁא, אִישָּׁתָא, Syriac ܐܶܫܳܬܳܐ );—Dn 7:11.
v. [אֹשׁ].
(K § 58 a) n.m. conjurer, enchanter (prob. Bab. loan-word; so BH אַשָּׁף);—abs. א׳ Dn 2:10; pl. abs. אָֽשְׁפִין v 27; 5:11, emph. אָֽשְׁפַיָּא 4:4; 5:7, 15.

n.m. meaning and √ dub. (K § 62 Buhl 14);—‖ בַּיְתָא Ezr 5:3, 9; most wall (𝔖𝔙 walls); M 55* cp. Assyrian ašurrû, wall, but?; Hpt in Gu Ezr pp. 34. 63 thinks = [aširânâ] from Assyrian ašru, sanctuary; pointed by Mas. as if = אֻשַּׁיָּא (4:12; 5:16); other conj. Marquart 44 Scheft 79 f..
v. שׁדר.
v. [שְׁתָה].
vb. come (BH poet. אָתָה; Palm. אתי Haph. Lzb230, Chr-Pal. ܐܬܐ Schulth Lex.);—

Pf. 3 ms. אֲתָה Ezr 5:3; Dn 7:22; א—ָ Ezr 5:16; 3 mpl. אֲתוֹ 4:12; Imv. mpl. (וֶ)אֱתוֹ Dn 3:26; Inf. לְמֵתֵה (K § 41 c)) v 2; Pt. אָתֵה 7:13;—come, c. עַל pers. Ezr 4:12 (+ ל loc.), 5:3; c. ל rei Dn 3:2; abs. v 26; 7:13, 22; sq. vb. fin. act. Ezr 5:16.

bring: Pf. 3 ms. הַיְתִי (K l.c.), Dn 5:13 (acc. pers. + מִן loc.); 3 mpl. הַיְתִיו, acc. rei 5:3, so (ל acc.) v 23 (+ קֳדָם pers.), 6:17 (ל acc. pers.), v 25 (acc. pers.); Inf. לְהַיְתָיָה (so Egyptian Aramaic RÉS 361 C) 3:13 (ל acc. pers.), 5:2 (ל acc. rei).
(pass., K l.c.) be brought: Pf. 3 fs. הֵיתַ֫יִת (K § 47, Beisp. 6, W CG 225) subj. rei Dn 6:18; 3 mpl. הֵיתַ֫יוּ subj. pers. 3:13 (+ קֳדָם pers.).
v. אוה.

n.m. Dn 3:19 (prob. f. v. 26) furnace (prob. loan-word from Assyrian utûnu, atûnu, id. [also TelAm.], DHM VOJ i. 23 Buhl; Syriac ܐܰܬܘܿܢܳܐ, hence Arabic أَتُّونٌ as loan-word Frä 26; Ethiopic እቶን Di763; conj. on etym. in K § 59 Anm. Lag BN 111);—cstr. א׳ Dn 3:6, 11, 15, 17, 20, 21, 23, 26; emph. אַתּוּנָא 3:19, 22.
v. אִיתַי.
n.m. place (so Egyptian Aramaic, Nab., Palm.; 𝔗; Syriac ܐܰܬܰܪ place; Zinj. אשר Lzb 229 f.; Arabic إِثْرٌ footstep; cf.Heb. אֲשׁוּר, and sub אֲשֶׁר);—place:
Dn 2:35 וְכָל־אֲתַר לָא־הִשְׁתְּכַח לְהוֹן, Ezr 5:15 וּבֵית אֱלָהָא יִתְבְּנֵא עַל־אַתְרֵהּ, 6:3, 5, 7. Hence

בָּאתַר (Dn 7:6 Baer בָּתַר) after (lit. in the track of: so Zinj. באשר (Cooke 160 f., 170), Palm. 𝔗 בָּתַר, Syriac ܒܳܬܰܪ ), בָּאתַר דְּנָה after this, Dn 7:6, 7, sf. Dn 2:39 וּבָֽתְרָךְ and after thee.
v. נתר.
prep. in, with, through, etc. (BH בְּ);—sf. בִּי, בָּךְ Dn 4:6 +, 3 ms. בֵּהּ 3:7 +, f. בַּהּ 2:41; 3:6 +, 3 pl. בְּהוֹן 3:25 +;—
in, of place, 2:38; 3:1; 4:12 בֶּאֱסוּר +; at Ezr 5:10, of time Dn 2:28; 3:5 (at), 5:2 +; 4:12 Ezr 4:16 חֲלָק בְּ׳ a share in (BH I. 2).
into, Dn 2:38 יְהַב בִּידָךְ, Ezr 5:12; עֲדָה ב׳ pass over or upon Dn 3:27.
of the instrument, by, with Dn 2:30, 34; 3:4; 4:12b, 24, 27 +; 5:2, 3 (Am 6:6: BH III. 2).
of the price (ib. III. 3), with, Ezr 7:17, 18.
יוֹם בְּיוֹם Ezr 6:9 = day by day (ib. III. 3, end; so Syriac PS 1577; cf.ירח בירח S-C L 5, ܫܢܳܐ ܒܰܫܢܳܐ PS 4240).
through, on account of (ib. III. 5), Ezr 6:14.
in the matter of, Dn 6:6, 18.
after vbs. of ruling, Dn 2:38 +, trusting 6:24, looking at 7:8; עֲבַד בְּ to do with 4:32 Ezr 7:18. cf.Lzb 232 K § 68.
vb. be evil, bad (so 𝔗; Syriac ܒܶܐܫ; Old Aramaic באש Lzb 233 SAC 27 Cooke 191; cf.BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. impers. ב׳ עֲלוֹהִי Dn 6:15 i.e. it was evil (displeasing) to him (cf.BH [רעע] 1).
adj. bad (so Egyptian Aramaic Cooke 75. 2; 𝔗 בִּישׁ, Syriac ܒܺܝܫ );—fs. emph. וּבִאישְׁתָּא Ezr 4:12 rebellious and bad city (not בִּאוּשְׁתָּא, v. Baern.).
v. אֲתַר.
n.pr.loc. Babylon (BH id.);—Dn 2:12 + 15 times Dn, 9 times Ezr.
adj.gent. pl. emph. as subst. בָּֽבְלָיֵא Ezr 4:9 the Babylonians.
vb.
scatter (so 𝔗 Syriac; BH [בָּזַר]);—Imv. mpl. וּבַדַּ֫רוּ Dn 4:11 (acc. rei).
vb.

alarm, dismay (so usually 𝔗 (not Syriac); BH [בָּהַל]);—Impf. 3 ms. sf. יְבַהֲלָךְ Dn 4:16 and 3 mpl. sf. -לֻנַּנִי 4:2; 7:15, 28 (both juss. Str§ 13 c M § 52 a); -לוּךְ 5:10, -לֻנֵּ֑הּ 4:16, -לוּנֵּהּ 5:6.
hasten (so Pi. in late BH; 𝔗 Ithpe. (rare)); Inf. בְּהִתְבְּהָלָה = in haste (orig. ‘in alarm’) Dn 2:25; 3:24; 6:20.
Pt. pass. מִתְבָּהַל Dn 5:9 was greatly alarmed.
n.f. haste (𝔗);—בְּב׳ Ezr 4:23 (K§ 61, 4)).
(assumed as prob. √ of foll., Brock Schulth; Lane 277).
n.[m.] mind (Syriac ܒܳܠܴܐ id. PS529; Arabic بَالٌ heart);—abs. שָׂם ב׳ Dn 6:15 (sq. Inf.; cf.Syriac ܝܗܒ ܟܠܐ PS l.c. SchulthLex. 80).
vb. cease (late BH);—
Pf. 3 fs. בְּטִלַת Ezr 4:24, Pt. fs. בָּֽטְלָא v 24 (both of work).
make to cease, acc. pers.: Pf. 3 mpl. בַּטִּ֫לוּ 4:23; 5:5; Inf. לְבַטָּלָא 4:21, acc. pers. om. 6:8.
prep. between (BH [בַּ֫יִן,] בֵּין; 𝔗 בֵּין, בֵּינֵי; Syriac ܒܰܝܢܰܝ, ܒܰܝܢܳܬ ); Dn 7:5; c. sf. 3 pl. m. בֵּינֵיהוֹן v 8 Kt (Qr 3 pl. f. בֵּינֵיהֵן).
n.f. understanding (BH; √ בין; 𝔗 בִּיּוּנָא, Syriac ܒܽܘܝܳܢܳܐ );—abs. ב׳ Dn 2:21.
(Baer -תָּא) n.f. emph. castle (so Egyptian Aramaic RÉS 361, A 5; B 1, 2 S-C Pap. B 3, C 16 +; Nab. = temple CIS ii. 164. 3; BH בִּירָה);—Ezr 6:2.

n.m. Ezr 6:7 house (BH בַּ֫יִת);—emph. בַּיְתָ֫א Ezr 5:3 +, -תָ֫ה 5:12; 6:15; cstr. בֵּית(־) 4:24; 5:2 +; sf. בַּיְתִי Dn 4:1 (Baern., cf.M§ 76 c; van d. H. Gi בֵּיתִי), בַּיְתֵהּ 2:17 +; pl. sf. בָּֽתֵּיכוֹן Dn 2:5;—

house, of men: Ezr 6:11(×2); Dn 2:5, 17; 3:29; 6:11; of king Ezr 6:4; Dn 4:4, ב׳ מִשְׁתְּיָא 5:10, ב׳ גִּנְזַיָּא דִּי מַלְכָּא Ezr 5:17, cf.7:20 = ב׳ סִפְרַיָּא וגו׳ 6:1; ב׳ מַלְבוּ Dn 4:27 royal residence (of Bab.).
house of God, temple at Jerusalem Dn 5:3, 23; Ezr 4:24 + 28 times Ezr.
vb.denom. (lodge,) pass the night (𝔗 id.);—
Pf. 3 ms. בָּת Dn 6:19.
v. בול.
vb.
wear away, out (BH בלה);—Impf. 3 ms. יְבַלֵּא Dn 7:25, fig. for harass continually (acc. pers.).

n.[m.] tribute (loan-word from Assyrian biltu, √ ובל, according to most mod.; but Scheft 80 cp. OIran. bali, tribute, OPers. bari, payment in kind, so (in Bab. bara) Mey G. d. Altert. iii. 88 Scheft MGWJ 47 (1903), 316 Buhl 14 ‘vielleicht’);—abs. מִנְדָּה ב׳ וַהֲלָךְ Ezr 4:13, 20; 7:24.
n.pr.m. Bab. name of Daniel (BH id., p. 117);—Dn 2:26; 4:5 + 6 times Dn; Βαλτασαρ.
n.pr.m. king of Bab., according to Dn 5:1, 2, 9, 22, 29 (BH id., p. 128) = בֵּלְאשַׁצַּר v 30; 7:1; Βαλτασαρ; vid. BevEncy. Bib. belshazzar DrDn xxviii f..
vb. build (BH בָּנָה);—

Pf. 3 ms. sf. 3 ms. בְּנָ֫הִי Ezr 5:11; i s. sf. בֶּנַיְתַהּ Dn 4:27; Impf. 3 mpl. יִבְנוֹן Ezr 6:7; Inf. לְמִבְנֵא 5:2 +, לְמִבְנְיָה v 9 (read לְמִבְנֵא M § 64 u or < לְמִבְנֵה, so S-C A 3. 64), לִבְּנֵא (read לְמִבְנֵא Str § 23 l M l.c.) v 3, 13; Pt. act. pl. בָּנַ֫יִן 4:12 +; pass. בְּנֵה 5:11 (v. on forms K § 47, Beisp. pass.);—build: c. acc. of temple Ezr 5:2, 3, 9, 11, 13, 17; 6:7, 8, so 5:4 (acc. cogn.); pass. of temple v 11; c. acc. of city 4:12 Dn 4:27; abs. Ezr 6:14(×2).
be built: Impf. 3 ms. יִתְבְּנֵא of temple Ezr 5:15; 6:3; 3 fs. תִּתְבְּנֵא of city 4:13, 16, 21; Pt. מִתְבְּנֵא of temple 5:8 (c. acc. mater.), v 16.
n.[m.] a building (so 𝔗 Syriac);—emph. בִּנְיָנָא Ezr 5:4.
vb. be angry (𝔗J id.; Sam. ࠐࠍࠎ );—
Pf. 3 ms. ב׳ וּקְצַף שַׂגִּיא Dn 2:12.
vb. ask, seek, only Dn (BH בעה (rare));—
Pf. 3 ms. ב׳ 2:16, 49; 3 mpl. בְּעוֹ v 13; 1 pl. בְּעֵ֫ינָא v 23; Impf. 3 ms. יִבְעֵא 6:8, 13; 1 s. אֶבְעֵא־ 7:16; Inf. לְמִבְעֵא 2:18; Pt. בָּעֵא 6:12, 14, pl. בָּעַ֫יִן v 5;—

ask, request, c. מִן pers. 2:16 (obj. cl. c. דִּי), v 49 7:16 (+ acc. rei); ask of God 2:23 (+ id.), of God or man 6:8 (+ acc. cogn.), v 13; c. מִן־קֳדָם of God 2:18 (acc. rei); = pray, ב׳ וּמִתְחַנֵּן קֳדָם א׳ 6:12, ב׳ בָּעוּתֵהּ v 14.
seek, acc. pers. 2:13, acc. rei 6:5.
Impf. 3 mpl. יְבַעוֹן (K§ 47, 3); Mad loc. conj. יִבְעוֹן) 4:33 resort (for favours) to, ל pers.
(K§ 61, 4) n.f. petition (𝔗 Syriac);—abs. ב׳ Dn 6:8; sf. בָּעוּתֵהּ v 14 (both acc. cogn. c. בְּעָא).

(K§ 54, 3 γ) n. m. owner, lord (Syriac ܒܥܶܠ, used similarly; cf.BH בַּ֫עַל, √ בָּעַל; also 𝔗 בְּעֵיל);—cstr. בּ׳־טְעֵם Ezr 4:8, 9, 17 i.e. commander (AndrM 56* as translation of Persian framātār, commander).
n.f. plain (𝔗; BH בִּקְעָה, √ בקע; cf.Syriac ܦܩܰܥܬܳܐ, √ ܦܩܰܥ );—cstr. בְּבִקְעַת דּוּרָא Dn 3:1.
vb.

inquire, seek (only Ezr) (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH);—Pf. 3 mpl. בַּקַּ֫רוּ 4:19; 6:1; Impf. 3 ms. יְבַקַּר 4:15; Inf. לְבַקָּרָה 7:14;—inquire, c. עַל (rei) concerning 7:14; c. subj. indef., = pass., 4:19 search was made, so 6:1, 4:15.
Impf. 3 ms. יִתְבַּקַּר 5:17, impers., let search be made.

n.m. son (𝔗 id.; Syriac ܒܰܪ, Mand. ברא Nö M § 148, Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. בר (and בן) Lzb 242 f.; Sab. בר according to Mordtm VOJ x. 154 f.; = בֵּן, ן becoming ר, Philippi ZMG xxxii (1878), 36 ff. Brock Syriac Gr. § 76 al.; √ diff. from בן according to JHMich Thes K§ 63 al.; BH בַּר Aramaism for בֵּן);—cstr. ב׳ Dn 3:25 +; sf. בְּרֵהּ 5:22; pl. cstr. בְּנֵי Ezr 6:9 +; sf. בְּנ֫וֹהִי 6:10; 7:23, בְּנֵיהוֹן Dn 6:25;—

son(s) Ezr 5:1, 2(×2); 6:14; Dn 5:22; 6:25; Ezr 6:10; 7:23; בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל 6:16 = Israelites, בְּנֵי גָלוּתָא = captives v 16; Dn 2:25; 5:13; 6:14; בַּר־אֱנָשׁ 7:13 i.e. one of human kind, בְּנֵי אֲנָשָׁא men 2:38; 5:21; בַּר־אֱלָהִין 3:25 a divine (or angelic) being (v. Dr, and cf.BH Gn 6:2; Jb 1:6); בַּר שְׁנִין וגו׳ 6:1 a son of 62 years = 62 years old (BH בֵּן 9).
of bullocks, בְּנֵי תוֹרִין Ezr 6:9.
v. ברר.
vb. kneel, bless (so BH);—
Pt.
act. בָּרֵךְ עַל־בִּרְכוֹ֫הי Dn 6:11 kneeling on his knees (in prayer).
pass. בְּרִיךְ Dn 3:28 blessed (be) the God, etc.
bless, praise: Pf. 3 ms. בָּרִךְ 2:19, 1 s. בָּֽרְכֵת (K § 39. 3) 4:31, both c. ל of God; Pt. pass. מְבָרַךְ 2:20 the name of God (be) blessed.
n.[f.] knee;—pl. sf. בִּרְכ֫וֹהִי Dn 6:11.
n.f. id. (by transp.; cf.𝔗 רְכוּבָא, 𝔗J אַרְכּוּבְתָּא; Chr-Pal. ܐܪܟܘܒܬܐ SchwallyIdiot. 89 (who > expl. from √ רכב, cf.SchulthLex. 194); Arabic رُكْبَةٌ id.);—pl. sf. אַרְכֻבָּתֵהּ Dn 5:6 his knees.

adv. with advers. force, only, nevertheless (der. uncertain: Nö M 202 = מָא + בָּר, lit. except what: 𝔗 בְּרַם often for אַךְ, אוּלָם; Syriac ܒܪܰܡ Ex 9:16; 21:21, and in NT for πλήν; Chr-Pal. ܒܪܢ, ܒܪܝܢ );—Dn 2:28; 4:12 hew down the tree, etc., בְּרַם … שְׁבֻקוּ only leave the stump, etc., v 20; 5:17; Ezr 5:13.
(√ of foll.; BH ברר, בָּר †Jb 39:4).
n.[m.] open field;—emph. בָּרָא, in חֵיוַת ב׳ (= BH חַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה), Dn 2:38; 4:9, 18, 20, 22, 29; דִּתְאָא דִּי ב׳ v 12, 20.
n.m. flesh (𝔗 בְּסַר, Syriac ܒܣܰܪ; BH בָּשָׂר √ בשׂר);—abs. ב׳ Dn 7:5 flesh (as devoured by beast); emph. בִּשְׂרָא 2:11 flesh = mankind, כָּל־ב׳ 4:9 = all creatures.
n.[m.] bath, liquid measure (𝔗; perhaps loan-word from BH ii. בַּת, √ בתת);—pl. abs. בַּתִּין Ezr 7:22(×2).
Dn 6:19 v. [בִּית].
v. sub אֲתַר.
(prob. √ of foll.; BH גָּאָה rise up).
n.f. pride (𝔗 גֵּיוָה; BH גֵּאָה; cf.K§ 55, 1 (but also 6 a));—abs. בְּג׳ Dn 4:34 in pride.

n.[m.] either back (𝔗 גַּב back, top; BH גַּב, √ גבב), or < side (√ גנב, cf.Arabic جَنْبٌ side, Syriac ܓܰܒܴ݁ܐ side, √ ܓܢܒ;—v. also D WB 65);—pl. sf. Dn 7:6 Kt wings עַל־גַּבַּיהּ on its sides (Bev Behrm Dr; Qr גַּבַּהּ perhaps its back, so most).
n.m. pit, den of lions (𝔗 גּוּב, Syriac ܓܽܘܒ pit;? cf.BH גֹּב n.pr.loc., √ גבב);—cstr. ג׳ Dn 6:8, 25; גּוֹב v 13; emph. גֻּבָּא v 17, 18, 20, 21, 24(×2), 25.
(√ of foll.; be strong, so 𝔗; BH גָּבַר).
n.m. man (BH);—abs. ג׳ Dn 2:25; 5:11; pl. abs. נֻּבְרִין (K§ 54, 3 ε) 3:24, 25, also, = certain ones, v 8, 12, 20; emph. גֻּבְרַיָּא Ezr 4:21; 5:4, 10; 6:8; Dn 3:12 + 9 times Dn.
n. f. might;—emph. גְּבוּרְתָּא (K§§ 9 c); 57 b) α) but M-A§ 72 c) Dn 2:20, 23.
n.m. mighty one;—pl. cstr. גִּבָּרֵי־ חַיִל Dn 3:20 (= BH גִּבּוֹרֵי חַיִל).

n. m. pl. emph. Dn 3:2, 3, dub.: most think ‖ form of [גַּזְבָּר] treasurer (or, MeyEntst. J. 23, textual error for גז׳); Gr Bev al. read הַדָּֽבְרַיָּא ministers (3:24); poss. (v. Lag Dr al.) dittogr. for following דְּתָֽבְרַיָּא.
vb. hew down (𝔗J; Syriac (rare); BH cut);—
Imv. mpl. גֹּ֫דּוּ אִילָנָא (K§ 46, Beisp. α) Dn 4:11, 20.

n.m. midst (Egyptian Aramaic Nab. Palm. גו; 𝔗 גָּיו; especially cstr. בְּגוֹ, לְגוֹ, מִגּוֹ; so Syriac ܓܰܘ; cf.BH גֵּו, p. 156);—cstr. גּוֹא (so Nab. CookeNo. 94) Dn 3:26 +, 7:15 edd., Gi גּוֹ (Baer גּוֹא, v. on 3:6); sf. 3 ms. גַּוֵּהּ †Ezr 5:7, 3 fs. גַּוַּהּ †4:15; 6:2;—midst, always c. preps.:
בְּגוֹא (= Heb. בְּתוֹךְ), Dn 3:25 בְּגוֹא נוּרָא, 4:7; 7:15; Ezr 4:15; 5:7 וְכִדְנָה כְתִיב בְּגַוֵּהּ, 6:2.
לְגוֹא Dn 3:6, 11, 15, 21, 23, 24.
מִן־גּוֹא Dn 3:26.
v. גאה.
v. Haph. Pt. pl. f. מְגִיחָן breaking forth, of winds Dn 7:2.
n.m. treasurer (Pers. loan-word (Scheft81); 𝔗 Syriac BH; K§ 64, 3; in Bab. ganzabaru Peiser ZAW xvii (1897), 347);—pl. emph. גִּזְבָּרַיָּא Ezr 7:21.—Vid. גְּדָֽבְרַיָּא.
vb. cut, (divide,) determine (so 𝔗 Syriac, in both meanings; BH usually divide, †Jb Est decree);—
Pt. act. as subst., pl. abs. גָּֽזְרִין determiners (of fate; astrologers or soothsayers) Dn 2:27; 5:11; emph. גָּֽזְרַיָּא 4:4; 5:7 (cf.Dr.; Arabic جزّار RS JPhil. xlii (1885), 781).
Pf. 3 fs. הִתְגְּזֶ֫רֶת 2:34 a stone was cut out, so אִתְג׳ (K§§ 23. 1; 30, 2) v 45 (c. מִן of source).
n.f. decree (𝔗 גְּזֵירָא, Syriac ܓܙܺܝܪܳܐ );—cstr. גְּזֵרַת Dn 4:14, 21.
c. בְּ, בְּגִין prep. on account of (so Galil. Aramaic, D§ 47, 3), read perhaps in 7:15: v. נִדְנֵה.
n.[m.] chalk, plaster (so 𝔗; BH once, p. 162);—emph. גִּירָא Dn 5:5.
v. גלל.
vb. reveal (BH גָּלָה uncover, reveal);—
reveal secrets, human agent: Inf. לְמִגְלֵא Dn 2:47; of God, Pt. act. גָּלֵא v 22, 28, 29, 47. Peʿîl Pf. גֲּלִי v 19, גֱּלִי v 30, revealed (WCG 225 Nö LCB, 1896, 703);—of secret, c. ל pers.
take into exile (BH Hiph.), Pf. 3 ms. הַגְלִי, c. acc. pers. Ezr 4:10; 5:12 (ל loc.).
n.f. exile;—emph. בְּנֵי גָלוּתָא i.e. exiles, Ezr 6:16; Dn 2:25; 5:13; 6:14 (cf.BH גּוֹלָה).
(√ of following; BH II. גלל; Palm. גללא Lzb250 SAC36 Cooke334, = στήλη λιθίνη).
n.[m.] rolling;—abs. אֶבֶן ג׳ Ezr 5:8; 6:4 stones of rolling, too heavy for carrying.
n.m. wheel (𝔗 BH; Syriac ܓܺܝܓܰܠ );—pl. sf. גַּלְגִּלּוֹהִ֫י Dn 7:9 of throne-chariot of God.
n.f. (book-) roll (𝔗 BH);—Ezr 6:2.
vb. complete (often 𝔗 Syriac; rare BH);—
Pt. pass. גְּמִיר Ezr 7:12 as adj. perfect (read perhaps שְׁלָם ג׳, Torrey Berthol; cf.5:7).
n.m. Ezr 6:1 treasure (𝔗; v. BH [גְנָזִים], sub גנז);—pl. emph. גִּנְזַיָּא treasures Ezr 6:1, בֵּית ג׳ דִּי מַלְכָּא 5:17, cstr. בֵּית גִּנְזֵי מַלְכָּא 7:20.

n.f. Dn 7:4 wing of bird (𝔗 גַּף, גַּפָּא, גַּנְפָּא (? DWB 79), Syriac ܓܶܦܳܐ; akin to BH אֲגַף, Assyrian agappu? according to NöM 77 (cf.Mand. גאדפא, 𝔗 גַּדְפָּא), Id. GGA, 1884, 1019, √ גדף, Arabic جَذَفَ, جَدَفَ fly, row (but this loan-word Frä 227));—pl. abs. wings, גַּפִּין Dn 7:4, 6; sf. גַּפַּיהּ v 4 Kt (Qr sg. גַּפַּהּ).
n.[m.] bone (BH גֶּ֫רֶם; Chr-Pal. ܓܪܡ Schulth Lex. 46);—pl. sf. גַּרְמֵיהוֹן Dn 6:25.

n.m. Dn 4:30 body (v. √ גשׁם in BH; 𝔗J גּוּשְׁמָא, גִּשְׁמָא (DWB 83), Syriac ܓܽܘܫܡܳܐ, body, self);—body of man, sf. גִּשְׁמֵהּ Dn 4:30; 5:21; 7:11, pl. sf. גֶּשְׁמֵיהוּן (K§ 15 a) 3:27, 28, both Kt, Qr sg. גֶּשְׁמְהוֹן (K§ 54, 3b)).

demonstr. pr. f. this (= BH זֹה: Zinj. Têma, Cappad. Egyptian Aramaic זא, Nab. דא, Palm. דה (Lzb 264; Eph. i. 323 Cooke 26), 𝔗 דא: v. further sub BH זֶה. The corresp. masc. is דְּנָה);—this, Dn 4:27 הֲלָא דָא הִיא בָּבֶל רַבְּתָא, 5:6 דָּא לְדָא נָֽקְשָׁן one striking another, cf.7:3 (v. זֶה 1 b), v 8 בְקַרְנָא־דָא. דָּארִין v. [דּוּר].
n.[m.] bear (so 𝔗 BH √ דבב; Syriac ܕܶܒܳܐ );—abs. ד׳ Dn 7:5.
vb. sacrifice (BH זָבַח);—
Pt. act. pl. דָּֽבְחִין Ezr 6:3, c. acc. דִּבְחִין, v. foll.
n.[m.] sacrifice;—pl. abs. דִּבְחִין Ezr 6:3.
n.[m.] altar;—emph. מַדְבְּחָא Ezr 7:17.
vb. cling (BH);—
Pt. pl. דָּֽבְקִין דְּנָה עִם־דְּנָה Dn 2:43.

n. f. cause, reason (BH id., √ דבר, cf.על דבר Egyptian Aramaic S-CPap. B 5.6.8.16);—cstr. in adv. phr. עַל־דִּבְרַת דִּי Dn 2:30 for the cause (to the intent) that, 4:14 (read עֶל for עַד K§ 11, 2 Bev).
n.m. Dn 2:32 gold (so 𝔗 Syriac; BH זָהֶב);—abs. ד׳ Dn 2:32 +, דְּהַ֑ב Ezr 7:15; emph. דַּהֲבָה 5:14; 6:5; 7:18, -בָא Dn 2:35 + 15 times Dn.
Kt, דֵּהָיֵא Qr, according to Thes and most n.pr. gent. Ezr 4:9, v. conj. identif. by Dl Baer Dn x Scheft81 f.; < read דִּהוּא that is, Hoffm ZA ii. 54 Marquart 64 MeyEntst. J. 36, 𝔊 οἳ εἰθίν.
vb. dwell (v. BH);—

Impf. 3 fs. of beasts תְּדוּר Dn 4:18; 3 mpl. birds יְדֻרוּן v 9 (Qr f. יִדוּרָן, f. subj., צִפֲּרֵי, follows, cf.v 18 and K§ 98, 2 c, Anm. 3); Pt. pl. of men, דָּארִין Kt 2:38; 3:31; 6:26 (Qr דָּֽיְרִין); as subst., cstr. דָּארֵי Kt 4:32(×2) (Qr דָּֽיְרֵי) dwellers.
n.[m.] generation (BH דּוֹר);—abs. in phr. עִם־דָּר וְדָר Dn 3:33; 4:31 (is) with generation and generation, i.e. endures gen. after gen.
n.[m.] dwelling-place;—sf. מְדֹרָךְ Dn 4:22, 29, מְדוֹרֵהּ 5:21.
n.m. id.;—sf. מְדָֽרְהוֹן Dn 2:11.
n.f. continuance (𝔗 id.; v. BH דּוּר);—abs. in phr. בִּת׳ continually Dn 6:17, 21.

n.pr.loc. near Bab., only בִּקְעֶת ד׳ Dn 3:1, 𝔊 τοῦ περιβόλου (Syro-Hex. περίβολον), Θ Δεειρα; Dûru is name of several places in Babylonia DlPar. 216; Baer Dn. p. x, cf.AndrM 58*; Hoffm Pers. Märtyrer 164 f.; name of small river and mounds Opp Expéd. i. 238 f. (v. Dr); improb. expl. as = زور zôr, depression (name actually used of lower Euphr. and Tigris valleys) by Wetzst De Jes3 701 f.; Bab. dûru = wall.
vb. tread down (BH);—
Impf. 3 fs. (sf. of earth) תְּדֻשִׁנַּהּ Dn 7:23, subj. beast.

n.f. dub.;—pl. abs. דַּחֲוָן Dn 6:19, Vrss conject.; AV RV instr. of music (so AE, assuming meaning strike [strings] for דְּחָא [BH דָּחָה] thrust; Saad RVm dancing-girls; Bertholdt al. concubines (from sens. obsc. of Arabic دَحَى), but then read prob. לְחֵנָן (5:2, 3, 23) Marti Prince Dr.
);—Pe. Pt. act. pl. דָּֽחְלִין Dn 5:19, c. מִן־קֳדָם of king, 6:27, id. of God; pass. דְּחִיל terrible 2:31, f. דְּחִילָה 7:7, 19. Pa. Impf. 3 ms. sf. וִידַחֲלִנַּנִי 4:2 the dream made me afraid.

part. of relation who, which, that, used also as mark of gen. and conj. that, because (Aramaic of Nineveh, Bab. Zinj. Nerab, Cilicia, Têma, Egypt, זִי (Lzb 267, 446 RÉS 361 S-CPap. A 2 +); Nab. Palm. די; 𝔗 דְּ (except in cpds., as דִּילִי mine, דִּילֵיהּ his); Sam. ࠃ; Syriac ܕ; Ethiopic ዘ za: of same origin as Arabic ذُو possessor of [cf.sub BH זֶה]. Properly a demonstr. that [cf.זֶה; in Ethiopic ze is ‘this’, za ‘which’]; but this being referred by usage to something preceding becomes equiv. to the relative who, which, used, however, more widely than Heb. אֲשֶׁר);—
as rel. who, which (construed like אֲשֶׁר):

Je 10:11; Dn 2:11 דִּי מְדָֽרְהוֹן whose dwelling, v 24 דִּי מַנִּי מַלְכָּא whom the king had appointed, v 26 דִּי שְׁמֵהּ בּ׳ whose name was B., 4:5; 5:12, 23, etc.; = that which 2:23; = him that Ezr 7:25; 6:15; Dn 7:17 דִּי אִנּוּן אַרְבַּע which are four (v. אִנּוּן). Sq. pron. of 2 ps. (cf.אֲשֶׁר 3), Dn 2:37 thou, O king …, דִּי … יְהַב לָךְ to whom … hath given, 4:19; 4:6 as to whom I know, etc. (cf.אֲשֶׁר 4 d end). Sq. תַּמָּה = where Ezr 6:1, so דִּי alone 6:3 Dn 2:38; of time, בְּעִדָּנָא דִּי at the time when, etc., 3:5, 15. With the pred. an inf. c. לְ, Dn 6:9 כְּתָבָא דִּי לָא לְהַשְׁנָיָה which is not to be changed, Ezr 6:8; a place- or other determination, Dn 3:20 valiant men דִּי בְחֵילֵהּ that were in his army, 5:2 הֵיכְלָא דִּי בִירוּשְׁלֵם, 7:20 Ezr 4:24; 5:6; 6:2, 6; cf.Dn 2:25; 5:13; 7:7; Ezr 7:23. דִּי לָא = without, Ezr 6:9; 7:22 (so דְּלָא 𝔗 Gn 15:2; Ex 21:11); cf.Dn 2:34, 45.

מַן דִּי, מָה דִּי (cf.in late Heb. מַה־שֶּׁ׳, מַה 1 e b) whoever, whatever, so †Dn 3:6, 11 מַן־דִּי־לָא יִפֵּל whoever does not fall down, 4:14 לְמַן דִּי יִצְבֵּא to whomsoever he willeth, v 22, 29; 5:21; מָה דִי whatever (or simply what), †Dn 2:28 מָה דִּי לֶהֱוֵא what will be, v 29(×2), 45 Ezr 6:8, 7:18.—cf.K§ 103.

as mark of the gen., Dn 2:15 שׁליטא די מלכא proposes the captain, that of the king = the king’s captain (a genuine Aramaic idiom: so 𝔗 דְּ, Syriac ܕ constantly), v 19, 25, 49 + often: the subst. in such cases may be either in the emph. state (determined), as ll. cc. Ezr 4:15; 5:2, etc., or in the abs. state (undetermined), Dn 5:5; 7:4, 9, 10 נְהַר דִּי נוּר; or it may have a pleon. sf., 2:20 שְׁמֵהּ דִּי אֱלָהָא lit. his name, that of God = God’s name, v 44; 3:8, 25, 26; 4:23, etc. (so also 𝔗 Syriac). To circumscribe an adj., especially in specif. of the material: Dn 2:38 thou art רֵאשָׁה דִּי דַהֲבָא the head of gold, v 39 3:1; 5:7, 16 Ezr 5:14; 6:4 +; as predic. Dn 2:32 רֵאשֵׁהּ דִּי־דְהַב טָב his head (was) of fine gold, v 33 7:19; with a pron. Dn 2:20 wisdom and might דִּי־לֵהּ הִיא are his; cf.6:27 וּמַלְכוּתֵהּ דִּי־לָא תִתְחַבַּל his kingdom (is one) which shall not be destroyed, 7:14.—Vid. further K§ 81.
as conj. (cf.אֲשֶׁר 8):

that (quod), after vbs. of knowing, Dn 2:8, 9, seeing 2:45; 3:27, hearing 5:14, etc.; introducing the subject of a sentence, יְדִיעַ … דִּי … 3:18 Ezr 4:13; Dn 2:47 מִן־קְשֹׁט דִּי … True is it that … (cf.אָמְנָם כִּי Jb 12:2).

= in that, inasmuch as, whereas: Dn 2:41 and whereas (דִּי) thou sawest, etc.… it shall be a divided kingdom, v 43 4:20, 23; as a connecting link = seeing that, because, for (cf.אֲשֶׁר 8 c) 2:9, 20b, 23b, 47b; 4:15; 6:24b.
that (ut), after vbs. of asking Dn 2:16, commanding 3:10, 29, expressing a purpose 4:3; 5:15; Ezr 4:15; 6:10 +; דִּי לָא that not (ne) Dn 2:18; 3:28; 6:18 (on דִּי לְמָה lest Ezr 7:23, see מה).
prefixed to direct narr. (like כִּי 1 b, and sometimes אֲשֶׁר 8 a γ, and ὅτι recitativum), Dn 2:25 and said thus unto him דִּי־הַשְׁכַּחַת (that) I have found, etc., 5:7; 6:6, 14.
with preps. and other prefixes:

כְּדִי (like Heb. כַּאֲשֶׁר; so Egyptian Aramaic כזי, Palm. Nab. כדי, Lzb 293 SAC Gl 62, 63 Cooke 369 b RÉS 361; 𝔗 כַּד, Syriac ܟܕ); a. according as, Dn 2:43, b. so soon as, when, 3:7; 5:20; 6:11, 15.
מִן־דִּי: a. because that, Dn 3:22; Ezr 5:12 (cf.מֵאֲשֶׁר Is 43:4); b. from (the time) that, after (ex quo), Dn 4:23; Ezr 4:23.
עַד דִּי until, Dn 2:9, 34; 4:30; 7:22; = ere that 6:25.
עַל דִּי Dn 3:19 is not a conj., but means above that which …
for עַל דִּבְרַת דִּי and כָּל־קֳבֵל דִּי see [דִּבְרָה] and קֳבֵל.
vb. judge (BH);—
Pt. pl. דָּאֲנִין Ezr 7:25 Kt (Qr דָּֽיְנִין), sq. ל pers.

n.m. Ezr 7:26 judgment;—abs. ד׳ Dn 4:34 = justice (of ways of God); emph. דִּינָה מִתְעֲבֵד מִנֵּהּ Ezr 7:26 judgment be executed upon him; דִּינָא = judges, court Dn 7:10, 26 + perhaps v 22 (reading וְד׳ יְהִב [יְתִב וְשָׁלְטָנָא], Ew Bev Kmp Dr); MT however = judgment was given in favour of (v. Dr).
n.m. judge;—pl. דַּיָּנִין Ezr 7:25.

n. f. (judicial) district, province (K§ 60, 3) d); also BH);—emph. מְדִינְתָּא (M-A§ 72 c) Ezr 5:8; 6:2; cstr. מְדִינַת Dn 2:48, 49; 3:1, 12, 30; Ezr 7:16; pl. abs. מְדִנָן 4:15, emph. מְדִינָתָא Dn 3:2, 3.
n.pr.m. Daniel (BH id.);—Dn 2:13, 14 + 50 times Dn.

n.pr.gent. (?) Ezr 4:9 (so most, but Hoffm ZA ii. 55 Marquart 64 AndrM 59* MeyEntst. J. 39 Str 46* read דַּיָּנַיָּא judges (as transl. of Pers. dâtabara), while Scheft 81 (improb.) cp. OIran. *denya, (the) orthodox, i.e. Persians).

demonstr. pr. m. this, f. דָּךְ; only Ezr; Dn uses דִּכֵּן (Egyptian and Cappad. Aramaic זך (CIS ii. 151 RÉS 361 B S-CPap. (f. דכא, דכי ib.F 6, 9), LzbEph. i. 67); 𝔗 דֵּיכֵי, f. דָּךְ; Arabic ذَاكَ; Ethiopic ዝኩ From ذَا, זֶה, דָּא (f.), with the affix ך (WCG 110), thus lit. = Germ. dieser da. The pl. is אִלֵּךְ, q.v.);—this (always after its subst.), Ezr 5:16 שֵׁשְׁבַּצַּר דֵּךְ, v 17 בֵּית־אֱלָהָא דֵךְ, 6:7, 8, 12; f. 4:13, 15(×2), 16, 19, 21 all קִרְיְתָא דָךְ, 5:8.
demonstr. pr. comm. this, that; only Dn; Ezr uses דֵּךְ (דֵּךְ + demonstr. affix n, WCG 111);—Dn 2:31 צַלְמָא ד׳, 7:20, 21 קַרְנָא ד׳.
n.m. ram (𝔗 דִּכְרָא, Syriac ܕܶܟܪܳܐ id., also (and primarily) male, v. BH זָכָר);—pl. דִּכְרִין for sacrifice Ezr 6:9, 17; 7:17.
n.[m.] memorandum, record (BH זִכָּרוֹן, √ זָכַר; cf.Nab. Palm. דכר(ו)ן Lzb268 SAC40 Cooke234 +);—emph. דִּכְרוֹנָה Ezr 6:2.
n.[m.] id.;—pl. emph. סְפַר דָּכְרָנַיָּא Ezr 4:15(×2).
vb. burn (BH);—
Pt. act. דָּלִ֑ק (K§ 29, 1) Dn 7:9 burning fire.
vb. be like (BH I. דָּמָה);—
Pt. act. דָּמֵה Dn 3:25 (ל pers.); f. דָּֽמְיָה 7:5 (לְדֹב).

demonstr. pr. comm. this (Zinj. זן, זנה; Egyptian Aramaic זנה (S-CPap. B 17 +); זנך (ib.C 6, D 8); Nab. Palm. דנה (Lzb 264 Cooke 26); 𝔗 דֵּין (e.g. 1 S 10:27) and (with הָ, i.e. הָא, ܗܳܐ ecce) הָדֵין; Aramaic of Têma הא זא (Cooke 195. 198); Syriac ܗܳܢܳܐ (contr. for הָֽדְנָא); Mand. האזין; Sab. ذن (HomChrest. 13); Ethiopic ዝንቱ: all from [דֶּה,] זה, + demonstr. n (WCG 108 f.); fem. Biblical Aramaic דָּא, 𝔗 דָּא, הָדָה, Syriac ܗܳܕܶܐ, Mand. האזא, Ethiopic ዛቲ without the n; the pl. is אִלֵּין, q.v.);—this:
Dn 2:18 רָזָא דְנָה this secret, v 28, 29, 30 +, Ezr 4:11; 5:3, 4, 9 +; כָּל־דְּנָה Dn 5:22.
אַחֲרֵי דְנָה after this †Dn 2:29, 45; so בָּאתַר דְּנָה †7:6, 7.
כִּדְנָה like this, thus, †Je 10:11 (= Heb. כֹּה), Dn 2:10 מִלְּתָא כִדְנָה a word like this (cf.כָּזֹאת Est 4:14), Da 3:29 Ezr 5:7.
עַל־דְּנָה on account of this †Dn 3:16; Ezr 4:22; 5:5, 17; 6:11; as conj. = therefore (cf.Heb. עַל־זֹאת) Ezr 4:14, 15.—Vid. also קֳבֵל and קַדְמָה.
vb. be shattered, fall to pieces (BH);—
Pf. 3 mpl. דָּקוּ Dn 2:35.

break in pieces: Pf. 3 fs. הַדֶּ֫קֶת 2:34, 45, 3 mpl. הַדִּ֑קוּ 6:25 (all sq. acc.); Impf. 3 fs. תַּדִּק 2:40 (abs.), v 44 (acc.); sf. תַּדֱּקִנַּהּ 7:23; Pt. act. מְהַדֵּק 2:40 (acc.), f. מַדֱּקָה (K§ 46, 3b)) abs. 7:7, 19.
v. דוּר.
n.pr.m. (BH id.; Egyptian Aramaic דריוהוש RÉS 361 S-C H 1 +);—
Darius Hystaspis Ezr 4:24 + 8 times Ezr.
‘Darius the Mede’ Dn 6:1, 2, 7, 10, 26, 29.
(√ of following; BH II. זרע, זְרוֹעַ).
n.[f.] arm (so 𝔗 Syriac);—pl. sf. דְּרָע֫וֹהִי Dn 2:32.
(K§ 60, 1)) n.[f.] force (proposes arm, 𝔗 (rare); BH אֶוְרוֹעַ);—abs. בְּא׳ וְחָ֑יִל Ezr 4:23 by force and power, forcibly.
n.f. Dn 6:9 decree, law (Syriac; Pers. loan-word, v. BH);—ד׳ abs. Dn 6:16; 7:25, cstr. Ezr 7:14 +; emph. דָּתָא Ezr 7:12 +; sf. דָּֽתְכוֹן Dn 2:9;—
decree of king Dn 2:13, 15; Ezr 7:26; c. sf. Dn 2:9 decree against you.
unchangeable law of Medes and Pers. Dn 6:9, 13, 16.
law of God (in mouth of non-Jews): Dn 6:6 Ezr 7:12, 14, 21, 26, so (abs.) Dn 7:25; laws of God Ezr 7:25.
n.[m.] grass (so 𝔗 Syriac; BH דֶּשֶׁא);—emph. דִּתְאָא Dn 4:12, 20.
n.m. judge (loan-word from Pers. dâtabara, law-bearer, judge (cf.דִּינָיֵא), AndrM 59* MeyEntst. J.23 Dr Dn; in Bab. as dâtabar(r)i Hilpr Bab. Exp. ix. 28);—pl. emph. דְּתָֽבְרַיָּא Dn 3:2, 3.

interrog. part. (BH הֲ, q.v.: 𝔗 הֲ; not Syriac: on the vocal., v. K§ 67, 2);—Dn 2:26 הַאִיתָיךְ art thou …? 3:14 הַצְדָּא (Baer Gi; edd. הַצְדָא), 6:21 הַיְכִל can he …? הֲלָא nonne? †3:24; 4:27; 6:13.

demonstr. part. lo! behold! (BH הֵא (twice); Egyptian Aramaic and Têma הא (Cooke 195, 198); 𝔗 הָא; Syriac ܗܳܐ; Mand. הא (NöM 81); Arabic هَا: in Aramaic also often prefixed to pr. 3 ps. for greater definiteness, as 𝔗 הָהוּא, ܗܰܘ (for hā-hū), v. NöM 89 f. WCG 106 f.), Dn 3:25.

demonstr. part., prefixed idiom. to כְּ for greater definiteness, lit. behold like (BH הֵא, v. הָא supr.), only in הֵא־כְדִי Dn 2:43 הֵא־כְדִי פַרְזְלָא לָא מִתְעָרַב like as iron doth not mingle with clay (cf.a. 𝔗O הָא כְמַוָּא Gn 49:4, so 𝔗jor הא כ׳ Is 5:28; 9:4 + often; 𝔗Jer הֵי כ׳ Gn 26:4, 18, 22 + often; הֵיךְ ψ 2:9; 5:10, 13 +, also pleon. הֵיךְ כְּ׳ ψ 22:14, 15, 17 + often b. Palm. הֵיךְ as (Lzb259), as היך בנמוסא as (is) in the law (Cooke321; so 𝔗Jer ψ 2:9, etc.), הֵיךְ דִּי conj. (like Dn הֵא כְדִי: = Heb. כַּאֲשֶׁר), as היך די גבא like as he levied, Cooke Tariff ii. b 12. 18, c 14. 17. 21. 26 [𝔗O Jon for כַּאֲשֶׁר have כְּמָא דְ׳, 𝔗Jer הֵיכְמָא דְ׳, 𝔖 ܐܰܝܟ ܕ]. It is dub. whether הֵא כְדִי belongs to a (notice especially 𝔗Jon) or b: Schulth ZAW 1902, 164 f. to b, reading הֵאךְ דִּי (but א rare and late: D§ 45. 1); NesOLtz. 1892, 488 from הֵיךְ (v. BH) how?). הַב v. יְהַב.

n. m. counsellor, minister (Pers. loan-word; orig. form and meaning dub., cf.AndrM 60* MeyEntst. J.23 Dr Dn 3:24);—pl. emph. הַדָּֽבְרַיָּא Dn 6:8; cstr. הַדָּֽבְרֵי 3:27; sf. הַדָּֽבְרֵי 4:33, -ר֫וֹהִי 3:24.—Vid. גְּדָֽבְרַיָּא.
n.[m.] member, limb (loan-word from Pers. هَنْدَام, أَنْدَام id. Lag Ges Abh. 28 Fl Levy ChWB i. 423 b); pl. abs. הַדָּמִין תִּתְעַבְדוּן Dn 2:5 ye shall be made members, i.e. dismembered, so 3:29.
vb.
glorify God (𝔗 Syriac BH honour man);—Pf. 2 ms. הַדַּ֑רְתָּ Dn 5:23; 1 s. הַדְּרֵת 4:31; Pt. act. מְהַדַּר v 34 (all c. ל pers.).
n.[m.] honour, majesty, of kg.;—emph. הַדְרָא Dn 5:18; sf. הַדְרִי 4:27, 33 (where Behrm plausibly (after Theod) הַדְרֵת [𝔗 הֲדַר return]).
vb. come to pass, become, be (BH הָיָה);—

Pf. 3 ms. הֲוָה Dn 4:26 +, הֲוָא Dn 5:19 +; 3 fs. הֲוַת Dn 2:35 הֲוָת Dn 7:19; 2 ms. הֲוַיְתָ Dn 2:31, 34; 1 s. הֲוֵית 4:1 +; 3 mpl. הֲווֹ Dn 2:35 +; Impf. 3 ms. לֶהֱוֵא (K§ 47, 1) b) Dr§ 204 Obs. NöM215 ff.; cf.D§ 61, 1 c) Dn 2:20 +; 3 fs. תֶּהֱוֵה Dn 4:24 +, א—ֵ Ezr 6:8 +, 3 mpl. לֶהֱוֹן Ezr 6:10 + 6 times, 3 fpl. לֶהֶוְיָן Dn 5:17; Imv. mpl. הֱווֹ Ezr 4:22, הֲווֹ 6:6;—
come to pass Dn 2:28, 29(×2), 45.

come into being, arise Ezr 7:23; become, come to be, c.n.pred. Dn 4:24; 5:29 and (= represent) 7:23; c. כְּ like 2:35a, c. ל pred. v 35b, c. adj. pred. Ezr 6:6, c. adv. phr. 5:5 Dn 4:22; often periphrast., c. pt.: יְדִיעַ לה׳ let it become known 3:18 Ezr 4:12, 13; 5:8; so let it be given 6:8, 9, also 7:26 Dn 2:20.
be, as copula, c. adj. pred. Dn 2:40, 42; 7:19; so very often in periphrast. conj. c. pt., ה׳ צָבֵא wish 5:19(×4), חָזֵה ה׳ behold 2:31, 34; 7:2, 4, 6 +, etc

m. הִיא 7 f. pron. of 3 s. he, she, it (= BH הוּא, הִיא; Zinj. and Palm. (once) הא, Palm. (usually) Nab. Egyptian Aramaic הו, f. הי, Lzb257, S-CPap. A 1, 12 +; A 4, C 9 +. The pl. is אִנּוּן, q.v.);—he, she, it, Dn 2:21 וְהוּא מְהַשְׁנֵא … and he will change, etc., v 22, 44; 6:5; 7:7, 24 Ezr 5:8; Dn 2:32 הוּא צַלְמָא that image (nom. pend.); 4:19 אַנְתָּה הוּא thou art it. Resuming the subj. with emph. (BH 2 b) 2:47; 6:17; resuming the subj. in predication (ib. 3 b) 2:20 חָכְמְתָא וּגְבוּרְתָּא דִּי־לֵהּ הִיא it is his, v 28. Anticipating the subj. (ib. 4 a) 2:9 הֲדָא הִיא דָֽתְכוֹן; with a pron. (ib. 4 b) 2:38 אַנְתְּה הוּא … thou art the head of gold 5:13; 3:15 מַן הוּא אֱלָהּ … who is the good …? (so pl. אִנּוּן Ezr 5:4); 4:27 הֲלָא דָא הִיא … (ib. 4 b γ); 6:27 דִּי הוּא … who is … (ib. 2 c), Ezr 6:15 (so דִּי אִנּוּן … Dn 7:17). [cf. in 𝔗 Ex 14:25; 15:11 2 S 20:19; 24:17 ψ 43:2; 63:4; 66:3 +.] Affirming existence (BH 6 b) Dn 4:21. cf. K§ 87, 3. הוּבַד v. [אֲבַד].
n.m. palace, temple (Assyrian loan-word; BH; also Palm. היכלא and הכלא Lzb 259 SAC 43);—emph. הֵיכְלָא Ezr 4:14 +; cstr. הֵיכַל Dn 4:26; sf. הֵיכְלִי 4:1, -לֵהּ 6:19;—
palace of king Dn 4:1, 26; 5:5; 6:19 Ezr 4:14 (v. מְלַח).
temple:
in Jerusalem Dn 5:2, 3 Ezr 5:14a, 15; 6:5(×2).
in Babylon 5:14b, c. הַיְתִי v. אֲתָא.
vb. go (BH; 𝔗; Syriac only Pa.);—

syncop. (so 𝔗 D§ 70, 9, Egyptian Aramaic Cooke 209, Impf. S-C D 22, G 25, 28) go, of men: Impf. 3 ms. וִיהַךְ (K§ 44 a; al. וִיהָךְ) Ezr 6:5, יְהָֽךְ 5:5 of inanimate things, 7:13 people; Inf. לִמְהַךְ (K l.c.; al. ךְ—ָ) v 13.
Pt. מְהַלֵּךְ walking about Dn 4:26 (עַל loc.).
id.: Pt. pl. מַהְלְכִין 3:25 (בְּגוֹא); fig. 4:34 walk in pride (? read Pa. in these).
(K§ 57 α)) n.[m.] toll;—Ezr 4:13, 20; 7:24.

(Ezr), הִמּוֹן3 (Dn), pron. 3 pl. they, them (= BH הֵם, הֵמָּה, q.v., but the more original forms. Egyptian Aramaic המו CIS 145 B 4 (Cooke 207), 149 A 1, S-CPap. C 7, 10 +; not 𝔗 Syriac, which use אִנּוּן, ܐܶܢܽܘܢ, ܗܶܢܽܘܢ, instead; Arabic هُمُ, هُمْ. The n in הִמּוֹן, as in דֵּין, אִלֵּין, by the side of זֶה, אֵלֶּה, أُولَآءِ; NöM 86 WCG 106);—they, them:
as nom. Ezr 5:11 אֲנַחְנָא הִמּוֹ עַבְדוֹהִי we are his servants (constr. as in Syriac, Nö§ 312 D Mt 5:13, K§ 87. 3).

as accus. (in Biblical Aramaic, as in Syriac, there being no verbal sf. of 3 pl.; so Egyptian Aramaic Cooke 76 B 4, S-CPap. E 5 +), Dn 2:34 והדקת הִמּוֹן and crushed them, v 35 3:22 Ezr 4:10, 23; 5:5, 12, 14(×2), 15; 7:17.—Comp. אִנּוּן.

Qr (Kt המינכָא, also [Gi] המוניכא, etc.) n.[m.] chain, necklace (Talm. הַמְנִכָּא DWB 108; Syriac ܗܰܡܢܺܝܟܳܐ; loan-word from Gk. μανιάκης K§ 64, 4; or < Pers. hämyān, girdle [dimin. would be hamyānak] (whence also Gk. μαν., Bev Dr Dn 5:7) AndrM 60 (reading הַמְיָנְֽכָא); v. also Behrm ix Lag Ges Abh. 40; Arm. Stud. 1420; v. Krauss 5 f. (who cp. also Talm. מוּנְיָיק, מָנְיָיק necklace, bracelet, Levy NHWB iii. 52 b, 158 b D 230));—of gold, Dn 5:7, 16, 29.
conj. if, whether (BH הֵן, q.v.: Zenj. Egyptian Aramaic (S-CPap. A 7 +), Palm. Nab. הן, Mand. הין if [𝔗OJon use אם, 𝔗Jer אין, Syriac ܐܶܢ]);—
if, Dn 2:6; 3:15, 17; 4:24; 5:16 Ezr 4:13; 16; 5:17, הֵן לָא … Dn 2:5, 9; 3:15; v 18 הֵן לָ֔א if not.
repeated, הֵן … הֵן sive … sive, whether … or (cf. BH אִם, 1 b I), Ezr 7:26 (so Palm. Tariff ii. c. 19).
in indirect question, whether (cf. אִם, 2 b), Ezr 5:17b יִתְבַּקַּר … הֵן אִיתַי ….—Vid. also לָהֵן.
etc., v. סלק Haph. הַנְעֵל v. [עֲלַל].
(√ of foll., 𝔗 הַרְהֵר, NH הִרְהֵר reflect, brood impurely DWB 112; Syriac ܗܰܪܗܰܪ is injure, irritate, quarrel PS).
n.[m.] fancy, imagining;—pl. abs. הַרְהֹרִין Dn 4:2 fancies (in dream).

conj. and (BH וְ), used mostly as in Heb., except that there is no ו ‘consecutive’;—and, connecting both words (Dn 2:5) and sentences (ib.). When three or more words are connected together, וְ may connect them all (Dn 2:6, 10; 4:34; 5:18), or only the two last (2:17; 3:4; 4:4 Ezr 6:9), or the three last (Dn 2:37; 3:21), or be omitted altogether (2:27; 5:11, cf. 3:2 Ezr 4:9). וְ also connects vbs., in cases where BH would use וַ ·, as Dn 4:2; 5:29; 6:17, 25; in such cases a pf. is often followed by a ptcp., as Dn 2:7 עֲנוֹ וְאָֽמְרִין, so v 10; 3:9, 16, 24 +, hence in 2:5, 8, 15, 20 and often read prob. with Nö GGA 1884, 1021 עֲנָה וְאָמַר (for עָנֵה). Special senses:—
and that Dn 4:10, 12, 20; Ezr 6:8, 9 (cf. Dn 2:16, 18); and also Dn 6:29; = with, 7:1.
connecting contrasted ideas, but Dn 2:6; 3:6, 18; 4:4.
= and so, Dn 2:49; 6:2, especially after imv. 2:4, 9, 24, or impf. 2:7.
to express an intention Dn 5:2 וְיִשְׁתּוֹן that they might drink: after a command, etc., even with ptcp. or perf., nearly = that, 2:13; 6:2 (cf. K§ 102).
introducing the pred. (cf. BH 5 c), Dn 7:20 וְקִרְנָא דִכֵּן וְעַיְנִין לַהּ and this horn, it had eyes; but the case is isolated, and del. prob. וְ with Marti.
v. [זוּעַ].
vb. buy, gain (𝔗 id., buy, Syriac ܙܒܰܢ Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. זבן (often) Lzb266 SAC47, cf. Assyrian zibânîtu, scales);—
Pt. act. pl. זָבְֽנִין Dn 2:8 time ye (are seeking to) gain.
vb.
Pt. pass. pl. זְהִירִין Ezr 4:22 be warned (𝔗 Syriac, cf. BH II. [זָהַר] Hiph. warn).
vb. be presumptuous (𝔗J; v. BH [זִיד, זוּד]);—
Inf. לַהֲזָדָה Dn 5:20 act presumptuously.
vb. feed (𝔗 זוּן; Syriac ܙܳܢ; cf. BH);—
be fed: Impf. יִתְּזִין (K§ 45, 1 d); so in Syriac WCG 254 NöLCB, 1896, 703) Dn 4:9, מִן of source.
(K§ 15 a) n.[m.] food (𝔗 Syriac);—abs. מ׳ Dn 4:9, 18.
vb. tremble (𝔗 Syriac: cf. BH);—
Pt. pl. זָֽאֲעִין Kt, Qr זיְעִין; מִן־קֳדָם pers., Dn 5:19; 6:27.

n.m. brightness, splendour (𝔗 id., Syriac ܕܟܺܝ, perhaps loan-word from Assyrian zîmu, chiefly of countenance, DlWB 252: Pr 152 NöZMG xl (1886), 732 JenZK ii. 43 BrockLex. Syriac 93);—sf. זִיוִי Dn 4:33 splendour of royalty; זִיוֵהּ 2:31 (of image); pl. brightness of countenance: sf. זִיוַי 7:28, זיויך Kt, זִיוָךְ Qr, 5:10, זִיוֹ֫הִי 5:6, 9.

(K§ 61, 4) n.f. purity, innocence (cf. BH זָכָה, also 𝔗 דְּכָא, Syriac ܙܟܳܐ be clean (Arabic ܙܺܝܘܳܐ is be bright (of fire), acute (of mind), etc.), or Arabic ذَكَا be pure, good, 𝔗 זְכָא, Syriac ܙܟܳܐ be pure, innocent; are these forms with ז secondary? or ancient ‖?);—abs. ז׳ Dn 6:23 innocence in God’s sight.
n.pr.m. prophet (BH id.), Ezr 5:1; 6:14.

n.m. Dn 3:7 time (prob. loan-word from OPers. zrvan, zarvâna, time, age, NöM 152Scheft45; cf. BH (late); and (on change of v [b] to m) FräZA iii. 52; Nab. זמן, Palm. (Nab.) זבן Lzb 266. 268 SAC 48. 49);—abs. ז׳ Dn 2:16; 7:12; emph. זִמְנָא Ezr 5:3 +; pl. abs. Dn 6:11 +, emph. זִמְנַיָּא Dn 2:21;—time: specified time Dn 2:16; appointed time 7:12, 22, cf. 2:21; בֵּהּ זִמְנָא at that time Ezr 5:3; Dn 3:7, 8; 4:33; (festival) seasons 7:25; time, occurrence, 6:11, 14 three times in the day.
vb. denom.
agree together (𝔗);—Pf. 2 mpl. Dn 2:9 Qr הִזְדַּמִּנְתּוּן (D 211, 2nd ed. 263 M§ 12 a; Kt Haph. הַזְמִנְתּוּן v. 𝔗 Onk Ex 5:14 D (2) 263, 403), sq. Inf. לְמֵאמַר.
n.[m.] music (cf. BH I. [זָמַר]);—emph. זְמָרָא Dn 3:5, 7, 10, 15.
n.m. singer;—pl. emph. זַמָּרַיָּא Ezr 7:24.
n.[m.] kind, sort (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH);—pl. cstr. זְנֵי זְמָרָא Dn 3:5, 7, 10, 15.
vb. cry, call (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. ז׳ Dn 6:21 (ב of voice).
(𝔗 Syriac, be small; BH זְעֵיר √ זער; Egyptian Aramaic זער Cooke 213, Nab. זעירא, Palm. זערא Lzb 268 SAC 49).
adj. little, small;—fs. קֶרֶן זְעֵירָה Dn 7:8.
vb. raise, lift up (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH (late; rare));—
Pt. pass. וּזְקִיף יִתְמְחֵא עֲל֑וֹהִי Ezr 6:11 and, lifted up, he be fastened upon it (sc. the timber erected; ref. prob. to impalement, v. Ryle Berthol).
n.pr.m. (BH id.);—Ezr 5:2.
n.[m.] seed (cf. BH I. זרע);—cstr. ז׳ אֲנָשָׁא Dn 2:43 seed (offspring) of men.
vb.
destroy, hurt (v. BH II. חבל);—Pf. 3 mpl. sf. חַבְּלוּנִי Dn 6:23 (of lions); Imv. mpl. sf. חַבְּלוּהִי 4:20 (sf. of tree); Inf. לְחַבָּלָה Ezr 6:12 (acc. of temple).
be destroyed: Impf. 3 fs. לָא תִּתְחַבַּל Dn 2:44; 6:27; 7:14 (-בַּ֑ל; all of kingdom of God).
n.m. Dn 6:24 hurt, injury;—abs. ח׳ Dn 3:25; 6:24, cf. RÉS 362 A 2; emph. חֲבָלָא Ezr 4:22.
n.f. hurtful act, crime;—abs. ח׳ Dn 6:23.
n.m. fellow, comrade (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH);—pl. sf. חַבְרוֹ֫הִי Dn 2:13, 17, 18.
n.f. fellow;—pl. sf. חַבְרָתַ֑הּ Dn 7:20 its fellows (in vision of horns).
n.pr.m. prophet (BH id.);—Ezr 5:1; 6:14.
v. אחד.
n.f. joy (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH II. חדה);—abs. בְּח׳ Ezr 6:16 with joy.
n.m. breast (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH II. חזה);—du. (SchulthZAW xxii (1902), 164) sf. חֲדוֹ֫חִי Dn 2:32.
adj. new (𝔗 Syriac; BH חדשׁ);—ח׳ Ezr 6:4.
(√ of following; 𝔗 חוּד, חוּדִיתָא, riddle, v. BH and K§ 57 b) a)).
n. f. riddle;—fpl. abs. אֲחִידָן Dn 5:12.
vb. Pa. Haph. (M§ 65 c) declare (𝔗 Syriac; BH III. [חָוָה] (late));—
c. acc. פִּשְׁרָא (or equiv.): Impf. 3 ms. sf. יְחַוִּנַּ֫נִי (sf. pers. indir. obj.) Dn 5:7; יְחַוִּנַּהּ 2:11 (קֳדָם pers.); 1 s. אֲחַוֶּה 2:24 (ל pers.), 1 pl. נְחַוֶּה v 4.

usually c. acc. פִּשְׁרָא (or equiv.): Impf. 3 ms. יְהַחֲוֶה Dn 5:12; 2 mpl. תְּהַחֲוֹן 2:6, sf. (of indir. obj.) תְּהַחֲוֻנַּ֫נִי v 9; 1 pl. נְהַחֲוֶה v 7; Imv. mpl. sf. (of indir. obj.) הַחֲוֹ֑נִי v 6; Inf. לְהַחֲוָיָה v 10 5:15; + ל pers. 2:16, 27; c. acc. of signs and wonders 3:32.
n.f. a declaring (proposes Inf. Aph., K§ 60, 1));—cstr. אַחֲוָיַת אֲחִידָן Dn 5:12 the declaring of riddles (cf. לְהַגִּיד הַחִידָה Ju 14:14f., Bev).
vb. repair (foundations);—
Impf. 3 mpl. יַחִ֫יטוּ Ezr 4:12 (si vera l. [NöGGA, 1884, 1018 Str§ 13 b
adj. white (𝔗 Syriac; BH I. [חָוַר]);—Dn 7:9 (robe).
vb. see, behold (v. BH);—

Pf. 3 ms. ח׳ Dn 4:20; 7:1; 2 ms. חֲזַ֫יְתָ 2:43 +, -תָה 2:41(×2); 1 s. חֲזֵית v 26 +; 2 mpl. חֲזֵיתוּן 2:8; Pe. Inf. לְמֶחֱזֵא֑ Ezr 4:14; Pt. act. חָזֵה Dn 2:31 + 14 times; pl. חָזַ֫יִן 3:27; 5:23; pass. חֲזֵה 3:19;—
see, have sense of sight Dn 5:23.
see, behold:
acc. pers. 3:25, c. ל v 27, acc. rei 5:5.
see, witness dishonour of king (acc.) Ezr 4:14.

usually behold in dream or vision (often pt. in periphrast. conj.), acc. pers., Dn 4:20, acc. rei 2:41(×2), 43; 4:17, abs. 2:34; 7:4, 7, 9, 11(×2), 21, + אֲלוּ 2:31; 4:7, 10, אֲרוּ 7:2, 6, 13; c. obj. cl. 2:8, 45; behold a dream, acc. חֵלֶם, 2:26; 4:2, 6, 15; 7:1.
pass. = customary (seemly) Dn 3:19 (so 𝔗 Lv 5:10 al., v. Dr).
n.m. vision, appearance;—emph. חֶזְוָא (K§ 55, 6 b)) Dn 2:19; sf. -וִי 7:2, -וִהּ v 20; pl. cstr. חֶזְוֵי 2:28 +;—
vision (as mode of revelation) 2:19 (ח׳ דִּי לֵילְיָא), 7:2, so 7:7, 13, ח׳ רֵישָׁא 2:28; 4:2, 7, 10; 7:1, 15, ח׳ חֶלְמָא 4:6 (GieGGA, 1895, 598 reads אֲחַוֵּא I will relate).
appearance 7:20.
K§ 55, 6 b) 2; read perhaps -וּת K§ 61, 4 b). Anm.] n.f. sight, visibility (v. SchulthZAW xxii (1902), 165 f.);—sf. חֲזוֹתֵהּ Dn 4:8, 17.
n. [m.] sin (v. BH חטא);—sf. חֲטָיָךָ Dn 4:24 (Qr חֲטָאָךְ K§ 57 a) β)), < pl. (for חַטְיָיךְ) Hi Bev Kmp Behrm, cf. ‖ עֲוַיָּתָךְ.
n.f. sin-offering (BH חַטָּאת 4; Nab. חטיאת penalty, according to SAC 51);—abs. ח׳ Ezr 6:17 Kt, Qr חַטָּאָה.
vb. live (v. BH חָיָה);—
Imv. לְעָֽלְמִין חֱיִי live for ever! Dn 2:4; 3:9; 5:10; 6:7, 22.
Pt. מַחֵא (K§ 11, 3 b) γ) HptKmp. Dn. 28) Dn 5:19 let live.
adj. living (BH id.);—
of God: cstr. חַי Dn 4:31, emph. חַיָּא 6:21, 27; men, pl. emph. חַיַּיָּא the living 2:30; 4:14 (חַי עָֽלְמָא).
pl. as n. abstr. life (BH חַיִּים): חַיִּין 7:12; cstr. חַיֵּי Ezr 6:10.

n.f. beast (BH ii. חַיָּה);—abs. א—ָ Dn 4:13, ה—ָ 7:5, 7; emph. חֵיוְתָא 7:6, 11, 19, 23, and (coll.) 4:11, 12; 5:21; cstr. (coll.) חֵיוַת בָּרָא 2:38; 4:9, 18, 20, 22, 29; pl. abs. חֵיוָן 7:3, emph. חֵיוָתָא 7:7, 12, 17.
n.m. power, strength, army (v. BH II. חול, חיל);—
power: abs. בְּאֶדְרָע וְחָ֑יִל Ezr 4:23 by force and power; קרא בְח׳ i.e. call loudly Dn 3:4, בְּחַיִל 4:11; 5:7; גִּבָּרֵי־ח׳ 3:20 mighty men of power.
force, army, sf. חַיְלֵהּ 3:20; cstr. חֵיל שְׁמַיָּא 4:32 (= BH צְבָא הַשָּׁמַיִם).
n.m. wise man (v. BH חכם);—pl. abs. חַכִּימִין Dn 2:21; elsewhere of the class possessed of occult learning in Bab. v 27, emph. -מַיָּא v 13; 5:15; cstr. -מֵי 2:12, 14 + 7 times Dn.

n.f. wisdom;—ח׳ abs. Dn 2:30 +, emph. חָכְמְתָא Dn 2:20 +, cstr. חָכְמֶת 5:11; Ezr 7:25;—wisdom, attrib. of God Dn 2:20; of gods 5:11; of man 2:30; of God imparted to man Ezr 7:25 (practical wisdom), Dn 2:21; = occult knowledge (v. foregoing) imparted to men v 23; 5:11, 14.

n.m. Dn 4:2 dream (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH חֲלוֹם, √ II. חלם);—abs. ח׳ Dn 4:2; 7:1; emph. חֶלְמָא 2:4 +; sf. הֶלְמִי 4:6, -מָךְ 2:28; pl. חֶלְמִין 5:12;—dream, as vehicle or revelation Dn 2:4 + 10 times, 4:3 + 6 times, 5:12; to prophet 7:1.
vb. pass (over) (v. BH);—
c. עַל pers. pass over one (of time): Impf. 3 mpl. יַחְלְפוּן Dn 4:13, 20, 22, 29.
n.[m.] portion, possession, lot (v. BH);—abs. ח׳ possession in land Ezr 4:16; sf. חֲלָקֵהּ Dn 4:12, 20, i.e. his appointed lot.
n.f. class, division, of priests and Levites (BH מַחֲלֹקֶת);—pl. sf. מַחְלְקָֽתְהוֹן Ezr 6:18.
v. יחם.
n.m. wine (𝔗 Syriac; BH חֶמֶר (poet. and late), √ I. חמר);—abs. ח׳ Ezr 6:9; 7:22; emph. חַמְרָא Dn 5:1, 2, 4, 23.
n.f. wheat (v. BH חִטָּה, √ חָנַט; NöLCB, 1896, 703 cp. Egyptian chnt; Old Aramaic has חטה, pl. חטי, Plam. חטא Lzb 279 SAC 51);—pl. חִנְטִין Ezr 6:9; 7:22.
n.f. dedication (𝔗; BH id., √ חנך);—cstr. חֲנֻכַּת, of image Dn 3:2, 3; temple Ezr 6:16, 17.
vb. shew favour (v. BH);—
Inf. c. acc. pers. מִחַן (K§ 46, 3 a) Dn 4:24 (cf. BH Pōʿ. Pr 14:21).
implore favour (of God; so BH Hithp.), Pt. מִתְחַנֵּן Dn 6:12.
n.pr.m. (= BH id. 5);—Dn 2:17.
vb.

take possession of (Syriac be strong, overcome; 𝔗 be strong, take possession of; Egyptian Aramaic Haph. החסן hold property S-C D 2 +, cf. BH חסן);—Pf. 3 mpl. הֶחֱסִ֫נוּ (K§ 38, 3 Kmp ad loc.) Dn 7:22; Impf. 3 mpl. יַחְסְנוּן (K§ 38, 1 b) v 18 (perhaphs point -סִנוּן).
n.m. (royal) power;—emph. חִסְנָא Dn 2:37; sf. חִסְנִי 4:27.

n.[m.] clay, potsherd (𝔗 id.; Chr-Pal. ܚܣܦܐ clay vessel, ܚܨܒܢܐ pl. potsherds Schulth 68, Syriac ܚܶܨܦܳܐ potsherd; 𝔗 חַצְבָא, NH חָצָב clay vessel; Assyrian ḫaṣbu, id.; ܚܨܰܦ jar (PS 1238), whence Arabic خَزَفٌ pottery Frä 169, but Sab. חסף jar, according to HomZMG xlvi (1892), 532; cf. Ethiopic ܚܶܙܒܳܐ: jar (transp.; Di 1265); v. BH [חַסְפַּם]);—ח׳ abs. Dn 2:41 (ח׳ דִּי פֶּחָר), חֲסַ֑ף v 33, 42; cstr. ח׳ טִינָא v 41, 43; emph. חַסְפָּא v 34, 35, 43, 45.
adj. lacking, wanting, deficient (cf. BH חָסֵר);—ח׳ Dn 5:27.
vb.
shew insolence, harshness (NH חצף Hiph. act insolently, so 𝔗 Aph.; Syriac ܚܳܫܰܚ be audacious);—Pt. f. מַחְצְפָה (K§ 33, 2 e)) Dn 3:22 overbearing (of command), מְהַחְצְפָה 2:15 harsh (id.).
vb. be waste (v. BH II. חרב);—
Pf. הָחָרְבַ֑ת Ezr 4:15 city was laid waste.
n.m. magician (BH id., √ I. חרט);—abs. Dn 2:10; pl. abs. חַרְטֻמִּין 2:27; 5:11; emph. -מַּיָּא 4:4, 6.
vb. singe (𝔗 Syriac; NH חָרַךְ);—
Pf. 3 ms. הִתְחָרַךְ be singed Dn 3:27 (hair).
n.[m.] loin (v. BH חָלָץ, √ II. [חָלַץ]);—sf. חַרְצֵהּ Dn 5:6 the joints of his loin (v. קְטַר).
vb. think, account (v. BH);—
Pt. pass. pl. כְּלָה חֲשִׁיבִין Dn 4:32 like those not accounted of, of no account, Bev Dr.
vb. need (Assyrian h̬ašâh̬u, crave; Syriac ܚܫܰܚܬܳܐ in need of; not 𝔗);—
Pt. pl. חָֽשְׁחִין Dn 3:16, sq. Inf. (van d. H., wrongly, חַשׁ׳).
n.f. thing needed (Syriac ܚܫܰܚܬܳܐ; Nö in K p. 175);—pl. חַשְׁחָן Ezr 6:9.
n.f.coll. things needed, requirement (Syriac id.);—cstr. חַשְׁחוּת בֵּית אֱלָהָךְ Ezr 7:20.
(v. BH חֹשֶׁךְ darkness, √ חשׁך).
n.[m.] darkness;—emph. חֲשׁוֹכָא Dn 2:22.

vb. shatter by a blow (Assyrian h̬ašâlu, shatter, perhaps thresh; NH חָשַׁל Pi. shatter: JAram. חֲשַׁל forge, hammer, Syriac ܚܫܰܠ forge, furbish; Buhl14 cp. 𝔗 חוּשְׁלָא barley-groats (as pounded, beaten), and perhaps Assyrian h̬ušlu, barley; NöM 135 cp. Arabic حَسَلَ thrust, drive away (Frey), 𝔗 נַחְשׁוֹל storm(y sea; cf. in Eng. beaten, buffetted by waves; Assyrian loan-word Ba ZA ii. 117), Syriac ܡܰܚܫܽܘܠ id.);—
Pt. act. חָשֵׁל Dn 2:40 (acc. rei).
vb. seal (v. BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. sf. (of stone) חַתְמַהּ Dn 6:18 (ב instr.).
vb. be good (𝔗 Syriac, v. BH טוֹב);—
Pf. 3 ms. ט׳, c. עַל pers. Dn 6:24 it was good to him = he was glad (cf. בְּאֵשׁ v 15).
adj. good;—abs. ט׳ Dn 2:32 pure gold; = pleasing to (עַל pers.) Ezr 5:17 (cf. 6:18, BH טוֹב 5).
n.m. guardsman (v. BH id.; √ טבח);—pl. emph. טַבָּחַיָּא Dn 2:14.
n.m. mountain (𝔗 Syriac Nab., SAC 58; BH צוּר, √ V. צור);—abs. ט׳ Dn 2:35; emph. טוּרָא v 45.
adv. fastingly, hungrily (Syriac ܛܘܳܬ id.; PS 1455; on etym. cf. Schulth Hom. Wurz. 32 f.; on adv. force of f. term. ת—ָ, v. Nö§ 155 A, M 201 WCG 135; and cf. רַבַּת ψ 124:3);—Dn 6:19.
n.[m.] clay (𝔗 id.; NH טִינָֹה, Syriac ܛܺܝܢܳܐ, Arabic طِينٌ (yet v. Frä8));—emph. חֲסַף מִינָא Dn 2:41, 43.
n.[m.] dew (v. BH I. טלל);—cstr. טַל שְׁמַיָּא Dn 4:12, 20, 22, 30; 5:21.
vb.
have shade (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH III. [צָלַל]);—Impf. 3 fs. תַּטְלֵל Dn 4:9 (beasts under tree).
vb.
feed (Pe. proposes taste, v. BH);—Impf. 3 mpl., acc. of grass + ל pers.: יְמַעֲמוּן Dn 4:22, 29, so (sf. pers.) יְטַעֲמוּנֵהּ 5:21.

n.m. Ezr 4:21 taste, judgment, command (BH טַ֫עַם (late sense));—abs. ט׳ Dn 3:10 +, cstr. ט׳ 5:2 Ezr 6:14, טַ֫עַם (of God, mere scribal distinction Nö LCB 1896, 305 Str§ 8 c KAramaismen 40) Ezr 6:14; 7:23; emph. מַעְמָא 4:21 +;—
Dn 5:2 in the taste of the wine (while they were enjoying it).
judgment, discretion, in reply, הֲתִיב עֵטָא וּט׳ Dn 2:14 (Pr 26:16); in act (pers.) שִׂים ט׳ על Dn 3:12; 6:14 shew proper deference to (עַל).
report (of official), c. הלך Ezr 5:5, יהב Dn 6:3.
command, of God Ezr 6:14; 7:23, of king 6:14; שִׂים ט׳ give command, issue decree Dn 3:10 + 3 times, Ezr 4:19, 21(×2) + 11 times; בְּעֵל ט׳ commander Ezr 4:8, 9, 17.
n.m. nail, claw (𝔗 טוּפְרָא, Syriac ܝܰܓܪܳܐ; v. BH צִפֹּ֫רֶן, √ IV. צפר);—pl. sf. of man טִפְר֫וֹהִי Dn 4:30; of beast, טפריה (K§ 53, 2. b)) 7:19, Qr טִפְרַהּ.
vb. chase away (v. BH);—
Pt. act. pl. טָֽרְדִין, ל acc. pers. + מִן pers. Dn 4:22, 29. Peʿîl Pf. 3 ms. טְרִיד (WCG 224), subj. pers. + מִן 4:30; 5:21.

n.pr. gent. so most, Ezr 4:9 (AndreasM 64 a title; Hoffm ZA ii. 55 cp. Pers. taraparda, i.e. beyond the bridge; < Scheft86 cp. OIran. tarapâra, beyond the shore [= transriparii id.MGWJ 47, 316] transl. of עֲבַר נַהֲרָא).
vb.
bear along, carry (v. BH);—Pf. 3 ms. הֵיבֵל, acc. rei + ל loc. Ezr 5:14; 6:5; Inf. לְחֵיבָלָה 7:15, acc. rei.
n.f. earth (so Syriac; 𝔗 as BH יַבָּשָׁה dry land, √ יָבֵשׁ);—emph. יַבֶּשְׁתָּא Dn 2:10.
n.[m.] (stone-) heap (𝔗 id.; Syriac ܝܰܓܪܳܐ; cf. Ethiopic ወገረ: throw together, ወግር: mound);—cstr. י׳ שָֽׂהֲדוּתָא Gn 31:47 (= Heb. גַּל־עֵד).
n.f. Dn 5:2; hand (v. BH);—cstr. י׳ Ezr 5:12 +; emph. יְדָא Dn 5:5, 24; sf. יְדִי 3:15, יְדָךְ v 17, יְדֵהּ Ezr 6:12, יֶדְהֹם (K§ 53, 2. a)) 5:8, etc.; du. abs. בִּידַ֫יִן Dn 2:34, 45;—
hand of man Dn 2:34, 45 Ezr 5:8; 6:12, and (in vision) Dn 5:5(×2), 24; fig. בִּידָךְ in thy possession Ezr 7:14, 25; fig. of God Dn 4:32.
power, of man Dn 2:38; 3:15, 17; 7:28 Ezr 5:12, of God Dn 5:23; of lion 6:28 (al. paw).
vb.
praise (v. BH ידה);—Pt. act. מְהוֹדֵא Dn 2:23 (ל dei), מוֹדֵא (K§§ 33, 2; 43, 1. c.) 6:11 (קֳדָם dei).
vb. know (v. BH);—

Pf. 3 ms. י׳ Dn 5:21; 6:11, 2 ms. יְדַ֫עְתָּ 5:22, 1 s. יִדְעֵת 4:6; Impf. 2 ms. תִּנְדַּע (K§ 11, 4. b) δ) Ezr 4:15 +, etc.; Imv. דַּע ms. (K§11, 3 α)) Dn 6:16; Pt. act. יָדַע 2:8 +; pl. יָֽדְעִין 5:23, etc.; pass. יְדִיעַ Ezr 4:12 +;—know, c. acc. rei Dn 2:30; 5:22, acc. rei om. Ezr 7:25; יָֽדְעֵי דָּתֵי א׳ v 25, יָֽדְעֵי בִינָה Dn 2:21; c. obj. cl. v 8, 9, 22; 4:6, 14, 23, 29; 5:21; 6:11, 16; Ezr 4:15, so (of God) Dn 4:22; pt. act. abs. 5:23 having capacity of knowledge; pass. in periphr. conjug., subj. cl. + ל pers. 3:18 Ezr 4:12, 13; 5:8.

Pf. 3 ms. הוֹדַע Dn 2:15 +, sf. הוֹדְעָךְ v 29, 2 ms. sf. הוֹדַעְתַּ֫נִי v 23, -תֶּ֑נָא v 23, 1 pl. הוֹדַ֫עְנָא Ezr 4:14; Impf. 3 ms. יְהוֹדַע Dn 2:25, sf. יְהוֹדְעִנַּ֑נִי 7:16, etc. (v. K§ 43 c); Inf. לְהוֹדָעָה 5:8, sf. לְהוֹדָעֻתַ֫נִי 4:15; 5:16, etc.; Pt. act. pl. מְהוֹדְעִין 4:4 +;—cause to know, inform: ל pers. Ezr 4:14, + acc. rei Dn 2:15, 17, 25, 30; 4:4; 5:8, 17, so (sf. pers.) 2:5, 9, 26; 4:3, 15; 5:15, 16; 7:16, and (subj. God) 2:23; ל pers. + obj. cl. Ezr 4:16; 7:24, so (of God) Dn 2:28, 29, 45, and (sf. pers.) v 23; acc. pers. only Ezr 5:10; 7:25.
n. [m.] knowledge, power of knowing (𝔗J id.; Syriac ܡܰܕܥܳܐ, ܡܽܘܕܥܳܐ; BH מַדָּע (late); cf. ‘Mandâ’ = γνῶσις, NöM xx);—abs. Dn 5:12; emph. -דְּעָא 2:21; sf. -דְּעִי 4:31, 33.
vb. give (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. י׳ Ezr 5:12 +; 2 ms. יְהַבְתְּ Dn 2:23; 3 mpl. וִיהַ֫בוּ 3:28; Imv. ms. הַב (K§ 11, 3. a)) 5:17; Pt. act. יָהֵב 2:21, pl. יָֽהֲבִין 6:3;—

give, acc. rei + ל pers. Dn 2:48; 5:17, also (subj. God) 2:21, 23, 37, 38; 5:18, 19; give report 6:3 (ל pers.); give over, acc. pers. + בְּיַד (יַד 2) Ezr 5:12 (subj. God); give up, surrender Dn 3:28 (one’s body, acc.).

place, lay foundations Ezr 5:16 (Nab. also place Cooke 102, l. 6 SACJQ 1904, 274; v. ܝܗܒ 2 SchulthLex.; and ZAW xxii (1902), 162; cf. DWB 171). Peʿîl (WCG 224), be given, subj. rei, c. ל pers.: 3 ms. יְהִיב Dn 7:4, 6, יְהִב v 14, 22, 3 fs. יְהִיבַת 5:28; 7:12, 27; 3 mpl. וִיהִ֫יבוּ Ezr 5:14; be given up (ל of flame) Dn 7:11.
Impf. 3 ms. יִתְיְהֵב Dn 4:13, 3 fs. תִּתְיְהִ֑ב Ezr 6:4; 3 mpl. יִתְיַהֲבוּן Dn 7:25; Pt. מִתְיְהֵב Ezr 4:20; 6:9, fs. מִתְיַהֲבָא v 8, pl. -בין 7:19;—
be given, subj. rei, ל pers., Dn 4:13; Ezr 6:9; 7:19; be given over, subj. pers. בִּידֵהּ (יַד 2) Dn 7:25.
be paid, of cost Ezr 6:4 (מִן of source), v 8 (ל pers.), toll 4:20 (ל pers.).
n.pr.terr. Judah (secondary format. from foll. according to M§ 68. b Buhl; cf. BH יְהוּדָה);—Dn 5:13b; Ezr 5:1, 8; 7:14; בְּנֵי גָלוּתָא דִּי י׳ Dn 2:25; 5:13a; 6:14.
n.gent. Jew (BH יְהוּדִי);—pl. abs. יְהוּדָאִין (K§ 61, 6)) Dn 3:12; emph. יְהוּדָיֵא (Ib.ib.) v 8 Ezr 4:12, 23; 5:1, 5; 6:7(×2), 8, 14. יְהָךְ Ezr 5:5 v. [חֲלַךְ].

n.m. Ezr 6:15 day (v. BH);—abs. י׳ Ezr 6:9(×2), 15, emph. יוֹמָא Dn 6:11, 14; pl. abs. יוֹמִין v 8 +, emph. יוֹמַיָּא 2:28 +; cstr. יוֹמֵי 5:11, and יוֹמָת (K§ 51, 2, Anm. 3) Ezr 4:15, 19; sf. יוֹמֵיהוֹן Dn 2:44;—day, as division of time Dn 6:11, 14, day of month Ezr 6:15; thirty days Dn 6:8, 13; יוֹם בְּיוֹם Ezr 6:9 day by day; pl. especially of duration: עַתִּיק י׳ one aged of days, aged man Dn 7:9, 13, 22; י׳ עָֽלְמָא days of old Ezr 4:15, 19: of a period: life-time, or reign, of king Dn 2:44; 5:11; לִקְצָת י׳ 4:31 at the end of the days (appointed time), בְּאַחֲרִית י׳ 2:28 in the latter part of the (future) days.
n.pr.m. Ezr 5:2 (BH id., √ הָיָה).
v. שֵׁיזֵב.
(√ of foll.; v. BH יָחַם, whence חֵמָה).
n.f. rage;—abs. Dn 3:19, חֲ׳ v 13.
vb. be (good,) pleasing (𝔗; Egyptian Aramaic Haf. הוטב S-CB 11 +; v. BH יטב);—
Impf. יֵיטַב (K§ 43, 2) Ezr 7:18 (עַל pers., + inf.).
(K§ 25. a) β) vb. be able (Dn) (𝔗; Nab. (rare) SAC60; Egyptian Aramaic S-C E 8, 11 +; Chr-Pal. Schulth 83; BH יָכֹל);—Pe.

c. Inf. be able to do: Pf. 3 ms. יְכִל Dn 6:21 (subj. God), 2 ms. יְכֵ֫לְתָּ 2:47; Impf. 3 ms. יוּכַל (Hebraism, K§43, 1. Beisp. b) v 10, יִכֻּל 3:29 (subj. a god), 2 ms. תוכל 5:16(×2) (< both Qr תִּכּוּל, Kl.c.); Pt. יָכִל 3:17; 4:34 (both subj. God); pl. יָֽכְלִין 2:27; 4:15; 6:5.
prevail (BH 2) against (ל), Pt. fs. יָֽכְלָה 7:21.
n.m. sea (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH יָם, √ ימם);—emph. יַמָּא Dn 7:2, 3. יִנְדַּע v. יְדַע.
vb. add (v. BH);—
(WCG 225) Pf. 3 fs. הוּסֲפַת (K§§ 15 d); 17, 1; 43, 1, Beisp. c) Dn 4:33 was added, ל pers.
vb. advise (so JAram.; BH יעץ);—Ithpa. Pf. 3 mpl. אִתְיָעַ֫טוּ (K§§ 23, 1, Anm.; 39, 5) Dn 6:8 recipr. took counsel with each other, sq. inf.
n.m. counsellor (proposes Pt. act.);—pl. sf. יָֽעֲטֹ֫הִי Ezr 7:14, יָעֲט֫וֹהִי v 15.
n.f. counsel;—abs. Dn 2:14 (v. טְעֵם 2).
v. שֵׁיצֵא.
vb. Pa. make certain, gain certainty (𝔗; cf. BH);—
Inf. לְיַצָּבָא Dn 7:19, c. עַל concerning.
adj. certain, true (𝔗 id., firm, native (= אֶזְרָח));—abs. י׳ Dn 2:8, 45, emph. -בָא 3:24 (K§ 59. g); fs. -בָא 6:13; 7:16;—
certain, sure Dn 2:45; in exclam. 3:24 undoubtedly! מִן־יַצִּיב 2:8 of a surety.
true 6:13; f. as subst. 7:16 the truth concerning, עַל rei.
vb. burn (v. BH);—
Pt. act. f. יָקִדְתָּא Dn 3:6, 11, 15, 17, 20, 21, 23, 26.
n.f. burning;—cstr. לִיקֵדַת אֶשָּׁה Dn 7:11.
n.m. Dn 2:6 honour (v. BH);—abs. וִיקָר Dn 2:6; 7:14; cstr. id. 4:27, לִיקַר v 33 (K§ 57. Anm. Str -קָר); emph. וִיקָרָא 2:37; 5:18, ה—ָ v 20.
adj. honourable, difficult;—
honourable, emph. יַקִּירָא Ezr 4:10.
difficult (cf. BH כָּבֵד adj. 1 d), fs. יַקִּירָה Dn 2:11.
n.pr.loc. Jerusalem (BH יְרוּשָׁלַםִ);—Dn 5:2, 3; 6:11; Ezr 4:8, 12 + 20 times Ezr.
n.m. month (v. BH);—abs. לִירַח אֲדָר Ezr 6:15; pl. abs. יַרְחִין Dn 4:26.
n.f. thigh, or loin (𝔗; v. BH ירך);—pl. sf. יַרְכָתֵהּ Dn 2:32.
n.pr.gent. Israel (BH id., √ I. שָׂרָה);—אֱלַהּ יִשׁ׳ Ezr 5:1; 6:14; 7:15; מֶלֶךְ לְיִשׂ׳ 5:11; בְּנֵי יִשׂ׳ 6:16, עַמָּא יִשׂ׳ 7:13.
n.pr.m. (BH id. 3, p. 221);—Ezr 5:2.
(√ of following; BH ישׁן, שֵׁנָה).
n.f. sleep (𝔗 Syriac);—sf. שִׁנְּתֵהּ (K§ 12 d)), var. שִׁנְתֵּהּ Dn 6:19.—i. [שְׁנָה] v. [שְׁנָא].

mark of accus. (= BH I. אֵת; Palm. ית; Zinj. Had. 28 c. sf. ותה; Nab. Palm. c. sf. יתה (Lzb263 Cooke170; cf. RÉS468); 𝔗 Sam. יָת; Syriac ܝܳܬ (rare); v. further p. 84b);—Dn 3:12 דִּי מַנִּיתָ יָֽתְהוֹן whom thou hast appointed.
(K§ 25 a) β)) vb. sit, dwell (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH ישׁב);—Pe
sit, be seated: Pf. 3 ms. יְתִ֑ב Dn 7:9 and (of judgment = the judge) v 10, so Impf. 3 ms. יִתִּ֑ב (K§ 43, 1, Beisp. b), cf. BH יֵשֵׁב) 7:26.
dwell, Pt. pl. abs. יָתְבִין Ezr 4:17 (ב loc.). Haph. cause to dwell: Pf. 3 ms. הוֹתֵב 4:10 (acc. + ב loc.).

adj. pre-eminent, surpassing (v. BH יתר);—ms. abs. י׳ Dn 2:31; fs. יַתִּירָא 6:4, usually ה—ָ 4:33; 5:12, 14; as adv. exceedingly 3:22; 7:7, 19 (cf. יתיר מתבריך EutSin. 498 wh. Lzb 401 reads יתירית בריך).

part. like, as, about (BH כְּ, q.v.);—like, as, Dn 2:40 תַּקִּיפָא כְּפַרְזְלָא, 4:5, 32; 5:11 +; according to 4:32 וּכְמִצְבְּיֵהּ עָבֵד and according to his will he doeth, Ezr 6:9, 18 +; about (as BH 1 a: cf. Zinj. Lzb444 כשלשן מלך[ן]), Dn 4:16 כְּשָׁעָה חֲדָה, 6:1; with inf. (BH 3 b), 6:21 וּכְמִקְרְבֵהּ לְגֻבָּא and as he drew near, etc. Cpds.:—כְּדִי and כִּדְנָה, v. דִּי and דְּנָה; כַּחֲדָה together, v. חַד (sub אחד).
adj. false (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH כזב);—fs. abs. מִלָּה כִדְבָה Dn 2:9 (> n. appos. K 175 M 66*).
v. דִּי.
adv. here (BH כֹּה; 𝔗 Mand. כָּא; Chr-Pal. ܟܐ; Syriac with prefixes, as ܠܟܳܐ hither, ܐܰܝܟܳܐ where?);—Dn 7:28 עַד־כָּה סוֹפָא דִי־מִלְּתָא hitherto (cf. Je 48:47; 51:64) is the end of the matter.
vb. be able (𝔗 id.; Egyptian Aramaic, S-CPap. A 6, 8, 11 +; Ethiopic ክህለ cf. syn. יְכִל);—
Pt. act., usually sq. inf.: abs. כָּהֵל Dn 2:26; 4:15 (inf. om.); pl. abs. כָּֽהֲלִין 5:8, 15.
n.m. priest (v. BH כהן);—emph. כָּהֲנָא Ezr 7:12, 21; pl. emph. -נַיָּא 6:9, 16, 18; 7:16, 24; sf. (of. Isr.) -נ֫וֹהִי v 13.
n.f. window (𝔗 כַּוְּתָא, Syriac ܟܰܘܬܳܐ cf. SchulthLex. 91 (sub ܟܘ), hence Arabic كُوَّة, كَوَّة id., as loan-word Frä 13);—pl. abs. כַּוִּין פְּתִיחָן Dn 6:11 (cf. S-CJ 6).
n.[m.] kôr, a measure of wheat (BH כֹּר p. 499);—pl. abs. כּוֹרִין Ezr 7:22.
n.pr.m. Cyrus (BH id.);—Dn 6:28; Ezr 5:13 + 6 times Ezr.
v. כרר.
v. כלל.
vb. complete (v. BH I. [כָּלַל]; but שַׁכ׳ perhaps loan-word from Assyrian šuklulu, ušaklil, uštaklil, DlWB 331, cf. שֵׁיזִב, שֵׁיצֵא and Buhl14);—

of building: Pf. 3 ms. sf. שַׁכְלְלֵהּ Ezr 5:11 he finished it; 3 mpl. שַׁכְלִלוּ 6:14, also (c. acc. rei) 4:12 (Kt שׁורי אשׁכללו, read Qr) שׁוּרַיָּא שׁ׳; Inf. לְהַשְׁכְּלָלָה, acc. rei 5:3, 9. Ishtaph. be completed, of walls; Impf. 3 mpl. יִשְׁתַּכְלְלוּן 4:13, 16.
n.m. the whole, all (BH כֹּל);—emph. כֹּלָּא Dn 2:40 +, cstr. כֹּל 2:12; 3:2 +, כָּל־ 2:8 +, sf. 3 mpl. כָּלְּהוֹן (so Palm. Lzb296 CookeNo. 117, Tariff ii b. 18) †2:38; 7:19 (Qr f. כַּלְּהֵן);—
כֹּל חַכִּימֵי בָבֶל the whole of (= all) the wise men of B. 3:2, 3, 5, etc.; 6:2 כל־מלכותא the whole of the kingdom, v 4; c. sf. the whole of them 2:38; 7:19.

with a sg. noun, understood collectively, every, any, or with a neg. none (BH 1 b): 3:29 דִּי כָל־עַם אֻמָּה וְלִשָּׁן that every people, nation, and language, etc., 6:8 מִן־כָּל־אֱלָהּ of any god, Ezr 6:12 כָּל־מֶלֶךְ וְעַם; כל אנשׁ די every man who = whoever, Dn 3:10; 5:7; 6:13 Ezr 6:11; Dn 2:10 כל מלך … לא שׁאל no king hath asked …, v 35 4:6; 6:5, 24; so כָּל־דִּי (= Heb. כָּל־אְשֶׁר) whoever 6:8 Ezr 7:26, whatever v 23, בְּכָל־דִּי wherever Dn 2:38 (cf. אֲשֶׁר 4 b γ).

emph. כֹּלָּא, used absolutely, as Heb. הַכֹּל (BH 2 b): Dn 2:40 חָשֵׁל כֹּלָּא crushing all things, 4:9, 18 וּמָזוֹן לְכֹלָּא־בֵּהּ and food for all was in it, v 25 כֹּלָּא מְטָא all came upon N. (cf. הַכֹּל בָּא Jos 21:43), Ezr 5:7 שְׁלָמָא כֹלָּא all peace (K§ 83 d; cf. in Heb. כֻּלּוֹ etc., after their noun: BH 1 d a).—For כָּל־קֳבֵל v. קֳבֵל.

adv. thus, as follows (BH כֵּן; 𝔗 כֵּן, Syriac ܟܶܢ );—usually c. אֲמַר (אָמַר, etc.; cf. Egyptian Aramaic CIS ii. 149 A 1, B–C 3 RÉS 492 B 5), Dn 2:24 וְכֵן אֲמַר־לֵהּ, v 25 4:11; 6:7; 7:5, 23 Ezr 5:3; 6:2 וְכֵן־כְּתִיב בְּגַוַּהּ.

adv. accordingly, as follows (der. uncertain: NöGGA, 1884, 1021 Marti al. from כֵּן + indef. מָא, so somewhat, ungefähr so: v. older improb. view (as we should say, from כְּ and נֵימָא = נֵאמַר, cf. Talm. יֵימָא for יֵימַר) in Thes652): referring backwards, Ezr 6:13 כְּנֵמָא … עֲבַדוּ did accordingly; referring forwards, 4:8 כְנֵמָא כְּתַבוּ … wrote a letter … as follows, 5:4 (read c. 𝔊 אֲמַרוּ; אֲמַרְנָא from v 9, MeyEntst. J. 26), v 9, 11.
vb. gather (𝔗 id.; Old Aramaic Palm. כנש Lzb298; Syriac ܟܢܰܫ; v. also BH [כָּנַס]);—
Inf. לְמִכְנַשׁ, sq. ל acc. pers. Dn 3:2.
Pt. pl. מִתְכַּנְּשִׁין (were) assembled 3:3, 27.

n.m. Ez 4:17 associate (Old Aramaic id., Lzb 298 SAC65; S-CB 6; Syriac ܟܢܳܬ; Chr-Pal. [ܟܢܐ, ܟܢܬ] SchwallyIdiot. 46 SchulthLex. 95; √ appar. כנה K§ 56, α) β2 M-A§ 74 c; Buhl makes loan-wd. from Assyrian kinâtu, ‘Genosse,’ but v. DlWB 338 ZimM p. 66);—associate, pl. sf. בְנָוָתֵהּ Ezr 5:6, -תְהוֹן 4:9, 17, 23; 5:3; 6:6, 13.
(v. BH כִּסֵּא throne).
(K§§ 11, 4 b) ε); 62) n.m. Dn 7:9a throne;—cstr. כ׳ Dn 5:20; sf. כָּרְסְיֵהּ 7:9b; pl. abs. כָּרְסָוָן 7:9a.
v. כַּשְׂדָּי.
n.m. Ezr 7:17 silver (v. BH);—abs. כ׳ Ezr 7:15 +, כְּסֲ֑ף Dn 2:32; emph. כַּסְפָּא v 35 +;—
as material Dn 2:32, 35, 45; 5:2, 4, 23 Ezr 5:14; 6:5.
as money or its equivalent Ezr 7:17, v 15, 16, 18, 22.
v. sub ענה.

vb. bind (𝔗 id.; NH כָּפַת; Syriac ܟܦܰܬ form knots, ܟܪܳܐ twist into a knot, Arabic كَفَتَ draw together, Assyrian [kapâtu] ii. bring together);—Peʿîl Pf. 3 mpl. כְּפִ֫תוּ (WCG 224) Dn 3:21 they were bound.
bind: Inf. לְכַפָתָה Dn 3:20 (ל acc. pers.); Pt. pass. pl. מְכַפִּתִין bound v 23, 24.

vb. Ithpe. be distressed (cf. כַּרְיָא iii. adj. suffering, כְּרִיוּתָא n. id. DWB 197; Syriac ܟܶܪܝܰܬ ܠܝ be short, abridged, ܟܰܪܝܽܘܬܳܐ it grieved me; ܟܪܰܗ pain, grief; cf. Assyrian kûru, pain; also ܟܰܪܒܳܠܬܳܐ (der. spec.) be ill, Arabic كَرِهَ dislike, shrink from);—Pf. 3 fs. אִתְכְּרִיַּת רוּחִי (K§ 47. Beisp. 2) Dn 7:15.

n.f. prob. helmet, cap (> al. mantle, e.g. K§ 62; v. Dr) (NH כַּרְבָּלָה comb of cock; so J.Aram כַּרְבָּלְתָא, Syriac ܟܳܪܘܿܙ; Assyrian karballatu, cap AndrM 67, Muss-ArnAssyrian Dict. 436a; so SACJPhil. xxvi. 310 f., cf. BH [כדבל]);—pl. sf. כַּרְבְּלָֽתְהוֹן Dn 3:21.
