n.m. herald (loan-word from Gk. κήρυξ, κηρύσσειν (K§ 64, 4 Kraussii. 296f.; NöGGA 1884, 1019 doubts); 𝔗 id., Syriac ܟܪܘܙ (v. Brock), Chr-Pal. [ܟܪܙ] SchulthLex. 97; cf. D§ 37 ad fin., also K§ 64, 4 Bev Dn 5:29 M-A§ 88);—emph. כָּרוֹזָא Dn 3:4.
vb. denom.

make proclamation (poss. directly dependent on κῆρυξ (D§ 37, p. 146 (2nd ed. 183) K l.c. M 67), but even then formed as denom.; cf. 𝔗 כְּרַז, NH כָּרַז, Syriac ܟܪܙ Af. Ethpe., so Chr-Pal. SchwallyIdiot. 46 SchulthLex. 97);—Pf. 3 mpl. הַכְרִ֫זוּ Dn 5:29, c. עַל pers. concerning.
v. כסא.
(√ of foll.; cf. BH כרר, כִּכָּר 3).
n.[f.] talent;—pl. abs. כִּכְּרִין Ezr 7:22.

n. pr. gent. Chaldean (v. BH כַּשְׂדִּים);—abs. כ׳ Dn 2:10; emph. כשדיא Dn 5:30 Kt (Qr כַּשְׂדָּאָה), כסדיא Ezr 5:12 Kt (Qr כַּסְדָּאָה); pl. abs. כַּשְׂדָּאִין 3:8; 5:11, emph. כשדיא Kt, כַּשְׂדָּאֵי Qr, Dn 2:5, 10; 4:4; 5:7;—
Chaldean by race Dn 3:8; 5:30; Ezr 5:12.
as learned, of the class of Magi (BH כ׳ 1 c), Dn 2:5, 10(×2); 4:4; 5:7, 11.
vb. write (v. BH);—

Pf. 3 ms. כ׳ Dn 6:26 ל pers. + orat. rect., 7:1 acc. rei; 3 mpl. כְּתַ֫בוּ Ezr 4:8 acc. אִגְּרָה; 1 pl. נִכְתּוּב 5:10, acc. rei; Pt. act. abs. fs. כָּֽתְבָה Dn 5:5, subj. יְדָא, fpl. כָּֽתְבָן v 5, subj. אֶצְבְּעָן. Peʿîl (WCG 224) Pf. 3 ms. כִּדְנָה כְּתִיב Ezr 5:7 thus (it) was written, so כֵּן כ׳ 6:2.
n.m. Dn 5:7 writing;—abs. כְּתָ֑ב Ezr 7:22 (Baer כְּתַב, but v. K§ 57 ad fin. Str); cstr. כ׳ 6:18; emph. כְּתָכָא Dn 5:8 +, ה—ָ 5:7, 15;—
writing, inscription (on wall) Dn 5:7, 8, 15, 16, 17, 24, 25.
written decree 6:9, 10, 11.
written requirement Ezr 6:18; 7:22.
(K§ 54, 3 a) ε) and c)) n.[m.] wall (BH כֹּתֶל, √ כחל);—cstr. כ׳ Dn 5:5; pl. emph. כֻּתְלַיָּא Ezr 5:8.

prep. to, for, in regard to, at, mark of accus. (BA לְ, and general Aramaic);—sf. לִי, לָךְ, לֵהּ, לַהּ Dn 7:4, 5 +; לָנָא †Ezr 4:14; לְכֹם † 5:3, 9; 7:24 (so Egyptian Aramaic S-CPap.II 12, 14 +), לְכוֹן † Dn 3:4; לְהוֹם †Je 10:11, לְהֹם †Ezr 5:3, 4, 9, 10; 6:9 (so Zinj., Cooke 184; Nab., ib.Nos. 85, 91), לְהוֹן †Dn 2:35; 3:14; 6:3; 7:12 (v 21 לְהֹן), Ezr 4:20; 5:2 (so Palm., CookeNo. 110, Tariff ii. c. 15 (p. 329));—

to, after vbs. of saying, declaring, writing, etc., Dn 2:4, 5, 7, 19; 6:21, 26, etc., giving 2:16, 21 +, offering Ezr 6:10; of going (Aramaic does not use אֶל), usually to a place, 2:17 לְבַיתֵהּ אֲזַל, 3:26; 4:8; 6:20 + often, rarely to a person Ezr 5:5; = towards Dn 4:31; into 3:6, 11; 6:17 +; in address of decree or letter 3:31 Ezr 5:7; 7:12; to fall or come to Dn 4:16, 18; 5:17; Ezr 5:7; 7:20, be confirmed to Dn 4:23.
as mark of accus. (as often in Aramaic; cf. in late Heb., BH 3), Dn 2:10, 12, 14, 24 + often, Ezr 7:25 לכל … (cf. אֵת Ju 3:15; Is 8:2).
to become or make into (BH 4) Dn 2:35; 4:27.
with reference to Ezr 6:8 לְמָא דִי, 7:14 (but read prob. וְעַל יְרוּשׁ׳).
belonging to Dn 5:23 לֵהּ, 7:4, 6, 7, and in דִּי לֵהּ = his 2:20 +; c. אִיתַי Ezr 4:16; הַשְׁכַּח לְ to find (belonging) to 2:35; 6:5, 6, 22 (cf. BH מָצָא לְ Dt 22:14 +).
as periphr. for the genitive (BH 5 c) Dn 7:1 בִּשְׁנַת חֲדָה לְ׳, Ezr 5:13; 6:3, 15(×2); 5:8, 11.
of the object or purpose, for (BH 5 g) Dn 4:9 וּמָזוֹן לְכֹלָּא־בֵּהּ v 27(×2), 33; 7:22; Ezr 6:9, 17; 7:19, 23; on behalf of Ezr 6:10b.
according to (BH 5 i) Ezr 6:17 לְמִנְיָן … according to the number of …
of time, at Dn 4:26 לִקְצָת … at the end of …, v 31; to Dn 2:4, 44 + לְעָֽלְמִין.

with an inf. (BH 7), after such vbs. as be able, think, need, agree, command, decree, Dn 2:9, 10, 12, 24; 3:13, 16, 19, 32; 6:4, 5, 8, 24; Ezr 4:21, 22; 5:3 + often; = in order to Dn 2:13, 14; 3:2, 20, so as to 5:20. With לָא = not to be … 6:9, 16 end Ezr 6:8, v. לָא. Cf. the synopsis Lzb 300 f..

(לָה †Dn 4:32) adv. not (BH לא; Aramaic of Têma, Egyptian, etc., לא; Nerab ל (Lzb 301 CookGl. 67); 𝔗 לָא; Syriac ܠܴܐ );—not Je 10:11; Dn 2:5, 9, 10, etc.; before a ptcp. (so rarely in BH, 1 b c), 2:27, 43; 3:16; 4:4, 6, 15 +, so v 32 וְכָל־דָּאְרֵי אַרְעָא כְּלָה חֲשִׁיבִין are as men not accounted of (so Bev Behrm Marti, cf. Is 53:3 𝔗 בסירין ולא חשׁיבין; > most ‘accounted as nothing,’ for which no analogy, yet cf. ψ 39:6 𝔗); sq. אִיתַי, v. אִיתַי. With inf. and לְ Dn 6:9 דִּי לָא לִהַשְׁנָיָה which it is not to alter = which is not to be altered (cf. v 16), Ezr 6:8 (K§ 67, 1 Dr§ 202, 2; cf. Is 35:6 𝔗, DAramaic Dialektproben, p. 1). With interr. הֲלָא †Dn 3:24; 4:27; 6:13.
(√ of foll.; BH לאך, מַלְאָךְ).
n.m. angel (𝔗 Syriac);—sf. מַלְאֲכֵהּ Dn 3:28; 6:23.
n.m. Dn 4:13 heart (v. BH; so Egyptian Aramaic S-CB 12 + );—cstr. ל׳ Dn 4:13; 7:4; sf. לִבְבָךְ 2:30; 5:22, -בֵהּ 4:13; 5:20, 21.
n.[m.] id. (BH id.; so 𝔗 Syriac; Egyptian Aramaic, Lzb301 = Cooke76 A 6);—sf. לִבִּי Dn 7:28.
vb. be clothed (v. BH);—
Impf. acc. אַרְגְּוָנָא: 3 ms. יִלְבַּשׁ Dn 5:7, 2 ms. תִּלְבַּשׁ v 16.
Pf. 3 mpl. הַלְבִּ֫שׁוּ v 29 clothe one (ל) with (acc.).
n.m. garment (BH id.);—sf. לְבוּשֵׁהּ Dn 7:9; pl. sf. לְבוּשֵׁיהוֹן 3:21.
v. לָא.
v. הֲוָא.
conj. therefore (BH לָהֵן †Ru 1:13(×2), Aramaic of Têma להן CIS ii. 113 = Cooke 195), Dn 2:6, 9; 4:24 (LambertRÉJ. 1904. 273 denies I. לָהֵן, taking Biblical Aramaic always as = רַק).

conj. except, but (from לָא and הֵן ‘not if’ (cf. Heb. אם לא Gn 24:38); so Nab. and Egyptian Aramaic להן Cooke217, 219, 241 S-CPap. C 6, 7 +; lâinnî, however SocinArabic Dial. v. Marokko 44, Anm. 103; 𝔗 אִילָּהֵין Gn 32:28; 43:3 al.);—
after a neg. (= BH כִּי אִם, q.v.):
except Dn 2:11; 3:28; 6:6, 8, 13.
but (Germ. sondern) Dn 2:30.
without a neg.: however, but Ezr 5:12.
n. gent. Levite (BH לֵוִי);—pl. emph. לויא Kt, לְוָאֵי Qr (K§§ 61, 6); 52. d), Ezr 6:16, 18; 7:13, 24 (all + priests).

prep. to, at, beside (der. uncertain; v.K 128 n.; perhaps akin to לָוָה, לְוִי, ܠܘܺܝ join; 𝔗 לְוָת, Syriac ܠܘܳܬ to), c. מִן, Ezr 4:12 the Jews which came up מִן־לְוָתָךְ from thee (de chez toi; cf. ܡܶܢ ܠܘܳܬ, מִלְּוַת, e.g. Ex 8:8; 9:33 𝔖 𝔗 = Heb. מֵעִם).
(K§ 54, 3. γ) n.m. feast (𝔗 Syriac bread, so BH, q.v. √ II. לחם);—abs. עֲבַד ל׳ Dn 5:1 made a feast.

n.f. concubine (𝔗 לְחֵינְתָא; FlLevy NHWB ii. 534 f. cp. Arabic لَخْنَا, indelicate epithet for woman; Batten Ezr 2:65 cp. Arabic لَحْنٌ note, tune, song; still otherwise WetzstDe, HL u. Koh. 454);—pl. sf. לְחֵנָתָךְ Dn 5:23, הּ—ֵ v 2, 3.
n.[m.] night (v. BH לַ֫יְלָה);—emph. לֵילְיָא Dn 2:19; 5:30; 7:2, 7, 13.

n.m. Dn 3:7 tongue (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH לָשׁוֹן, √ לשׁן);—tongue = language, fig. for people: abs. עַם אֻמָּה וְל׳ Dn 3:29; pl. emph. ע׳ א׳ וְלִשָּׁנַיָּא v 4, 7, 31; 5:19; 6:26; 7:14 (cf. BH לָשׁוֹן 2, Is 66:18).
v. מָה.
n.f. hundred (v. BH);—abs. מ׳ after noun enum., Ezr 6:17; 7:22(×4), so אַרְבַּע מ׳ 6:17, מ׳ וְעֶשְׂרִין Dn 6:2, and du. מָאתַ֫יִן Ezr 6:17.
v. אזן.
v. אמר.

n.m. Ezr 7:19 vessel, utensil (𝔗 מׇ(א)ן, Syriac ܡܳܐܢ, so Chr-Pal., SchulthLex. 106; Old Aramaic מאן, Ph. מנם; poss. √ אנה, v. BH II. אנה, cf. LagBN 183 Buhl);—pl., vessels of temple at Jerus.: emph. מָאנַיָּא Ezr 5:14, 15; 7:19; Dn 5:23; cstr. מָאנֵי v 2, 3; Ezr 6:5.
v. גלל.
vb.
overthrow (𝔗, Syriac (Lexx.); v. BH (late, rare));—Impf. 3 ms. יְמַגַּר כָּל־מֶלֶךְ Ezr 6:12 (of God).
v. דבח.
v. מִנ׳.
v. דור.
n.pr. gent. et terr. Medes, Media (BH id.);—
gent. Dn 5:28; 6:9, 13, 16.
terr. Ezr 6:2.
Kt, מָדָאָה Qr (K§ 61, 6)) n. gent. Mede;—Dn 6:1. [מְדִינָה] v. דין.
Dn 7:7 v. [דְּקַק].
v. דור.
(מָא †Ezr 6:8) pron. interr. and indef. what? (BH מָה; Nab. מה; Zinj. מ; 𝔗 מא; Syriac ܡܳܐ; Arabic مَا: cf. WCG 124 f.);—
what? Dn 4:32 מה עבדת.

whatever, what (cf. BH 1 b end) Dn 2:22 ידע מה בחשׁוכא knoweth what is in darkness, Ezr 6:9: so מָה דִּי (cf. דִּי 1 b: so Nab.; Palm. מא די, מדי, Lzb306 Cooke320, 332) Dn 2:28, 29(×2), 45; Ezr 6:8 למא די תעבדון with regard to what ye shall do, 7:18 (= whatsoever).
with prefixes:
כְּמָה how! Dn 3:33(×2).

לְמָה why? (cf. BH לָמָּה) Ezr 4:22 be not slack herein: why should damage grow, etc., virtually = lest damage grow (𝔊 μή ποτε), 7:23 די למה להוא קצף for why should there be wrath? = lest [𝔊 μή ποτε] there be wrath (cf. 𝔗 דִּילְמָא, Syriac ܕܰܠܡܳܐ lest: and v. מָה 4 d b, p. 554a).
על־מה wherefore? Dn 2:15.
v. [נְחֵת].
v. [אֲמַן].
v. [הֲלַךְ].
n.[m.] death (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH);—abs. Ezr 7:26. מֵזֵא v. [אֲזָא]. מָזוֹן v. זון.
vb. smite (v. BH II. מָחָה);—
Pf. 3 fs. מְחַת, ל rei, Dn 2:34, 35 (+ עַל).
Impf. 3 ms. יְמַחֵא בִידֵהּ 4:32, i.e. hinder him (cf. Ec 8:4 𝔗 DAramaic Dialektproben, p. 5; Talm.: LevyNHWB s.v.).
Impf. 3 ms. יִתְמְחֵא Ezr 6:11 let him be smitten (nailed) עֲלֹ֑הִי. מַחֵא Dn 5:19 v. [חֲיָא].
v. חלק.
vb. reach, attain (𝔗 id., Syriac ܡܛܳܐ, cf. Chr-Pal. SchulthLex. 108; Ethiopic መጠወ Arabic أَنْطَى (for أَمْطَى) NöZMG xi (1886), 736; distinct from BH מָצָא, etc., q.v.);—
Pf. 3 ms. מְטָא Dn 4:25, ה—ָ 7:13, 22; 3 fs. מְטַת 4:19, מְטָת v 21 Qr (Kt, erron., מטית K§ 47, Beisp. 1) α)); 3 mpl. מְטוֹ 6:25; Impf. 3 ms. יִמִטֵא 4:8, 17;—
reach, come to Dn 6:25 (ל loc.); come unto, as far as 7:13 (עַד pers.); abs. arrive 7:22 (of time; 𝔊 ἐδόθη; v. NesMM 41 who cp. Arabic عَطَى iv. give).
reach, extend, ל loc. 4:8, 17, 19.
c. עַל pers. come upon, befall 4:21, 25.
n.pr.m. (= BH id., 2, sub מִי);—Dn 2:17.
n.pr.m. (BH id.);—Dn 2:49; 3:12 + 11 times 3.
vb. fill (v. BH);—
Pf. 3 fs. מְלַאת Dn 2:35 (c. acc.).
Pf. 3 ms. הִתְמְלִי חֱמָא 3:19 was filled with rage.
v. לאך.
v. מלל.
n.m. salt (v. BH);—מ׳ abs. Ezr 6:9; 7:22 (both for sacrifices), cstr. 4:14.
vb. denom. c. acc. cogn., eat salt;—

Pf. 1 pl. מְלַחְנָא Ezr 4:14 we have eaten the salt of the palace (so most), i.e. have assumed obligations of loyalty, cf. M 69 * K§ 71, 2 (and Syriac ܐܶܬܡܰܠܰܚ be intimate with PS2134); Str (after NesMM 30 f.) thinks n. c. sf.: our salt is the salt of the palace.
(√ of following, v. BH).

n.m. king (general Sem.; v. BH);—מ׳ abs. Dn 2:10 + 2 times; cstr. 4:34 + 6 times; usually emph. מַלְכָּא Ezr 4:8 + 154 times, ה—ָ Dn 2:11; pl. מַלְכִין Ezr 4:15 + 9 times, ים—ִ 4:13 (Hebraism, Be-Ry M41 *); emph. מַלְכַיָּא Dn 2:44 + 2 times;—king Dn 2:4, 5 + 132 times Dn, Ezr 4:8, 11 + 42 times Ezr (מֶלֶךְ מַלְכַיָּא of Neb. Dn 2:37, of Artax. Ezr 7:12 [cf. Cooke71, 3, of Xerxes]; מַלְכִין Dn 7:17 = kingdoms, cf. מַלְכוּ v 23).
n.f. queen;—emph. מַלְכְּתָא Dn 5:10(×2).

n.f. royalty, reign, kingdom;—abs. מ׳ Dn 2:39 +; cstr. מַלְכוּת Ezr 4:24 +; emph. -תָא Dn 2:37 +, -תָה 2:44; sf. -תִי 4:15 +, -תֵהּ 3:33 +, -תָךְ 4:23 +; pl. cstr. מַלְכְוָת 7:27; emph. -וָתָא 2:44; 7:23;—
royalty, kingship, kingly authority: Dn 4:23, 28, 33; הֵיכַל מ׳ v 26, בֵּית מ׳ v 27, כָּרְסֵא מ׳ 5:20.

organized (world-) kingdom: 2:39(×2), 40, 41, 42, 44; 7:23(×2), 24, 27; מ׳ אֲנָשָׁא 4:14, 22, 29; 5:21; of specif. kings 2:37; 5:18, 28; 6:1; of God 3:33; 7:27 (both מ׳ עָלַם), 2:44(×2); 3:33; 4:31; 6:27; 7:27; of Mess. 7:14(×2); of saints 7:18(×2), 22, 27.
realm (territorial) 4:15, 33b; 5:7, 11, 16, 29; 6:2(×2), 4, 8, 27; Ezr 7:13, 28; meton. Dn 6:5 = administration of realm.
reign, time of reigning Dn 5:26; 6:29(×2); Ezr 4:24; 6:15.
(√ of foll.; Assyrian malâku, counsel, advise; 𝔗 מְלַךְ, Syriac ܡܠܰܟ, Chr-Pal. ܡܠܟ Schulth112; BH II. [מָלַךְ] †Ne 5:7 as loan-word).
n.m. counsel, advice;—sf. מִלְכִּי Dn 4:24 let my counsel be acceptable to thee.
vb.

speak, say (so 𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH מלל Pi. (rare));—Pf. 3 ms. מַלִּל Dn 6:22 he spoke with (עִם pers.); acc. of words, Impf. 3 ms. יְמַלִּ֔ל 7:25 (c. לְצַד of God); so Pt. act. מְמַלִּל v 8 (van d. H. here מְמַלֵּל), v 20; f. מְמַלֱּלָא (K§ 15 d)) v 11.
n.f. word, thing;—abs. מ׳ Dn 2:9 +, cstr. מִלַּת v 10 +; emph. מִלְּתָה v 5, א—ָ v 8 +; pl. abs. מִלִּין 7:1, 25, cstr. מִלֵּי 5:10, emph. מִלַּיָּא 7:11, 16;—

word, utterance Dn 4:28; 6:15, pl. 5:10; 7:11, 25; in bad sense, מ׳ כִדְבָה וּשְׁחִיתָה 2:9, מִלַּיָּא רַבְרְבָתָא 7:11 (cf. רַבְרְבָן alone v 8:20); word of God’s judgment 4:30; = command 2:5, 8; 3:22, 28; 6:13.
thing, affair, matter: 2:10(×2), 11, 15, 17, 23; 5:15, 26; 7:28(×2), pl. v 1, 16.

(so Gi, with most MSS., supported by Syriac ܡܰܢ, Arabic مِنْ; v. K§ 22, 1), מָן (Baer: v. on Dn 3:6), interr. pron. who? (Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. מן (Lzb312 Cooke188), 𝔗 מן, Syriac ܡܰܢ, Ethiopic መኑ Arabic مَنْ: WCG 123: BH מִי);—

who? Ezr 5:3, 9; strengthened by הוּא, Dn 3:15 וּמַן־הוּא אֱלָהּ דִּי who is the God who …? (cf. Syriac ܡܰܢܽܘ contr. from ܡܰܢ ܗܽܘ, and מַנּוּ in the Syriacizing 𝔗 to Pr: also BH מִי הוּא, הוּא 4 b β); so in the pl. Ezr 5:4 מַן־אִנּוּן שְׁמָהָת what (lit. who: cf. מִי 1 a, and Gn 32:28; Ex 3:13 𝔗) are the names of …?

מַן־דִּי whosoever (lit. who is there that …? v. BH מִי g) Dn 3:6, 11 מַן־דִּי לָא יִפֵּל, 4:14 וּלְמַן דִּי יִצְבֵּא יִתְּנִנַּהּ to whomsoever he willeth, he giveth it, v 22, 29; 5:21 (so Nab. מן די, Cooke241, 325 ff.; 𝔗 מַן דְּ; Syriac ܡܰܢ ܕ; cf. Egyptian Aramaic S-CPap. K 7, 12 ולמן זי צבית תנתן).

prep. from, out of, by, by reason of, at, more than (BH and general Aramaic id.);—rarely assimilated, as in Heb., v. Dn 6:5 מִצַּד, Ezr 5:11; 6:14; sf. מִנִּי, מִנָּךְ, 3 m. מִנֵּהּ, f. מִנַּהּ † Dn 2:42; 7:24; 3 mpl. מִנְּהוֹן (so Palm.Tariff ii. a 34; Nab. Egyptian Aramaic מנהם, CookeNo. 89. 6, S-CPap. A 10) †Dn 2:33(×2), 41(×2), 42(×2) Kt (Qr each time f. מִנְּהֵן), 6:3(×2);—
of place:
from, Dn 4:10, 11, 28; 7:4 +, מִן תַּמָּה †Ezr 6:6; fig. on the side or part of (cf. BH 1 c) Dn 6:5 מִצַּד מַלְכוּתָא.
out of, Dn 3:15, 26; 5:2; 7:3, etc.
(coming) from 2:35, away from, 2:45; 4:11, 22, 28; Je 10:11.
to ask or exact of a person, Dn 2:16, 49 +; Ezr 7:26; to deliver from Dn 6:21.

of the source (BH 2 b), as to be fed from Dn 4:9; or author (ib. d), מִנִּי שִׂים טְעֵם = by me is a decree made, Dn 3:29; 4:3 (6:27 מִן־קֳדָמַי), Ezr 4:19 +, cf. 5:17; מִנִּי = on my part Dn 2:5, 8 (v. אַזְדָּא).
of the immediate cause, as a result of, by, Dn 4:22 (= ב v 12, 20), v 30; 5:21: so with a vb. of fearing 5:19.
of the remoter cause, by reason of (BH 2 f), Dn 5:19 מִן־רְבוּתָא, 7:11; so מִן־דִּי, v. דִּי 4 b.
of the norm (cf. BH 2 g) = at, according to, Ezr 6:14 מִן־טַעַם אֱלָהּ יִשׂ׳ at the decree of, etc., 7:23; Dn 2:8 מִן־יַצִּיב according to certainty, v 47 מִן־קְשֹׁט.
partitively (BH 3), Dn 6:3 חַד מִנְּהוֹן, 7:8, 16; 2:25; 5:13; (some) of 2:41 מִן־נִצְבְּתָא; מִנְּהוֹן … מִנְּהוֹן some … others of them 2:33, 41, 42a; so v 42b מִן־קְצָת … מִנַּהּ.
of time, from, Dn 2:20 (מִן … וְעַד), Ezr 4:15, 19; v. also אֱדַיִן and דִּי 4.
in comparisons, different from Dn 7:3, 7, 19, 23, 24, beyond, more than 2:30, 39; 6:3; 7:20 end; 4:13 לִבְבֵהּ מִן־אֲנָשָׁא יְשַׁנּוֹן let his heart be changed away from man’s (BH 7 b b; Is 52:14).
cpds.:—v. לְוָת, קֳדָם, [קַדְמָה], תְּחוֹת.
v. מנה.
(?) n.f. tribute (Assyrian loan-word, cf. BH ii. [מִדָּה]);—abs. מִנ׳ Ezr 4:13; 7:24 + 4:20 Baer (van d. H. Gi Str מִדָּה); cstr. מִדַּת 6:8.
v. ידע.
vb. number, reckon (v. BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. מ׳ Dn 5:26 God has numbered (the days of) thy kingdom (acc.; i.e. put an end to it);—מְנֵא v. infr.
appoint, acc. pers.: Pf. 3 ms. מַנִּי Dn 2:24 (+ Inf.), v 49 (ל pers. + עַל rei); 2 ms. מַנִּיתָ 3:12 (עַל rei); Imv. ms. מֶנִּי (K§ 47, 3, c)) Ezr 7:25.

n. [m.] maneh, mina, a weight (v. BH; Old Aramaic מנה SAC75 Lzb313);—abs. Dn 5:25(×2), 26, v. ClGannJAs Juillet-Août, 1886, 36 ff. NöZA i. 414 f. Dr al.; its connexion in Dn with מְנָה is due to word-play; v. also פְּרֵס, תְּקֵל.
n. [m.] number;—cstr. מ׳ Ezr 6:17.
n.f. gift, offering (BH id., √ מנח);—
oblation, to God’s representative, abs. מ׳ Dn 2:46.
techn. meal-offering, pl. sf. מִנְחָֽתְהוֹן Ezr 7:17.
v. מנה.
n. [m.] pl. external belly (v. BH [מֵעֶה] 6);—sf. מְע֫וֹהִי Dn 2:32 (of image in vision).
v. עבד.
v. [מְעָא].
v. I. עלל.

n.m. lord (𝔗 מָר, c. מָרֵי; Syriac ܡܳܪܶܐ, e. ܡܳܪܳܐ, ܡܳܪܝܳܐ, Egyptian Aramaic מרא (RÉSi. 361); Chr-Pal. ܡܐܪ, etc., SchulthLex. 115; Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. מר(א) (Lzb316); cf. n.pr. dei מרנא (μαρνα), god of Gaza, SAC77; also Arabic مَرْءٌ man, Sab. מרא man, lord HomChr 127; AA 293 RÉSi. 454, 2);—lord: of God, cstr. מ׳ שְׁמַיָּא Dn 5:23, מָרֵה מַלְכִין 2:47; of king, sf. מָֽרְאִי Kt (as Nab., SACl.c.; K§ 58, 1), Qr מָרִי (as Palm., SACl.c.) 4:16, 21.
n.[m.] rebellion (v. BH);—abs. מ׳ Ezr 4:19.
adj. rebellious;—of city, f. abs. מָרָדָא Ezr 4:15, emph. מָרָֽדְתָּא (K ib.) v 12.
v. מָרֵא.
vb. pluck (v. BH);—Peʿîl Pf. 3 mpl. מְרִ֫יטוּ Dn 7:4 were plucked off (wings).
n.pr.m. Moses (BH id.);—סְפַר מ׳ Ezr 6:18.
n.[m.] oil (v. BH);—abs. Ezr 6:9; 7:22.
v. שׁכב.
v. שׁכן.
v. שׁרק.
v. שׁתה.
Dn 3:2 v. אֲתָה.
v. נתן.

(√ of foll.; v. BH id., but especially BewerAm. J. Sem. Lang., Jan. 1902 who cp. Assyrian nabû, tear away, lead forcibly, hence proph. as (fig.) carried away by divine frenzy, ecstasy, cf. 1 S 10:6, 10; 19:20, 24).
n.m. prophet (Hebraism? also 𝔗 Syriac; v. BH);—emph. נְבִיאָה Kt, נְבִיָּא Ezr 5:1; 6:14; pl. emph. נְבִיאַיָּא 5:1, 2.*
Hithpa. Pf. 3 m.s. הִתְנַבִּי prophesied Ezr 5:1.
n.f. prophesying;—cstr. נְבוּאַת Ezr 6:14.
n.pr.m. (= BH -רֶאצַּר, etc.);—Dn 2:28 + 23 times Dn, Ezr 5:12, 14; 6:5; נְבֻכ׳ Dn 3:3 + 3 times Dn.

n.f. reward (so 𝔗 (rare); prob. Pers. loan-word, HaugEw Jahrb. 1853, 160 proposes OP *nibaǧrâ, presentation; but perhaps crpt., v. M71*);—abs. נ׳ Dn 2:6; pl. sf. נְבָֽזְבְּיָתָךְ (al. נְבַז׳, נְבִז׳) 5:17.
n.f. emph. the candlestick (𝔗 id., Syriac ܢܰܒܪܶܫܬܳܐ, NH נַבְרֶשֶׁת; Arabic نِبْرَاس is loan-word from Aramaic Frä95; prob. foreign word K§ 62 Fra95 Bev al.;? Assyrian, cf. BaZA ii. 117);—Dn 5:5.
vb. stream, flow (𝔗 נְגַד, Syriac ܢܓܰܕ draw along, lead, 𝔗 also intrans. move along Is 30:24, flow Dt 33:13, 22, נַגְדִּין streams Is 44:4 +);—
Pt. Dn 7:10 נְהַר דִּי נוּר נָגֵד וְנָפֵק מִן־קֳדָמוֹהִי.
prep. in front of, facing (= BH, v. √ p. 616b; not elsewhere known in Aramaic), Dn 6:11 נֶגֶד יְרוּשְׁלֵם.
n.[f.] brightness, daylight (𝔗 Syriac; BH id.);—emph. בְּנָגְהָא (K§ 54 c), 1) Dn 6:20.
vb.
volunteer, offer freely (𝔗; BH נָדַב);—Pf. 3 mpl. הִתְנַדַּ֫בוּ Ezr 7:15; Inf. הִתְנִדָּבוּת v 16; Pt. מִתְנַדַּב v 13; pl. -דְּבִין v 16;—
volunteer, sq. inf., Ezr 7:13.
give, or offer freely, v 15, acc. rei + ל of God; v 16, c. ל of temple; freewill gift (inf., proposes freewill giving) v 16.

n.m. row or layer, course (𝔗 NH id.; NH also מִדְבָּךְ id. (LevyNHWB iii. 23), cf. مِدْمَاكٌ as loan-word Frä12; borrowed from Assyrian nadbaku, mountain-slope according to DlPr 150 (cf. BaZA ii. 115 f. HptGN 1883, 96; BASi. 8. 15), but meaning not very suitable NöZMG xl (1886), 733 MeyEntst. J. 46);—abs. נ׳ Ezr 6:4, pl. נִדְבָּכִין v 4.
vb. flee (v. BH I. נדד);—
Pf. 3 fs. שִׁנְּתֵהּ נַדַּת עֲלוֹהִי (K§ 46. Beisp. a)) Dn 6:19.

(Mas Baer) n. [m.] sheath (𝔗 נְדָן, לְדָן; v. BH (late) נָדָן, Pers. loan-word);—רוּחִי … בְּגוֹ נ׳ Dn 7:15 my spirit in (its) sheath, i.e. my body; < נִדְנָה emph., or sf. נִדְנַהּ (K§ 54. 3. β)); or (NöGGA. 1884, 1022 Bev) נְדָנַהּ; but expression at best strange; read prob. בְּגִין דְּנָה on account of this (בְּגִין as 𝔗J; D§ 47. 3 (2nd ed. 47. 10)), M72* cf. Buhl Dr.

n.m. Dn 7:10 river (v. BH I. נהר);—abs. נ׳ Dn 7:10; emph. נַהֲרָה Ezr 4:10 +, א—ָ 4:16;—river, usually of Euphr., in phr. עֲבַר נ׳ Ezr 4:10, 11, 16 + 10 times Ezr; נ׳ דִּי־נוּר Dn 7:10 a river of fire, in vision.
n.m. light (𝔗 נְהוֹרָא, Syriac ܢܽܘܗܪܳܐ; v. BH II. נהר);—emph. נהירא Kt, < נְהוֹרָא Qr (cf. 𝔗 Syriac; NöLCB 1896, 703) Dn 2:22.
(K§§ 16. 5; 61. 4) n.f. illumination, insight (Syriac id.);—abs. Dn 5:11, 14 (both + שָׂבְלְתָנוּ, חָכְמָה).
vb. flee (𝔗 Syriac; cf. [נְדַד] supra and BH נוּד 1 a);—
Impf. 3 fs. תְּנֻד מִן Dn 4:11.
(K§ 61, 4. 5) n.f. refuse-heap (𝔗 נְוָלִי dung-heap; perhaps loan-word from Assyrian namâlu (nawâlu), ruin, JenKB vi. 363);—נְוָלוּ Ezr 6:11, נְוָלִי Dn 2:5; 3:29.
n.f. Dn 3:6 et m.7, 9 fire (𝔗 Syriac; v. √ נור BH);—abs. נ׳ Dn 3:27; 7:9(×2), 10; emph. נוּרָא 3:6 + 12 times 3.
vb. suffer injury (𝔗 id.; Assyrian nazâḳu, injure; on combin. with Arabic نقص impair, v. BaES 51 FräBAS iii. 81);—
Pt. נָזִ֑ק Dn 6:3.
injure: Impf. 3 fs. תְּהַנְזִ֑ק (K§ 33, 2) Ezr 4:13 (acc. pers.). Pt. act. f. cstr. מְהַנְזְקַת מַלְכִין v 15; Inf. cstr. לְהַנְזָקַת מ׳ v 22 (Kib. d); M § 48 c -קֻת).
n.m. copper, bronze (𝔗 Syriac; BH נְחשֶׁת, נְחוּשָׁה, √ III. נחשׁ);—as material: abs. נ׳ Dn 2:32; 4:12, 20; 7:19; emph. נְחָשָׁא 2:35, 39, 45; 5:4, 23.
vb. descend (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH (poet., and late));—
Pt. נָחִ֑ת Dn 4:10, 20 (both מִן־שְׁמַיָּא).
deposit, ב loc.: Impf. 2 ms. תַּחֵת (K§ 42, b)) Ezr 6:5 (GuHpt reads 3 mpl.); Imv. ms. אֲחֵת (K§ 15 d)) 5:15 (acc. rei); Pt. pass. pl. מְהַחֲתִין 6:1 (were) deposited.
(WCG 225) be deposed: Pf. 3 ms. הָנְחַת Dn 5:20 (מִן־כָּרְסֵא).
vb. lift (𝔗 Syriac; BH (rare));—
Pf. 1 s. עַיְנַי לִשְׁמַיָּא נִטְלֵת Dn 4:31 (Assyrian naṭâlu = look). Peʿîl (WCG 224) be lifted: Pf. 3 fs. נְטִילַת מִן־אַרְעָא 7:4.
vb. keep (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH I. נצר, and (rarely) נָטַר);—
Pf. 1 s. מִלְּתָא בְּלִבִּי נִטְרֵת Dn 7:28.
n. [m.] soothing, tranquillizing (prob. Hebraism, v. BH id., √ נוּחַ (√ also 𝔗 Syriac));—pl. נִיח(וֹ)חִין Ezr 6:10; Dn 2:46 i.e. soothing offerings.
n.[m.], pl. נִכְסִין riches, property (𝔗 Syriac; Egyptian Aramaic S-CE4+; BH (late));—עֲנָשׁ נ׳ Ezr 7:26 confiscation of property; cstr. נִכְסֵי 6:8.
n.[m.] leopard (v. BH);—abs. Dn 7:6.
vb. pull away (𝔗; v. BH);—
be pulled away: Impf. 3 ms. יִתְנְסַח Ezr 6:11 (מִן).
vb. pour out (v. BH I. נָסַךְ);—
(more gen.): Inf. לְנַסָּכָה לֵהּ Dn 2:46 to offer in sacrifice to him, c. acc. מִנְחָה וְנִיחֹחִין.
n.[m.] drink-offering (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH);—pl. sf. נִסְכֵּיהוֹן Ezr 7:17 (+ מִנְחָֽתְהוֹן, etc.).
v. סלק.
vb. fall (v. BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. נ׳ Dn 2:46; נְפַ֑ל 4:28; 3 mpl. נְפַ֫לוּ 3:23 + 7:20 Kt (Qr 3 fpl. נְפַ֫לָה, K§23, 2); Impf. 3 ms. יִפֵּל (K§ 42) Dn 3:6 +; 2 mpl. תִּפְּלוּן 3:5, 15; Pt. pl. נָֽפְלִין 3:7;—
fall, עַל־אַנְפּ֫וֹהִי Dn 2:46; fall down and do homage 3:5, 6, 7, 10, 11, 15; ל loc. 3:23; of voice, מִן־שְׁמַיָּא 4:28.
fall by violence 7:20 (c. קֳדָם).
יִפֵּל לָךְ Ezr 7:20 it shall fall to thee (thou shalt need) to give (cf. Chr-Pal. SchulthLex. 126 and ZAW xxii (1902), 163).

vb. go, or come, out, forth (𝔗 id., NH נָפַק, Syriac ܢܦܰܩ, so Chr-Pal. SchulthLex. 126, Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. נפק Lzb 324, cf. Arabic نَافِقَاءُ hole of field mouse; v. also Aramaic נַפְקוּתָא, ܢܦܰܩܬܳܐ outlay, Egyptian Aramaic נפקתה CookeInscr. 212, Arabic نَفَقَةٌ household outlay (Aramaic loan-word SchwallyZMG lii (1898), 133));—

Pf. 3 ms. נ׳ Dn 2:14 he went out, c. inf.; 3 fs. נֶפְקַת v 13 decree went forth (cf. Lu 2:1); 3 mpl. נפקו 5:5 Kt (Qr 3 fpl. נְפַ֫קָה, K§ 23, 2) fingers came forth; c. מִן loc.: Imv. mpl. פֻּקוּ (K§ 42) 3:26 come forth! Pt. pl. נָֽפְקִין v 26 (both of men); sg. נָפֵק 7:10 (= flow out).
bring forth, acc. rei + מִן loc.: Pf. 3 ms. הַנְפֵּק Ezr 5:14(×2); 6:5 Dn 5:2; 3 mpl. הַנְפִּ֫קוּ v 3 (so Egyptian Aramaic S-CPap. D 15, 17 +).
n.f. outlay;—emph. נִפְקְתָא Ezr 6:4, 8.
n.f. firmnesss (v. BH נצב);—emph. נִצְבְּתָא Dn 2:41.
vb.
distinguish oneself (v. BH I. נצח);—Pt. מִתְנַצַּח Dn 6:4, עַל pers.
vb.
rescue, deliver (v. BH Egyptian Aramaic הנצל take away, S-CC 10, D 18);—of God, abs.: Pt. act. מַצִּל Dn 6:28, Inf. לְהַצָּלָה 3:29; of man, sf. pers. לְהַצָּלוּתֵהּ 6:15.
adj. clean, pure (v. BH נקה);—כַּעֲמַר נ׳ Dn 7:9 like pure wool.
vb. knock (v. BH (rare));—
Pt. act. fpl. נָֽקְשָׁן Dn 5:6 of knees knocking דָּא לְדָא.
vb. lift, take, carry (cf. BH; rare in Aramaic; v. נְסִי, נְסָא ChWB, NHWB);—
Pf. 3 ms. נ׳ Dn 2:35 carry away (of wind, c. acc. rei); Imv. ms. שֵׂא Ezr 5:15 take (acc. vessels).
make a rising, an insurrection: Pt. fs. מִתְנַשְּׂאָה Ezr 4:19, עַל pers.
v. [נְשִׁין] sub II.אנשׁ.
n.f. breath (v. BH, √ נשׁם);—sf. נִשְׁמְתָךְ Dn 5:23, i.e. breath of life.
n.m. griffon-vulture or eagle (v. BH);—abs. נ׳ Dn 7:4; pl. abs. נִשְׁרִין 4:30.
n.m. Ezr 4:18 letter (prob. Pers.; v. BH);—emph. נִשְׁתְּוָנָא Ezr 4:18, 23; 5:5.
n.m.pl. Nethinîn (prob. loan-word from BH נְתִינִים, √ נָתַן);—servants of sanctuary, emph. נְתִינַיָּא Ezr 7:24.
vb. give (v. BH; 𝔗 rare; Old Aramaic נתן, Impf. ינתן, so Nab.; Zinj. Palm. יתן; Egyptian Aramaic Impf. אנתן, ינתן, etc., S-CPap. A 7 +, pl. sf. תנתנונה ib.J 9, Inf. למנתן S-CC 6, 9 +);—
Impf. 3 ms. יִנְתִּן־ (K§ 42) Dn 2:16, sf. יִתְּנִנַּהּ 4:14 +; 2 ms. תִּנְתֵּן Ezr 7:20; 3 mpl. יִנְתְּנוּן 4:13; Inf. לְמִנְתַּ֑ן 7:20;—
give, subj. God, c. sf. rei + ל pers., Dn 4:14, 22, 29.
of man, give, allow, acc. time, 2:16.
give, pay, acc. rei, Ezr 4:13; 7:20 (+ מִן of source), abs. v 20.
n.f. gift;—pl. abs. מַתְּנָן Dn 2:6, 48; sf. מַתְּנָתָךְ 5:17.
vb.
strip off (𝔗 נְתַר fall off; Syriac ܢܬܰܪ; Arabic نَثَرَ scatter; Assyrian našâru, diminish, shorten, NH נָשַׁר fall off);—Imv. mpl. אַתַּ֫רוּ (K§ 42 b)) Dn 4:11 (acc. of leaves).
v. שַׂבְּכָא.

vb. si vera l. bear, carry a load (v. BH);—Pōʿ. Pt. pass. אֻשֹּׁ֫הִי מְסוֹבְלִים (K§ 36 NöGGA, 1884, 1016) Ezr 6:3 its foundations (be) raised (Thes al.; WCG 203, 225), very dub.; HptGu ad loc. conj. אֶשֹּׁהִי מְס׳ his (God’s) fire-offerings they bring (Assyrian zabâlu), so (hesitantly) Berthol.
vb. think, intend (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH II. שׂבר (late));—
Impf. 3 ms. יִסְבַּר Dn 7:25, sq. inf.
vb. do homage (by prostration) (𝔗 Syriac; BH (late));—

Pf. 3 ms. ס׳ Dn 2:46; Impf. 3 ms. יִסְגֻּד Dn 3:6 +, 3 mpl. יִסְגְּדוּן 3:28, etc.; Pt. act. pl. סָֽגְדִין 3:7 +;—do homage לְצֶלֶם Dn 3:5, 7, 10, 12, 14, 15, 18, ל of false god v 28; לְצ׳ om., v 6, 11, 15; לְדָנִיֵּאל ס׳ 2:46 (perhaps as representing God, cf. v b, yet v. Dr).
n.m. prefect (𝔗 (rare), Egyptian Aramaic S-CD 13; v. BH (late), Assyrian loan-word);—pl. abs. סִגְנִין Dn 2:48; emph. סִגְנַיָּא 3:2, 3, 27; 6:8.
vb. shut (v. BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. ס׳ Dn 6:23 shut the lions’ mouth (acc.).

n.f. bag-pipe, or < double pipe or Pan’s pipe (v. GFMJBL, 1905, 166 ff.) (NH LevyNHWB iii. 492; NH Aramaic סִימְפּוֹן is tube, especially vein, artery Idib. 513; loan-word from (late) Gk. συμφωνία, Krauss ii. 376, 390 Bev 41 Dr Dn 3:5 NesMM 37 (hence also later Lat. symphonia, Ital. zampogna), PrinceEB 3230);—abs. ס׳ Dn 3:5, 15, = סיפניה Kt, סוּפֹּנְיָה Qr v 10 (Syriac ܨܦܽܘܢܝܳܐ id.; cf. Palm. ספון = σύμφωνος, in agreement, Lzb 330 GACookeInscr. 338).
vb. be fulfilled (proposes ended) (𝔗 Syriac (often); v. BH);—
Pf. 3 fs. מִלְּתָא סָ֫פַת Dn 4:30 (cf. BH I. כָּלָה Qal 1 c).
put an end to: Impf. 3 fs. תָּסֵף Dn 2:44 (acc. rei).
n.[m.] end;—cstr. ס׳ end of the earth Dn 4:8, 19; emph. סוֹפָא 7:28 end, conclusion of the matter; עַד־ס׳ = for ever 6:27; 7:26.
v. סוּמְפֹּנְיָה.
vb. come up (Aramaic loan-word in BH, q.v.);—

Pf. 3 fs. סִלְקַת Dn 7:20, ת—ַ(!) v 8 (K§ 25 b)); 3 mpl. סְלִ֫קוּ 2:29 Ezr 4:12; Pt. fpl. סָֽלְקָן Dn 7:3;—come up, מִן pers. Ezr 4:12, מִן־יַמָּא Dn 7:3; abs. of horn in vision 7:8, 20; fig. of thoughts 2:29.
lift, take up: Pf. 3 mpl. הַסִּ֫קוּ (as if from נסק; K§ 44 b)) Dn 3:22; Inf. לְהַנְסָקָה (Kl.c. Str§ 3 h) 6:24 (מִן loc.), both c. ל acc. pers.
(WCG 225) be taken up: Pf. 3 ms. הֻסַּק 6:24 (מִן loc.).
vb.
support, sustain (𝔗 Zinj.; v. BH);—Pt. act. pl. מְסַעֲדִין לְהוֹן Ezr 5:2.
n.m. Dn 7:10 book (v. BH סֵ֫פֶד);—cstr. ס׳ דָּכְרָנַיָּא Ezr 4:15(×2), ס׳ משֶׁה 6:18; pl. abs. סִפְרִין Dn 7:10 books (of records, v. Dr); emph. בֵּית סִפְדַיָּא Ezr 6:1 house of records.
n.m. secretary, scribe (𝔗 Syriac; BH סֹפֵר);—emph. סָֽפְרָא the secretary, Persian official, Ezr 4:8, 9, 17, 23; cstr. סָפַר the scribe 7:12, 21, of Ezra as learned in God’s law.

n.[m.] prob. mantle (v. especially SACJPhil. xxvi (1899), 307 f., cf. AndrM 74*, with conj. as to orig. Pers. form; > trousers; NH; JAram. id., with both meanings, also shoes; Arabic سِرْبَالٌ mantle is loan-word Frä 47; Egyptian Arabic زربول shoe is Gk. loan-word according to VollersZMG li (1897), 298, cf. Krauss ii. 412);—pl. sf. סַרְבָּלֵיהוֹן Dn 3:21, 27.

n.m. chief, overseer (𝔗 id. (= BH שֹׁטֵר); etym. dub.; prob. with Bev Dn Dr Dn AndrM 75*, loan-word from. Pers. sār (and *sarak?), head, chief);—pl. abs. סָֽרְכִין Dn 6:3, emph. סָֽרְכַיָּא v 4, 5, 7, cstr. סָֽרְכֵי v 8.
vb.
hide (v. BH);—Pt. pass. fpl. emph. מְסַתְּרָתָא Dn 2:22 the hidden things.
vb. destroy (Syriac ܣܬܰܪ; v. BH שׂתר);—
Pf. 3 ms. sf. סַתְרֵהּ Ezr 5:12. (acc. of temple).
vb. make, do (𝔗 Syriac Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. Egyptian Aramaic (S-CPap.; cf. אַזְדָּא); = BH עָבַד, q.v., but in meaning ‖ עשׂה);—

Pf. 3 ms. ע׳ Dn 3:1 +, 2 ms. עֲבַ֑דְתְּ (K§ 13, 2) 4:32; 1 s. עַבְדֵֿת 3:15; 6:23, 3 mpl. עֲבַ֫דוּ Ezr 6:13 +; Impf. 2 mpl. תַּעְבְּדוּן (Baer K§ 38, 1. b); תַּעַבְדוּן Gi Str) Ezr 6:8; 7:18; Inf. מֶעְבַּד (K§ 15, a) 2)) 4:22; 7:18 (מֶעְבַּ֑ד); Pt. act. עָבֵד 7:26 +, fs. עָבְדָא Dn 7:21; mpl. עָֽבְדִין Ezr 4:15;—
make, acc. rei Dn 3:1, 15 and (of creation) Je 10:11; make a feast Dn 5:1, war 7:21 (עִם pers.), ded. of temple Ezr 6:16.

do, acc. of deed, Dn 4:32 (of God), 6:23 Ezr 4:15, 22; do, act, כְּנֵמָא, thus, Ezr 6:13, כ, according to, Dn 7:18 and (of God) 4:32, abs. 6:11; acc. + ב rei Ezr 7:18 do something with, + עִם pers. 6:8; do, perform, acc. of God’s law 7:26, acc. of signs, etc. (subj. God) Dn 6:28 and (+ עִם pers.) 3:32.
Impf. 3 ms. יִתְעֲבֵד Ezr 6:11 +, ד—ִ֑ 6:12; 7:21; 2 mpl. תִּתְעַבְדוּן Dn 2:5; Pt. מִתְעֲבֵד Ezr 7:26, -בֶד־ 4:19, fs. -עַבְדָא 5:8;—
be made into, c. n. pred., Dn 2:5; 3:29; Ezr 6:11.
be done, wrought, 4:19, 5:3 (subj. עֲבִידְתָּא); be performed, executed, of command Ezr 6:12; 7:21, 23, judgment 7:26.

n.m. slave, servant (BH עֶ֫בֶד);—cstr. עֲבֵד Dn 6:21 servant of God; pl. sf. of king, עבדיך Kt (K§ 53 Anm. b)), עַבְדָךְ Qr Ezr 4:11; עַבְדָךְ Qr Dn 2:4; sf. of God, עַבְד֫וֹהִי, Dn 3:26, 28; Ezr 5:11, of king Dn 2:7.
n.pr.m. comrade of Daniel (BH id.);—Dn 2:49; 3:12 + 10 times 3, + עֲבֵד נְגוֹא 3:29; = עֲזַרְיָה 2:17.
n.f. work, service (BH עֲבֹדָה);—emph. עֲבִידְתָּא Ezr 5:8; Dn 2:49, cstr. עֲבִידַת Ezr 4:24 +;—
work, of building temple, Ezr 4:24; 5:8; 6:7; = administration Dn 2:49; 3:12.
ritual, service, of God Ezr 6:18.
n.[m.

n.m. region across, beyond (v. BH I. עֵ֫בֶר, √ עָבַר);—cstr. in phr. עֲבַר(־)נַהֲרָה, i.e. Syria (Scheft 87): Ezr 4:10, 11, 17, 20; 5:3, 6(×2); 6:6(×2), 8, 13; 7:21, 25, ע׳ נהרא 4:16. cf. in Cilic. Aramaic, Cooke 346.
v. עדה.
vb. pass on, away (𝔗 for Heb. עָבַר, Syriac; v. BH I. עָדָה (rare, late));—
Pf. 3 fs. עֲדָת Dn 3:27; 4:28; Impf. 3 ms. יֶעְדֵּה 7:14, 3 fs. תֶּעְדֵּא 6:9;—
pass on, over, c. ב pers. Dn 3:27.
pass away, of kingdom 4:28 (מִן pers.), 7:14; of law 6:9, 13.
take away (so Egyptian Aramaic S-CG 35): Pf. 3 mpl. הֶעְדִּיו, acc. rei, Dn 5:20 (מִן pers.), 7:12; Impf. 3 mpl. יְהַעְדּוֹן v 26; Pt. מְהַעְדֵּה 2:21 remove, depose kings, of God.
prep. and conj. even to, until (BH III. עַד; so 𝔗 Syriac Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. Egyptian Aramaic (Lzb336 S-CA 5 +));—
prep.:
of space, even to Dn 7:13; עַד־כָּה v 28.
of amount, up to Ezr 7:22 (4 times).

of time, until Dn 2:20; 6:15, 27; 7:18(×2), 26 Ezr 4:24; 5:16 וְעַד־כְּעַן; = our against 6:15 (cf. BH, p. 724 a top); to (the end of) = during Dn 6:8 עַד יוֹמִין תְּלָתִין, v 13; 7:12, 25. On עַד־אָֽחֳרֵין Dn 4:5 v. אָחֳרָן; and on עַד־דִּבְרַת דִּי 4:14 v. [דִּבְרָה].
conj.:
עַד־דִּי until, sq. pf. (of past time) Dn 2:34; 4:30; 5:21; 7:4, 9, 11, 22; sq. impf. (of fut.) 2:9; 4:20, 22, 29.—Dn 6:25 לָא מְטוֹ … עַד דִּי שְׁלִטוּ וג׳ up to the time that …, i.e. ere that.
עַד alone, Ezr 4:21; 5:5.

n.m. Dn 2:9 time (𝔗 id., Syriac ܥܶܕܳܢܳܐ, perhaps loan-wd. from Assyrian (ḫ)adon(n)u, edanu, appointed, or definite, time; [Arabic عدّان prob. Aramaic loan-wd., SchwallyZMG liii (1889), 197]);—abs. ע׳ Dn 7:12 +; emph. עִדָּנָא 2:8 +; pl. abs. עִדָּנִין 4:13 +, emph. עִדָּנַיָּא 2:21;—
in gen., time, as duration Dn 2:8; 7:12; involving specif. conditions 2:9, 21; (point of) time 3:5, 15.

definite time, = year (as mod. Gk. χρόνος, v. EASophocles1173): שִׁבְעָה ע׳ = seven years, 4:13, 20, 22, 29; עִדָּן וְעִדָּנִין וּפְלַג עִדָּן 7:25 (i.e. 3 ½ years, v. Dr; perhaps read du. for pl., cf. Bev GunkSchöpf. 201).
adv. still (BH; S-CK 13; 𝔗O Jon.; Chr-Pal. Schulth 143 f.), Dn 4:28 עוֹד מִלְּתָא בְּפֻם מַלְכָּא (cf. BH 1 a a).
n.f. iniquity (BH II. עוה, עָוֹן; cf. 𝔗 עֲוָיָא);—pl. sf. עֲוָיָתָךְ (K§ 56 a) β) 2) Dn 4:24.
n.[m.] fowl (v. BH, √ I. עוּף);—ע׳ abs. Dn 7:6 wings of a fowl; cstr. 2:38 coll.
n.[m.] chaff (J.Aram (Talm, rare), Syriac ܥܽܘܪܳܐ; Arabic عُوَّارٌ, عَاىِٔرٌ mote (in eye, tending to cause blindness [עִוֵּר]) according to Arabic Lexx., Lane 2195);—abs. ע׳ Dn 2:35 (in sim.).
v. ענז.
n.f. signet-ring (𝔗 Syriac; √ עזק = surround, v. BH);—sf. עִזְקְתֵהּ Dn 6:18; pl. cstr. -קָת v 18.
n.pr.m. Ezra (BH id.);—Ezr 7:12, 21, 25.
n.pr.m. comrade of Daniel (BH id.; Dn 1:6 +);—Dn 2:17, = עֲבֵד נְגוֹ v 49 +.
v. יעט.
n.f. Ezr 5:5 eye (v. BH I. ע׳);—cstr. עֵין Ezr 5:5 (of God); pl. (K§ 51, 1) of horn, עַיְנִין Dn 7:8, 20; of man, du. cstr. עַיְנֵי v 8, sf. עַיְנַי 4:31.

n.m. waking, or wakeful, one, i.e. angel (√ עיר, cf. Syriac ܥܳܪ wake, ܥܺܝܪ waking (PS 2843), JAram עִיר, NH עֵיר adj. awake);—abs. ע׳ Dn 4:10, 20; pl. abs. עִירִין v 14; Aq Symm. ἐγρήγορος; cf. CharlesEnoch i, 5; xxxix. 12; also p. 356 Drad loc.; doubtful is the connex. with Ph. Zophesemim (Euseb.Praep. Evang. 10), i.e. צפי שמים watchers of heaven, as keeping watch over or spying out (ZimKAT3. 629 JeremAT im Licht d. AO 63).
v. עלה.
(√ of foll.; v. BH עָלָה).
n.f. burnt-offering (BH עוֹלָה; cf. Palm. עלתא altar, SAC 92 Lzb 341);—pl. abs. עֲלָוָן Ezr 6:9.
adj. highest;—always emph. עליא Kt, עִלָּאָה Qr, the Most High God: אֱלָהָא ע׳ Dn 3:26, 32; 5:18, 21; ע׳ alone, the Most High, 4:14, 21, 22, 29, 31; 7:25 (cf. Nab. n.pr. עליאל Lzb 341 SAC 91).
adj.id.(BH id.);—pl. of God, קַדִּישֵׁי עֶלְיוֹנִין (double pl., Buhl, as sometimes BH, Ges§ 124 q Köii. 1. 438 f) Dn 7:18, 22, 25, 27.
n.f. roof-chamber (cf. Dr; BH עֲלִיָּה);—sf. עִלִּיתֵהּ Dn 6:11.

prep. upon, over, on account of, above, to, against (BH and general Aramaic id.);—sf. 1 s. עֲלַי; 2 ms. עליך Kt (so Egyptian Aramaic, CookeNo. 77, A 5, 6, B 8, S-CPap.A 3, B 5 +), עֲלָךְ, Qr (𝔗 עֲלַךְ, Dalm§ 47, 2) Dn 3:12 + 6 times Dn, Ezr 7:18; 3 ms. עֲלוֹהִי (so Nab. Palm.; Egyptian Aramaic עלוי S-CA 6 +) Dn 3:28 +, עֲלֹהִי †Ezr 6:11; 3 fs. עליה Kt (so Egyptian Aramaic, S-CD 24), עֲלַהּ Qr (so 𝔗) †Dn 4:14; 5:21; 1 pl. עֲלֵי֥נָא †Ezr 4:12, עֲלֶ֑ינָא 4:18; 5:17 Baer (Gi עֲלֶ֑ינָא); 3 mpl. עֲלֵיהֹם (so Nab., CIS ii. 226; Egyptian Aramaic, S-CPap. F 5, 8 +) †7:24, עֲלֵיהוֹן †5:1, 3;—

upon, Dn 2:10, 28, 46; 5:5, 7; 6:11 + often, 4:26 עַל־הֵיכַל מַלְכוּתָא (2 S 11:2); to be established עַל מַלְכוּתִי 4:33 (cf. 2 Ch 1:1; BH II. 1) to lay an impost upon, Ezr 7:24; to trust on, Dn 3:28; after a vb. of motion, מְטָא עַל to come upon, Dn 4:21, 25; of times, to pass over, 4:13, 20, 22, 29; Ezr 5:1 בְּשֻׁם אֱלָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲלֵיהוֹן i.e. (named) over them.
idiom. (as in BH; v. II. 1 d) of the pers. who is the subj. of an emotion or experience, Dn 5:9 וְזִיוֹהִי שָׁנַיִן עֲלוֹהִי were changed upon him, 7:28; 6:19 וְשִׁנְּתֵהּ נַדַּת עֲלוֹהִי (cf. 2:1).
on acc. of (BH 1 f b), Dn 3:16 עַל־דְּנָה פִּתְגָּם. So in עַל־דְּנָה on this acc. †Ezr 4:15, 22; 5:17, עַל־מָה wherefore? †Dn 2:15; and עַל דִּבְרַת דִּי (v. דְּ׳).
on behalf of (ib. 1 f c), Ezr 6:17.
regarding, concerning (ib. 1 f g), Dn 2:18; 5:14, 29; 6:6, 13; Ezr 7:14 + often
over, with vbs. of ruling appointing, etc., Dn 2:48, 49; 3:12; 4:14 +, Ezr 4:20; 6:18.
in a compar. sense, above, beyond, Dn 3:19; 6:4.
expressing direction:

to, of a person, after a vb. of motion (cf. BH 7 c a α), Dn 2:24; 4:31, 33; 6:7, 16; Ezr 4:12, 23 + often; after to send (a letter, etc.) Ezr 4:11, 17, 18; 5:6 +, write 4:7, prophesy 5:1; of the direction of the mind (ib. 7 c c), Dn 3:12; 6:14(×2) 15; cf. Ezr 5:5 וְעֵין אֱל׳ הֲוַת עַל (cf. Je 40:4 and אֶל ψ 34:16).
against, Dn 3:19, 29; 5:23; 6:5, 6 +; Ezr 4:8; 7:23.

in such phrases as שְׁפַר עַל, טְאֵב (to be) good or acceptable to (as in Syriac and late Heb.: v. BH 8), Ezr 5:17 אִם עַל מַלְכָּא טָב, 7:18(×2); Dn 4:24 (יִשְׁפַּר), 6:15 (בְּאֵשׁ), v 24 (טְאֵב).—Comp. the synopsis of meanings in Lzb 340.

adv. above (from n. עֵל, with -א of direction, D§ 44, 1 n.; Nab., Egyptian Aramaic, id., Lzb 341 S-CA 5 +; 𝔗 עֵיל, עֵילָא; Syriac ܥܶܠ in ܠܥܶܠ above);—Dn 6:3 עֵ֫לָּא מִנְּהוֹן above (over) them (cf. Cooke 96:2, Dt 28:43 𝔗).
n.f. matter, affair, occasion (Syriac ܥܶܠܬܳܐ, v. BH I. עלל);—abs. ע׳ Dn 6:5(×2), 6 (= ground of accusation).
vb. go or come in (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH III. עלל);—
Pf. 3 ms. עַל Dn 2:16; c. עַל pers. v 24; c. לְבַיְתֵהּ 6:11, so 3 fs. עללת Kt, עַלַּת Qr 5:10; Pt. עללין Kt, עָלִּין Qr, abs. 4:4; 5:8.

bring in, c. קֳדָם pers.: Pf. 3 ms. הַנְעֵל (K§ 11, 4. b; so Egyptian Aramaic, S-C G 6, 7, 24, 27 הנעלת; cf. D§ 71. 7; Dial.-Proben, p. 4); Dn 2:25 (ל acc. pers.), 6:19 (acc. rei); Imv. ms. sf. pers., הַעֵלְנִי 2:24; Inf. לְהַנְעָלָה 4:3 (ל acc. pers.); no קֳדָם pers., לֶהֶעָלָה 5:7 (id.).
(WCG 225) be brought, subj. pers. + קֳדָם pers.: Pf. 3 ms. הֻעַל Dn 5:13, 3 mpl. הֻעַ֫לּוּ v 15.

n. [m.] going in (Syriac, 𝔗J; 𝔗Onk, etc., מַעֲלָנָא);—pl. cstr. מֶעָלֵי שִׁמְשָׁא Dn 6:15 i.e. sunset (so read NöGGA, 1884, 1020 Str M Bev, cf. Syriac ܡܰܥܰܠ, ܡܰܥܳܠܰܝ; > van d. H. Gi מֵעָלֵי, Baer מַעֲלֵי; cf. K§ 60, Beisp. b)).

n.[m.] perpetuity, antiquity (v. BH III. עלם, עוֹלָם);—ע׳ abs. Dn 3:33 +, cstr. 7:18; emph. עָֽלְמָא 2:20 +; pl. עָֽלְמִין 2:4 +, emph. עָֽלְמַיָּא 2:44; 7:18;—perpetuity in the future: מַלְכוּת ע׳ Dn 3:33; 7:27, cf. 4:31; 7:14; ע׳ as adv. for ever 4:31; עַד־עָֽלְמָא וְעַד־עָלַם עָֽלְמַיָּא 7:18; pl. לְע׳ for ever 2:4, 44(×2); 3:9; 5:10; 6:7, 22, 27; antiquity, מִן־יוֹמָת עָֽלְמָא Ezr 4:15, 19; of limitless time both past and future: מִן־ע׳ וְעַד־ע׳ Dn 2:20.
n.gent.pl. Elamites (cf. BH עֵילָם);—Ezr 4:9.
n.f. rib (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH I. צלע, צֵלָע);—pl. abs. עִלְעִין Dn 7:5.
v. עלה.

n.m. Ezr 6:12 people (v. BH I. עמם, עַם);—ע׳ abs. Dn 2:44; 3:29; Ezr 6:12, cstr. Dn 7:27; emph. עַמָּה Ezr 5:12, עַמָּא 7:13, 16, 25; pl. emph. עַמְמַיָּא (K§§ 15 d); 55, 5 a)) Dn 3:4, 7(×2), 31; 5:19; 6:26; 7:14.
prep. with (BH עִם: so 𝔗 Syriac (ܥܰܡ) and general Aramaic);—sf. עִמִּי †Dn 3:32, עִמָּךְ †Ezr 7:13, עִמֵּהּ †Dn 2:22, עִמְּהוֹן †Ezr 5:2;—
together with, Dn 2:18, 43; 7:13 עִם־עֲנָנֵי שְׁמַיָּא, Ezr 5:2 +; whose dwelling, portion, etc., is with Dn 2:11, 22; 4:12; 5:21.
to speak with Dn 6:22, to make war with 7:21; to do with (= towards) 3:22 דִּי עֲבַד עִמִּי (cf. ψ 86:17), cf. Ezr 6:8; שַׁוִּי עִם to make like to Dn 5:21.
of time, Dn 3:33 = 4:31 עִם־דָּר וְדָר (co-exists) with all generations (cf. BH 1 g); 7:2 עִם־לֵילְיָא during the night.
adj. deep (v. BH עמק);—fpl. emph., as n., עֲמִיקָתָא Dn 2:22 the deep things.
n.m. wool (𝔗 Syriac; EgyptianAramaic עמר S-CG 7, 10, קמר id.H 5; cf. Mand. אקאמרא, NöM 72; v. BH צמר);—abs. Dn 7:9.
vb. answer (v. BH I. עָנָה);—

Pf. 3 fs. עֲנַת Dn 5:10; 3 mpl. עֲנוֹ 2:7 +; Pt. act. (עֲנָה NöGGA, 1884, 1021) עָנֵה 2:5 +, pl. עָנַיִן (K§ 47 Beisp. ε)) 3:24;—always + אמר Pt., answered and said (ל [or קֳדָם] pers. usually foll. אמר; foll. ע׳ 2:10, 27, 47):—
answer, make reply, to something said: Dn 2:5, 7, 8, 10, 27; 3:16, 24, 25; 4:16 b; 5:17; 6:13, 14.
respond to occasion, speak in view of a situation: 2:15, 20, 26, 47; 3:9, 14, 19, 24, 26, 28; 4:16 a, 27; 5:7, 10, 13; 6:17, 21; 7:2.

adv. now (so Egyptian Aramaic (CISii. 137 = CookeNo. 73 RÉS 361 B S-CPap. C 5); 𝔗, e.g. Nu 22:4: עַן prob. a subst. from [עָנָה] the √ of עֵת (p. 773a), time; so כְּעַן lit. at (this) time = Heb. עַתָּה: K§ 67, 4);—Dn 2:23 וּכְעַן הוֹדַעְתַּנִי, 3:15; 4:34; 5:12, 15, 16; 6:9; Ezr 4:13, 14, 21; 5:17; 6:6; עַד־כְּעַן until now Ezr 5:16 (so 𝔗 Gn 18:22 +).

and (Ezr 4:17) contr. כְּעֶת adv. now (f. of כְּעַן; so first SS TorreyJBL 16 (1897), 166 ff.; now confirmed by Egyptian Aramaic כענת Cowley PSBA xxv. 264, 311, 312 (= RÉS 492–4 = S-C M, N, O); וכ׳ formerly taken to mean and so forth);—always וּכ׳, and always in a letter, introducing the business of the letter, and to be connected with what follows, not, as MT, with what precedes: Ezr 4:10 (del., as introduced by error from end of v 11), v 11 (joining to v 12) and now, let it be known, etc., v 17 f. and now, the letter which, etc., 7:12 f. and now, I make a decree, etc. (cf. וְעַתָּה similarly in letters 2 K 5:6; 10:2, and καὶ νῦν 2 Macc. 1:6).
(√ of foll.; v. BH III. ענה, עָנָו, עָנִי).

K§ 57 a) β) Str, or עֲנֵא cf. Buhl, M] adj. poor, needy;—pl. abs. עֲנָיִ֑ן (Baer Gi KI.c.), or עֲנָ֑יִן (van d. H. Buhl M77*; cf. D§ 39, 1) as n. Dn 4:24 the poor. Or [עֲנֵה]; v. Pognon Inscr. Sém. 173 A 1.
(√ of following; v. BH ענז, עֵז).
n.[f.] (she-)goat;—pl. עִזִּין Ezr 6:17.
n.[m.
n.[m.] bough (v. BH ענף);—pl. sf. עַנְפ֫וֹהִי Dn 4:9, 11(×2), 18.
(K§ 57 a) α)) n.[m.] amercing, confiscation (not 𝔗 Syriac; v. BH);—cstr. ע׳ נִכְסִין Ezr 7:26.
v. כְּעֶנֶת sub I. [עֲנָה].
(√ of foll.; 𝔗 עֲפָא Pa., Syriac ܥܦܳܐ Pa., enwrap, עֳפִי foliage, ܥܽܘܦܝܳܐ flower, etc., BH עפאים, עֳפָיִם as loan-word; cf. perhaps Assyrian upû, cloud(-mass)).
n.m. Dn 4:9 leafage, foliage;—sf. עָפְיֵהּ Dn 4:9, 11, 18.
vb. pain, grieve (𝔗 (rare); v. BH I. עצב);—
Pt. pass., as adj.: בְּקָל עֲצִיב Dn 6:21 a pained voice (cf. 𝔗 Est 4:1, 𝔗 J Ex 12:31).
(< ר—ָ K§ 59 c)) n.[m.] root, stock (√ עקר, v. BH, and, on meaning of √, SchwallyZMG iii (1898), 140);—cstr. ע׳ שָׁרְשׁ֫וֹהִי Dn 4:12, 20, 23.
vb. denom.
be rooted up;—Pf. 3 pl. (m.? v. K§ 23, 2) אִתְעֲקַ֫רוּ Kt, fpl. -רָה Qr, Dn 7:8.
v. ערר.
vb. mix (𝔗 (often); Syriac (rare); v. BH I. ערב);—
Pt. pass. מְעָרַב mixed with (ב) Dn 2:41, 43.
Pt. id.: מִתְעָרַב v 43 (עִם), pl. -רֲבִין v 43 (ב).
n.m. wild ass (𝔗 Syriac; √ ערד, perhaps = Arabic غرد give a cry NöSBWAk. cxlii. v. II. 1900, v. BH עָרוֹד as loan-word (KAramaismen 72, but dub. NöZMG lvii (1903), 413));—pl.emph. עֲרָדַיָּא Dn 5:21.
n.f. dishonour (√ ערה, BH be naked (q.v.), עֶרְוָה nakedness);—cstr. עַרְוַת Ezr 4:14.
(√ of foll., cf. BH II. צָרַר, iii. צַר).
n. m. foe (cf. JAram. עֲרָר objection; on dub. BH עָר v. p. 786);—pl. sf. עריך Kt (K§ 53 Anm. b)), עָרָךְ Qr Dn 4:16.
n.[m.] herbage, grass (v. BH עשׂב);—emph. עִשְׂבָּא, as fodder: Dn 4:12, 22, 29, 30; 5:21.
n. m. et f. a ten (v. BH);—m. (foll. n.f.) Dn 7:7, 20, 24; f. (before n.m.) v 24; תְּרֵי עֲשַׂר = twelve (foll. n.m.) 4:26 Ezr 6:17.
n.pl. indecl. twenty;—מְאָה וְע׳ Dn 6:2 (follows n.m.).

(K§§ 38, 1 α); 17, 2 Anm. 2) vb. think, plan (BH II. עשׁת (q.v.) as Aramaism; 𝔗 אִתְעַשֵּׁת, not Syriac);—Pf. 3 ms. (strictly Pt. pass. NöGGA 1884, 1019; Syriac Gr. § 280 M 78*) ע׳ Dn 6:4, sq. inf., plan to do so and so.
v. כְּעֶת.
adj. ready (v. BH I. עתד);—pl. עֲתִידִין Dn 3:15, sq. cl. c. דִּי.
adj. advanced, aged (BH (as Aramaism), √ עתק, q.v.);—cstr. (-מַיָּא) ע׳ יוֹמִין one advanced, aged, in days Dn 7:9, 13, 22 (cf. Syriac ܥܰܬܻܝܩ ܝܰܘ݇ܡܳܬܳܐ Ecclus 25:4 al., PS 3011).
Dn 3:26 v. נְפַק.
n.m. (Bab. or Pers.) governor (Assyrian loan-word, BH id.);—abs. פ׳ Ezr 5:14; cstr. פַּחַת Ezr 5:3, 6; 6:6, 7, 13; pl. emph. פַּתֲוָתָא Dn 3:2, 3, 27; 6:8.
n.m. potter (= paḫḫâr, 𝔗 פַּחָר (also clay), Syriac ܦܰܚܳܪܳܐ; prob. loan-wd. from Assyrian paḫâru, potter, cf. Brock ZimBuhl);—abs. פ׳ Dn 2:41.

n.[m.] a garment, meaning dub., tunic (Thes) or leggings SACJPhil. xxvi (1899), 309; (prob. later insertion in text id.ib. 311 ff.) (Talm (rare); √ פטשׁ spread out according to K§ 57 b) α));—pl. sf. פטישי הון Kt (prob. פְּטִי׳ K§§ 54, 3 a) α); 57, b) α), Kmpad loc. M 78* al. פַּטִּי׳), פַּטְּשֵׁיהוֹן Qr, Dn 3:21; conj. on meaning v. in Behrm Bev Dr M 78*.
vb. divide (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH (chiefly late));—
Pt. pass. fs. פְּלִיגָה תֶּהֱוֵה Dn 2:41 shall be divided.
n.[m.] half;—cstr. פ׳ Dn 7:25.
n.f. division;—sf. פְּלֻנָּֽתִהוֹן Ezr 6:18.
vb. pay reverence to, serve (deity) (cf. Assyrian palâḫu, fear, revere (and BH יָרֵא, פָּחַד etc.); Egyptian Aramaic פלח worship Lzb 351; 𝔗 פְּלַח serve, Syriac ܦܠܰܚ; Palm. פלחא soldier);—
pay reverence to deity (usually ל acc.): Impf. 3 mpl. יִפְלְחוּן Dn 3:28; 7:14, 27; so Pt. act. פָּלַח 6:17, 21, pl. פָּֽלְחִין 3:12, 14, 18, and (acc. dei) v 17.
pl. cstr. as n. פָּֽלְחֵי בֵית אֱלָהָא Ezr 7:24 servants of the house of God (+ priests, Nethinim, etc.).
n.[m.] service, worship;—cstr. פ׳ בֵּית אֱלָהָךְ Ezr 7:19.

n.m. Dn 7:8 mouth (cf. BH פֶּה; on form v. K§ 61, 2) M§ 76 f.);—פ׳ abs. Dn 7:8, 20, cstr. 4:28 +, sf. פֻּמֵּהּ (on form v. Kl.c. NöZur Gram. d. Class. Ar. 15 (1896) (expansion of biliteral √), BaZMG xli (1887), 633 f.) 7:5;—mouth of king Dn 4:28, lions 6:23, beast (in vision) 7:5, horn (ib.) v 8, 20; mouth of pit 6:18.
v. פסס.
n.[m.] a (triangular) stringed instrument (Gk. ψαλτήριον, Kraussi. 12, 99, 101; ii. 473 PrinceEB 3232 Dr Dn 58, and on 3, 5);—פ׳ Dn 3:7, פְּסַנְתֵּרִין v 5, 10, 15.
(√ of foll.; v. BH I. פסס, [פַּס]).
n.m. palm of hand;—cstr. Dn 5:5, emph. פַּסָּא v 24.
n.m. Dn 2:40 iron (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH בַּרְזֶל);—abs. Dn 2:33 (-זֶ֑ל), 4:12 +; emph. פַּרְזְלָא 2:34 +;—Dn 2:33, 34 + 11 times 2; 4:12, 20; 5:4, 23; 7:7, 19.
vb. break in two (v. BH פרס);—Peʿîl (WCG 224) Pf. 3 fs. פְּרִיסַת מַלְכוּתָךְ Dn 5:28.
(read פְּרָס? M 78* f.) prob. n.[m.] halfmina (NH פְּרָס, Old Aramaic פרס, פרש Lzb 354 SAC 99 Cooke 176, 406; v. מְנֵא and reff.);—abs. פ׳ Dn 5:28; pl. (וּ)פַרְסִין [read פְּרָסִין? v. Ml.c.] v 25.
n.pr. terr. et gent. Persia (as kingdom), Persians (v. BH id.)—;פ׳ Dn 6:9, 13, 16; פָּרָ֑ס 5:28; Ezr 4:24; 6:14.
adj. gent. Persian;—emph. פרסיא Kt, פְּרְסָאָה Qr (K§ 61, 6) Dn 6:29 the Persian.
vb. tear away, break off (v. BH [פָּרַק);—
Imv. ms. פְּרֻק Dn 4:24 (cf. Dr), acc. of sins + ב instr.
vb. make distinct (cf. BH (chiefly late));—
Pt. pass. Ezr 4:18 made distinct (BH Ne 8:8; 𝔗 NH).

n.m. Ezr 4:23 copy (𝔗 -שַׁגְנָא, Syriac ܦܰܪܫܰܓܢܳܐ; Aramaic loan-word in BH, where also פַּתְשֶׁגֶן id.; loan-word from Pers. (Thes1133; Add. 108), cf. Armen. patǧên, copy, GildemeisterZKM iv. 210 LagGes. Abh. 79; Armen. Stud. § 1838 MeyEnst. J. 22 HoffmZA ii. 52, OIran. *paticayan, id., according to AndrM 79*; not clear whether פַּר׳ is textual error for פת׳ (Hoffml.c.), or from diff. orig. (Andrl.c. paračayan? paricayan?), or from same √ in diff. stage (so appar. Scheft52, citing, for both, OBaktr. fra-sěṅhana, announcement, OIran. praśaṃsana, praśāsana, command, Arabic frasasti, command, patisêṅhana, answer, OP. *patithaṅhana, announcement, answer));—cstr. פ׳ Ezr 4:11, 23; 5:6.
vb. interpret (a dream) (𝔗 id., Syriac ܦܫܰܪ, perhaps EgyptianAramaic פשר Lzb355 SAC100 (Arabic فسّر loan-word, v. Frä263); Assyrian pašâru);—
Inf. לְמִפְשַׁר Dn 5:16, acc. cogn. פִּשְׁרִין.
Pt. act. מְפַשַּׁר Dn 5:12, acc. חֶלְמִין.

n.m. Dn 2:45 interpretation (of dream) (cf. BH as loan-word);—cstr. פ׳ Dn 4:3; 5:15, 26; 7:16; emph. פִּשְׁרָא 2:4 + 7 times Dn, + 4:15, 16 Kt (Qr. הּ—ֵ); ה—ָ 2:7; 5:12; sf. הּ—ֵ 2:5, 6(×2) + 11 times Dn, + Qr 4:15, 16 (Kt א—ָ); pl. פִּשְׁרִין 5:16.

n.m. Ezr 6:11 command, word, affair (Pers.: v. BH);—abs. פ׳ Dn 3:16; emph. -מָא Ezr 4:17 +;—command Ezr 6:11, word, by missive 5:7, from king 4:17 (both c. שְׁלַח), in answer 5:11 (c. התיב); weakened, thing, affair Dn 3:16; 4:14.
vb. open (v. BH);—
Pt. pass. fpl. פְּתִיחָן Dn 6:11 opened (windows). Peʿîl (WCG 225) Pf. 3 mpl. פְּתִ֫יחוּ 7:10 books were opened.
(√ of foll.; 𝔗 Syriac; BH פתה (rare)).
n.[m.] breadth (𝔗 Syriac; EgyptianAramaic RÉS246 S-CD 4);—sf. פְּתָיֵהּ Dn 3:1 Ezr 6:3.
vb. be inclined, desire, be pleased (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH 11 ׃צבה);—
desire: Pf. 1 s. צְבִית (K§ 47 Beisp. 1) α) NöGGA, 1884, 1019 pf. intrans.) Dn 7:19 (c. inf.).
be pleased, will (without hindrance), abs., of God: Impf. 3 ms. יִצְבֵּא 4:14, 22, 29; inf. sf. מִצְבְּיֵהּ v 32 according to his willing; of Neb.: Pt. act. צָבֵא 5:19(×4).
n.f. thing, anything (orig. purpose) (Palm. צבו Lzb357 SAC100 Cooke266, Syriac ܨܒܽܘܬܳܐ, all thing; cf. NH חֵפֶץ thing, from הָפֵץ delight in, crave);—Dn 6:18.
vb. dip, wet (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH I. צבע;—Pa. Pt. act. pl. מְצַבְּעִין Dn 4:22 wet thee (ל), + מִטַּל. Hithpa. Impf. יִצְטַבַּע (also -בַּ֑ע); be wet, c. בְּטַל 4:12, 20, מִטַּל v 30; 5:21.)
(√ of foll.; cf. BH II. צבע).
n.f. 1. finger; 2. toe (𝔗 Syriac; BH id.);—pl.
abs. אֶצְבְּעָן Dn 5:5
emph. תָא—ָ 2:41; cstr. ת—ָ v 42.
n.[m.] side (very rare in Aramaic; perhaps Hebr., v. BH id., √ צדד);—cstr., c. prep.: לְצ׳ עליא Dn 7:25, i.e. against; מִצּ׳ מַלְכוּתָא 6:5, i.e. arising from, touching.
n.[m.] usually (malicious) purpose (Hebraism from BH צְדִיָּה, √ I. צדה);—c. ה interrog. הַצְדָּא Dn 3:14; < read הַאַזְדָּא Bev Dr Kmp.
n.f. right doing (Talm, Old Aramaic; v. BH צְדָקָה, √ צדק);—צ׳ Dn 4:24.
n.m. neck (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH sub I. צור);—sf. צַוְּארָךְ Dn 5:16, צַוְּארֵהּ v 7, 29.)
vb.

pray (orig. bow in prayer) (𝔗 id., bow, Pa, pray, so Syriac ܨܠܴܐ and Pa.; Assyrian ṣullû, entreat (appar. not of prayer to gods ZimKAT3. 610 f.); Arabic صَلًا middle of the back, صلا ii. pray, Ethiopic ጸለወ bow, ጸለየ pray; Sab. צלות shrine HomChr 125; AA 185);—Pt. מְצַלֵּא Dn 6:11 (abs.); pl. מְצַלַּ֫יִן (K§ 47 a)) Ezr 6:10 (c. ל in behalf of).
vb. prosper (v. BH 11. צלח);—
Pf. 3 ms. הַצְלַח Dn 3:30; 6:29; Pt. מַצְלַח Ezr 5:8, pl. -לְחִין 6:14;—)
cause to prosper Dn 3:30 (c. ל pers.).
shew prosperity, be properous 6:29 (of pers.); have success (in building) Ezr 6:14; be successful (of work) 5:8 (בְּיֶדְהֹם).
n.m. Dn 2:31 image (v. BH צלם);—abs. צ׳ Dn 2:31; 3:1; cstr. צ׳ 3:19, צֶ֫לֶם v 5 +; emph. צַלְמָא 2:31 +;—image Dn 2:31(×2), 32, 34, 35; 3:1 + 10 times 3; צ׳ אַנְפּוֹהִי 3:19 i.e. his expression.
n.f. Dn 4:18 (cf. K. p. 165, Anm. 3 bird (v. BH 11. צפר);—pl. abs. צִפֲּרִין Dn 4:30, emph. צִפְּרַיָּא v 11, cstr. צִפֲּרִי v 9, 18.
n.m. he-goat (v. BH V. צפר);—pl. cstr. צְפִירֵי עִזִּין Ezr 6:17.
v. [קוּם].
(√ of following, be in front of).

subst. front, as prep. in front of, before, because of; sq. דִּי as conj. because that (perhaps in form a dimin., Bev Dn 2:8; 𝔗 קְבֵיל, c. לְ, לִקְבֵיל, sf. לְקִבְלִי, etc., in front of (Dalm§ 47:7); Syriac ܩܒܽܘܠ, ܩܽܘܒܠܴܐ aspect, ܡܶܢ ܩܒܽܘܠ in front, ܠܽܘܩܒܰܠ, sf. ܠܩܽܘܒܠܶܗ in front (of), opposite (to), cf. Gn 15:10 𝔗 𝔖; Palm. לקבל before (Cooke321, cf. 193));—cstr. לָקֳבֵל Dn 2:8 + sf. לְקָבְלָךְ †2:31;—
c. לְ:

Dn 3:3 לק׳ צַלְמָא before the image, 2:31; 5:1, 5; in view of, by reason of, 5:10 לק׳ מִלֵּי מַלְכָּא by reason of the words, etc., Ezr 4:16 לָקֳבֵל דְּנָה (cf. EgyptianAramaic לקבל זנה זי, RÉS361 B 5).
sq. דִּי as conj. because that Ezr 6:13 (so Palm. CISii. 164).

c. בֹּל, כָּל־קֳבֵל in view of, because of (but read probably כְּלָקֳבֵל according to the front of, i.e. having regard to, because of: LuzzChald. Gr. § 123 LambertRÉJ, 1895, 47 f. Marti§ 95 d NöLCB, 1896, 703 NesOLZ, 1902, 487 Strack56 al.; cf. BH I. עֻמָּה d):
as prep. כָּל־קֳבֵל דְּנָה because of this, therefore, †Dn 2:12, 24; 3:7, 8; 6:10 Ezr 7:17; Dn 3:22 pointing forwards, כָּל־קֳבֵל דִּנָה מִן־דִּי וג׳ on this account, (viz.) because that, etc.

sq. דִּי as conj. because that, inasmuch as, Dn 2:8 כָּל־קֳבֵל (כְּלָקֳבֵל) דִּי חֲזֵיתוּן because ye see, v 10, 41, 45 +, Ezr 4:14; 7:14; Dn 5:22 = although. In Dn 2:40; 6:11 taken by 𝔊 (ὃν τρόπον, καθώς), Ges (Thes, not Lex), Ew Hi as = according as (as Ec 5:15 𝔗 כל קבל דאתא according as he came), but not Bev Behrm Marti. [Occas. in 𝔗, usually = before; cf. in 𝔗J Gn 28:17; 31:32, D§§ 47. 7; 50].
vb. denom.

receive (BH (late), q.v.; 𝔗 Syriac: proposes come in front of, come to meet, cf. Germ. entgegennehmen);—Pf. 3 ms. קַבֵּל Dn 6:1; Impf. 2 mpl. תְּקַבְּלוּן ye shall receive 2:6, 3 mpl. וִיקַבְּלוּן 7:18; all c. acc. rei.

prep. before (so Old Aramaic Nab. Palm. etc. (Lzb360 f.), 𝔗 קָדָם, Syriac ܩܕܳܡ; proposes a subst. the front, cf. Arabic قُدَّام the front; for √ v. BH קדם);—sf. קֳדָמַי Dn 2:9 +, -מָ֑י v 6; קדמיך Kt, קֳדָמָךְ Qr, †5:23; 6:23; קֳדָמוֹהִי 4:5 + (cf. Nerab קדמוה, Cooke189); 3 fs. קדמיה Kt, קֳדָמַהּ Qr, †7:7, 8, 20; קֳדָמֵיהוֹן †4:4;—

before (= Heb. לִפְנֵי), especially in the phrases to answer, pray, say etc., before a superior (as more respectful than to), Dn 2:9 לְמֵאמַר קֳדָמַי, v 10, 11, 27; 6:11 (v. Dr), v 12, 13, 14; קֱרִי ק׳ Ezr 4:18, 23; 5:23(×2); with שְׁפַר to seem fair Dn 3:32; 6:2; after vbs. of motion, in before, Dn 2:24, 25; 3:13; 4:3 +; of time 7:7.

מִן־קֳדָם from before (= מִלִּפְנֵי, but as used in late Heb., Est 1:19; 4:8: p. 818a), c. קַבֵּל Dn 2:6, בְּעָא v 18; of a decree, 6:27 מִן־קֳדָמַי שִׂים טְעֵם (‖ מִנִּי 3:29 +), cf 2:15 Ezr 7:14; of God, Dn 5:24 מִן־קֳדָמוֹהִי שְׁלִיחַ פַּסָּא דִּי־יְדָא, 7:10 (so very often in 𝔗, DrSm lxx. f., lxxiii). Also = Heb. מִפְּנֵי, with to fear Dn 5:19; 6:27, be rooted up 7:8 fall v 20.
n.f. former time (cf. BH קַדְמָה, Zinj. קדמה (Cooke177), former state);—cstr. Dn 6:11 מִן־קַדְמַת דְּנָה = before this, formerly; so Ezr 5:11 מִקַּדְמַת דְּ׳. cf. Gn 28:19 𝔗J, Ez 38:17 𝔗.
adj. former, first (so Nab. Palm. 𝔗 Syriac);—fs. emph. קַדְמָֽיְתָא the first Dn 7:4, fpl. emph. קַרְנַיָּא קַדְמָיָתָא the former horns v 8, mpl. emph. קַדְמָיֵא v 24.
(√ of foll.; 𝔗 Syriac; v. BH id., קָדוֹשׁ).

adj. holy;—abs. ק׳ Dn 4:10, 20; pl. שִׁין 4:5 +, cstr. -שֵׁי 7:18 +;—gods Dn 4:5, 6, 15; 5:11; as subst., of angels 4:10, 14, 20; of Isr. (as holy ones, saints) 7:21, 22, קַדִּישֵׁי עֶלְיוֹנִין saints of the Most High v 18, 22, 25, 27.
(√ of following; BH קול, קוֹל).
n.m. Dn 4:28 voice (𝔗 Syriac);—ק׳ abs. Dn 4:28; 6:21, cstr. sound of words 7:11, instr. 3:5, 7, 10, 15.

vb. arise, stand (v. BH);—Pe Pf. 3 ms. קָם Dn 3:24, 3 mpl. קָ֫מוּ Ezr 5:2; Impf. 3 ms. יְקוּם Dn 6:20; 7:24, 3 fs. תְּקוּם 2:39, 44; 3 mpl. יְקוּמוּן 7:10, 17, 24 (יְקֻ׳); Imv. 2 fs. קוּמִי Dn 7:5; Pt. קָאֵם 2:31, pl. קאמין Kt, קָֽיְמִין Qr, 3:3, emph. קָֽאֲמַוָּא 7:16;—
arise Dn 3:24 (from throne), 6:20 (from bed).
come on scene of history: kingdom 2:39, king 7:17, 24 (both מִן of source), v 24.
arise (out of inaction), and build Ezr 5:2, devour Dn 7:5b.
stand, lit., לָקֳבֵל pers. 2:31, cf. 3:3, קֱדָם pers. 7:10; pt. as n., those standing (there) v 16.
endure, of kingdom 2:44.
set up, establish an ordinace (קְיָם): Inf. לְקַיָּמָה 6:8.

(K§ 45, 4) Pf. 3 ms. הֲקֵים Dn 3:2 +, וַהֲקִים 6:2, sf. הֱקִימֵהּ 5:11, אֲקִימֵהּ 3:1; 3 fs. הֱקִמַת 7:5; 2 ms. הֲקֵימְתָּ 3:12, 18; 1 s. הֲקֵ֫ימֶת לָא 3:14; Impf. 3 ms. יְהָקֵים (K§ 45, b)) 5:21; 6:16, יְקִים 2:44; 4:14; Inf. sf. לַהֲקָמוּתֵהּ 6:4; Pt. act. מְהָקֵים 2:21;—
set up, lit. image 3:1, 2, 3(×2), 5, 7, 12, 14, 18; fig. kings 2:21, kingdom v 44.
lift up one side 7:5a (Dr).
establish, c. acc. קְיָם 6:16 (= Pa.), אֱסָרָא v 9.
appopint Ezr 6:18, 2 acc. Dn 5:11; sf. pers. + עַל 6:4, ל acc. pers. + עַל 4:14; 5:21; 6:2.
Pf. 3 fs. הֳקִימַת (variants in Str; cf. K§ 45, 5; not Hebraism Nö GGA 1867, 1784; WCG 225, 253) 7:4 be made to stand עַל־רָגְלַיִן.
n. [m.] statute (Egyptian Aramaic קימיהם Cooke 209);—abs. Dn 6:16, cstr. v 8.
adj. enduring (cf. Nab. קים (Cooke 217 Lzb קָיֵם; SAC, privately, prob. קַיָּם));—abs. ק׳ Dn 6:27 (of God, so often 𝔗 NH, cf. Dr); fs. קַיָּמָה 4:23 (of kingdom).
vb. slay (𝔗 Syriac (often); v. BH (late, rare));—
Pt. act. קָטֵל Dn 5:19, acc. pers. Peʿîl be slain: Pf. 3 ms. קְטִיל 5:30, 3 fs. קְטִילַת 7:11.
slay: Pf. 3 ms. קַטִּל 3:22 (acc. pers.); Inf. לְקַטָּלָה 2:14 (ל acc. pers.).
be slain: Inf. לְהִתְקְטָלָה 2:13; Pt. (= gerundive, K§ 76, 3) pl. מִתְקַטְלִין v 13 were to be slain.
(√ of foll.; 𝔗 קְטַר, Syriac ܩܛܰܪ bind, whence קִטְרָא, ܩܶܛܪܳܐ knot, etc.; cf. BH II. [קטר]).

n.m. Dn 5:6 joint, knot;—lit. pl. cstr. קִטְרֵי Dn 5:6 joints of his loin; fig. abs. קִטְרִין v 12, 16, usually knotty things, difficulties (Syriac PS 3591); but prob. of magic spells, banns (also Syriac PS l.c., cf. Brock 319 b), so Bev, v. also Dr.
n. [m.] summer (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH II. קיץ);—abs. ק׳ Dn 2:35.
v. קום.
Kt, קַתְרֹס Qr, n. [m.] lyre, zither (also 𝔗; loan-word from Gk. κίθαρις Krauss i. 193; ii. 573);—Dn 3:5, 7, 10, 15; Kmp קִיתָרִס.
v. קול.
vb. acquire, buy (v. BH I. קנה);—
Impf. 2 ms. תִּקְנֵא Ezr 7:17 c. acc. rei, + בְּכַסְפָּא.
(√ of following; BH I. קצה, קָצֶה).
n.f. end (so BH (late); 𝔗 (Gn 47:2); not Syriac; cf. Egyptian Aramaic RÉS361 A4);—cstr. לְק׳ at the end of (months, days) Dn 4:26, 31; מִן־ק׳מַלְכוּתָא 2:43 = part of (‖ מִנַּהּ v d; cf. BH קְצָת 2).
vb. be wroth (Syriac; v. BH I. קצף);—
Pf. 3 ms. ק׳ Dn 2:12.
n. [m.] wrath (of God) (only Syriac ܩܨܳܦܳܐ sadness, anxiety, in Lexx.);—abs. ק׳ Ezr 7:23.
v. קצא.
vb. call, read out, aloud (v. BH I. קרא);—
Impf. 3 ms. יִקְרֵה Dn 5:7, 1 s. אֶקְרֵא v 17; 3 mpl. יִקְרוֹן v 15; Inf. לְמִקְרֵא v 8, 16; Pt. act. קָרֵא 3:4 +;—
call, proclaim, בְּהַיִל: Dn 3:4; 4:11; 5:7.
read out, aloud, acc. כְּתָבָא 5:7, 8, 15, 16, v 17 (ל pers.). Peʿîl (WCG 225) Pf. 3 ms. קֱרִי Ezr 4:18, 23 it was read, קֳדָם pers.
be summoned, Impf. 3 ms. יִתְקְרֵי Dn 5:12.
vb. approach (v. BH I. קרב);—
Pf. 3 ms. ק׳ Dn 3:26 (ל loc.); 1 s. קִרְבֵת 7:16 (עַל pers.); abs., 3 mpl. קְּרִ֫בוּ Dn 3:8; 6:13; Inf. sf. כְּמִקְרְבֵהּ 6:21 when he approached, ל loc.
offer sacrifice: Impf. 2 ms. תְּקָרֵב Ezr 7:17, c. acc. + עַל of altar.
= Pa.: c. acc. Pf. 3 mpl. הַקְרִ֫בוּ Ezr 6:17, Pt. act. מְהַקְרְבִין v 10 (ל dei).
bring near: Pf. sf. הַקְרְבוּהִי Dn 7:13 (קֳדָם dei).
(K§ 57 a)) n.[m.] war (𝔗 Syriac NH id.; BH as Aramaism);—abs. Dn 7:21.
-ָא, n.f. city (𝔗 Syriac; S-C A 9 + קריה; v. BH, √ קרה; also Nö Beitr. 62);—abs. ה—ָ Ezr 4:10, א—ָ v 15; emph. קִרְיְתָא v 12, 13, 15(×2), 16, 19, 21
n.f. Dn 7:8 horn (v. BH קרן);—abs. ק׳ Dn 7:8; emph. קַרְנָא 3:5 +; du. (often!) קַרְ֫נַיִן 7:7; emph. -נַיָּא 7:8 +;—
instr. of music, Dn 3:5, 7, 10, 15.
symbolic, in vision, 7:7, 8(×3), 11, 20(×2), 21, 24.

n. [m.] piece (𝔗; v. BH קרץ);—pl. sf. קַרְצ֫וֹהִי Dn 6:25, -צֵיהוֹן 3:8, both in phr. אֲכַ֫לוּ ק׳, i.e. accuse maliciously (so 𝔗 Syriac PS 3756 (cf. Old Aramaic אמר כרצי פ׳ Lzb 299 SAC 66 Cooke 205 f.; כרץ also Mand.), prob. borrowed from Assyrian karṣe akâlu, malign, slander (often; also TelAm.); cf. also uḳtarrizu Ḫamm Law 161; further Arabic أَكَلَ لَحْمَهُ id., and kindred phr.; Ethiopic በሊዐ: ሥጋ: Di 489).
n. [m.] truth (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH קֹשְׁטְ (once, Aramaism));—abs. Dn 4:34; מִן־ק׳ 2:47 of a truth.
v. קיתרס.
(√ of foll.; not Aramaic; BH רָאָה see).
n.m. appearance (𝔗, rare);—sf. רֵוֵהּ Dn 2:31; 3:25.

n.m. Dn 7:6 head (Egyptian Aramaic, S-CPap.; Palm. רש; 𝔗 רֵישׁ, Syriac ܪܺܝܫ; BH רֹאשׁ);—cstr. ר׳ Dn 7:1; emph. ה—ָ 2:38; sf. רֵאשִׁי 4:2 +, ךְ—ָ 2:28, הּ—ֵ v 32 +, הּ—ַ 7:20, הוֹן—ֵ 3:27; pl. abs. רֵאשִׁין 7:6, sf. רָאשֵׁיהֹם (K§§ 53, Anm. b); 63 Gu Hpt ad loc.) Ezr 5:10;—
head of man Dn 3:27, cf. 7:9; in vision: of image 2:32, 38, beast 7:6, 20.
head as seat of visions, הֶזְוֵי רֵאשָׁךְ, etc., 2:28; 4:2, 7, 10; 7:1, 15.
= chief, בְּר׳ Ezr 5:10 in the capacity of their chiefs.
sum, essential content, of matters Dn 7:1 (NesMM 40 beginning).
(√ of foll.; v. BH I. רבב, רַב, רִבּוֹ).
adj. great (𝔗 Syriac);—abs. Dn 2:31 +, cstr. v 14 +; emph. m. רַבָּא Ezr 4:10 +; f. רַבְּתָא Dn 4:27; mpl. redupl. רַבְרְבִין (K§ 59, 4) 3:33, fpl. -בָן 2:48 +, emph. תָא—ָ 7:11, 17;—
great, lit., of image Dn 2:31, rock v 35, city 4:27, sea 7:2, beast v 3, 17, teeth v 7, gifts 2:48; great, imposing, feast 5:1, signs 3:33, words 7:8, 11, 20; c. מִן comp. 7:20.
fig. of power, influence, etc.: great king 2:10 Ezr 4:10; 5:11 (cf. Zinj. מלכן רברבן Cooke 183), God 5:8 Dn 2:45.
as n. = captain, chief: רַב טַבָּחַיָּא Dn 2:14, ר׳ סִגְנִין v 48, ר׳ חַרְטֻמַּיָּא 4:6; 5:11.
(K§ 65, 4) n.f. myriad (𝔗 Syriac);—cstr. ר׳ + pl. רבון Kt (read רִבְּוָן Kl.c.), רִבְבָן Qr Dn 7:10 a myriad myriads.
n.m. lord, noble (cf. 𝔗 Syriac);—pl. sf. רַבְרְבָּנַי Dn 4:33 my lords (of Neb.); נ֫וֹהִי- (of Belshazzar) 5:1, 2, 3, 9, 10, of Darius 6:18; -ניך Kt, -נָךְ Qr (K§ 53, Anm. b)) of Belshazzar 5:23.
vb. grow great (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH I. רבה);—

Pf. 3 ms. ר׳ Dn 4:8 +; 3 fs. רְבָת v 19; 2 ms. רְבַיְתָ Kt (> רְבַת Qr K§ 47, Beisp. 1) a)) v 19;—grow tall and large, of tree Dn 4:8, 17; grow long, of hair v 30; fig. grow great, of king v 19, increase, of greatness v 19.
make great: Pf. 3 ms. רַבִּי 2:48 c. ל acc. pers.
n.f. greatness (𝔗 Syriac);—abs. ר׳ Dn 4:33, emph. רְבוּתָא 5:18 +, sf. -תָךְ 4:19;—greatness of king Dn 4:19, 33; 5:18, 19; of kingdom 7:27.
(v. BH אַרְבַּע, רְבִיעִי, √ רבע).
n.m. et f. four;—
m.: bef. n.fpl. Dn 7:2, 3; n.fs. א׳ מְאָה Ezr 6:17; after n.fpl. Dn 7:6; as pred. אַרְבַּ֑ע v 17.
f.: bef. n.m.pl. Dn 7:6, 17; after n.m.pl. 3:25.
adj. num. ord. fourth;—f. abs. רביעיא Kt, רְבִיעָאָה Qr (K§ 66, 1) Dn 2:40; 3:25; 7:7, 23; emph. רְבִיעָֽיְתָא v 19, 23.
etc. v. רַב supr.
v. רבב.
vb.
enrage (cf. BH);—Pf. 3 mpl. הַרְגִּ֫זוּ Ezr 5:12, c. acc. לָאֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא.
n.m. rage;—abs. Dn 3:13 (of king).

n. [f.] foot (v. BH);—du. abs. רַגְ֫לַיִן Dn 7:4; emph. -לַיָּא 2:41, 42; sf. -לוֹ֫הִי v 33, 34, רבליה Kt, רְגַלַהּ Qr (K§ 53, 2, Anm. b)) 7:7, 19;—feet; in vision, of image Dn 2:33, 34, 41, 42, of beast 7:4, 7, 19.
vb. be in tumult (𝔗; Syriac (rare; usually feel, perceive); v. BH (late, rare));—
shew tumultuousness, come thronging: Pf. 3 mpl. הַרְגִּ֫שׁוּ c. עַל pers. Dn 6:7, 16, abs. v 12.
v. [רֵו] sub ראה.
(√ of foll.; v. BH id., רוּחַ, רֵיחַ).
n.f. Dn 5:12 wind, spirit;—ר׳ abs. Dn 5:12; 6:4, cstr. 4:5 +, emph. רוּחָא 2:35; sf. רוּחִי 7:15, הּ—ֵ 5:20; pl. cstr. רוּחֵי 7:2;—
wind Dn 2:35; 7:2.
spirit:
of man, 5:20; 7:15; as faculty of knowledge, ר׳ יַתִּירָא 5:12; 6:4.
ר׳ אֱלָהִין קַדִּישִׁין 4:5, 6, 15; 5:11, ר׳ א׳ v 14.
n.f. smell;—cstr. ר׳ נוּר Dn 3:27.
vb. rise (v. BH);—
Pf. intr. רִם Dn 5:20 lifted up, of heart, i.e. presumptuous. Pōʿl. extol: Pt. מְרוֹמֵם 4:34 (ל dei).
exalt: Pt. מָרִים 5:19 (acc. pers.). Hithpōʿl. lift oneself up against, Pf. 2 ms. הִתְרוֹמַמְתָּ 5:23 (על dei).
n.m. Dn 4:7 height;—sf. רוּמֵהּ, of temple Ezr 6:3, image Dn 3:1, tree in vision 4:7, 8, 17.

n.m. Dn 2:18 secret (𝔗 id., Syriac ܪܳܙ, ܐܪܳܙ, ܪܳܐܙܳܐ; Pers. loan-word; = Phlv. rāž, N Pers. rāz AndrM 83 *);—abs. ר׳ Dn 4:6, emph. רָזָא 2:18, 19, 27, 30, 47; pl. abs. רָזִין v 28, 47, emph. רָזַיָּא v 29.
n.pr.m. Persian official Ezr 4:8 (usually expl. from √ רחם, v. BH, p. 933; Scheft92 thinks poss. orig. רוחם, OIran. n.pr. rukma, = splendour).
n. [m.] pl. intens. compassion (BH רַחֲמִים, √ I. רחם);—abs. ר׳ Dn 2:18.
vb. trust (𝔗 id., Chr-Pal. ܪܚܨ SchwallyIdiot. 126 SchulthLex. 193; Assyrian raḫâṣu; Arabic رَخُصَ ii. have indulgence, permission);—
set one’s trust upon (עַל dei) Pf. 3 mpl. הִתְרְחִ֫צוּ Dn 3:28.
(√ of following; v. BH רחק, רָחוֹק).
adj. far;—pl. abs. רְחִיקִין הֲווֹ מִן־תַּמָּה Ezr 6:6, i.e. keep aloof.
v. רוח.
vb. cast, throw (v. BH I. רמה (rare));—
Pf. 3 mpl. רְמוֹ Dn 6:17, 25; 1 pl. רְמֵ֫ינָא 3:24; Inf. לְמִרְמֵא v 20 Ezr 7:24;—
cast, acc. pers. + ל loc. Dn 3:24; 6:25; acc. pers. om. v 17 3:20.
fig. throw (burden of) tribute, עַל pers., Ezr 7:24.
Pf. 3 mpl. רְמִיו (WCG 225):
were cast, subj. pers. c. ל loc., Dn 3:21.
were placed, set, 7:9 (cf. 𝔗 Je 1:15 Dr, and BH ירה 2).
be cast, subj. pers. c. ל loc.: Impf. 3 ms. יִתְרְמֵא Dn 3:6, 11; 6:8, 13; 2 mpl. תִּתְרְמוֹן 3:15.
(√ of following; cf. BH III. רעה).
n.f. good pleasure, will;—cstr. רְעוּת of king Ezr 5:17, of God 7:18.
n. m. Dn 4:16 thought;—pl. cstr. רַעְיוֹנֵי לִבְבָךְ Dn 2:30; sf. -נַי 7:28; -ניך Kt, -נָךְ Qr (K§ 53 Anm. b)) 2:29; 5:10, רַעְיֹנֹ֫הִי 4:16; 5:6.
adj. flourishing (perhaps loan-word from BH רַעֲנָן luxuriant, √ רען);—fig. of pers. Dn 4:1 (cf. BH ψ 92:15).
vb. crush, shatter (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH רצץ);—
Impf. 3 fs. (וְ)תֵרֹעַ Dn 2:40 (obj. om.).
Pt. act. מְרָעַע 2:40 (acc. rei).
vb. tread, trample (cf. BH (late));—
Pt. act. fs. בּרגליה רָֽסְפָה, c. acc. rei Dn 7:7, 19.
vb. inscribe, sign (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH (once, late));—

Pf. 3 ms. ר׳ Dn 6:10; 2 ms. רְשַׁ֫מָתָּ v 13, רְשַׁ֑מְתָּ v 14; Impf. 2 ms. (וְ)תִרְשֻׁם v 9;—inscribe (prob. with one’s name, i.e.) sign, acc. כְּתָבָא Dn 6:9, 10, אֱסָר v 13, 14. Peʿîl Pf. 3 ms. רְשִׁים, subj. כְּתָבָא:
be inscribed, written, Dn 5:24, 25.
be signed 6:11.

(> van d. H. ס׳, v. Baer) n. [f.] trigon, mus. instr. (whence prob. Gk. σαμβύκη, triang. instr. with four strings, v. Thes LewyFremdw. 161 f. PrinceEB 3238 Dr Dn 3:5; also BH שְׂבָכָה lattice-work, √ שׂבך, cf. Syriac ܣܒܰܟ );—Dn 3:5, 7, 10, 15.
vb. grow great (𝔗 ס׳, Syriac ܣܐ; v. BH שׂנא (Aramaism in Job));—
Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׂגֵּא, of injury Ezr 4:22; שְׁלָֽמְכוֹן יִשְׂ׳ Dn 3:31; 6:26.
adj. great, much;—abs. שׂ׳ Dn 2:6 +, fpl. שַׂגִּיאָן 2:48 Ezr 5:11;—
great, of image Dn 2:31 (in vision), height of tree 4:7 (id.); of honour 2:6.
much, fruit 4:9, 18, flesh 7:5; pl. many, years Ezr 5:11, gifts Dn 2:48.
as adv. exceedingly, 2:12; 5:9; 6:15, 24; 7:28.

n.f. testimony (√ שְׂהַד = 𝔗 סְהַד testify, Syriac ܣܗܶܕ, Arabic شَهِدَ testify, cf. BH [שָׂהֵד] (once, as loan-wd.) KAram. 86; Egyptian Aramaic pl. שהדיא witnesses, Cooke404 S-CA 15 + often);—emph. שָֽׂהֲדוּתָא Gn 31:47 (‖ BH עֵד).
vb. set, make (v. BH; for Pers. infl. on usage cf. Scheft65);—
Pf. 3 ms. שָׂם Ezr 5:3 +, sf. שָׂמֵהּ 5:14; 2 ms. שַׂ֫מְתָּ Dn 3:10; 1 s. שָׂ֫מֶת טְעֵם Ezr 6:12; 3 mpl. שָׂמוּ Dn 3:12; Imv. mpl. שִׂ֫ימוּ Ezr 4:21;—
make, acc. טְעֵם = make decree Dn 3:10; Ezr 6:1, 12, + vb. fin. v 3, + inf. 4:21; 5:13 and (c. ל pers.) v 3, 9.
make, appoint, one’s name Dn 5:12 (2 acc.), one to office Ezr 5:14 (2 acc.).

set, fix, acc. בָּל mind, Dn 6:15 (c. inf.); acc. טְעֵם 3:12; 6:14 pay due regard (טְעֵם) to (עַל pers.). Peʿîl. 3 ms. מִנִּי שִׂים טְעֵם Ezr 4:19 from me a decree is made, so 5:17; 6:8, 11; 7:13, 21; Dn 3:29; 4:3; 6:27; lit. 3 fs. שֻׂמַת (read prob. שִׂימַת K§ 45, Beisp. 1. d)) 6:18 (of stone, עַל loc.).
be made: Impf. 3 ms. יִתְּשָׂם Ezr 4:21 (of decree, טְעֵם c. מִן agent); 3 mpl. יִתְּשָׂמוּן Dn 2:5 subj. rei + n. pred. be made into; Pt. מִתְּשָׂם Ezr 5:8 lit. be set, laid, of wood, ב of wall.
n.m. side (Egyptian Aramaic S-CA 5; 𝔗 סְטַר, סִטְרָא, Syriac ܣܶܛܪܳܐ, Chr-Pal. ܣܛܪ SchulthLex. 134, cf. SchwallyIdiot. 62, 122; Arabic شَطْرٌ half);—abs. שׂ׳ Dn 7:5 (of beast in vision).
vb. be hoary (v. BH);—
Pt. pl. as subst. = elders, term. techn., abs. שָׂבֵי יְהוּדָיֵא Ezr 5:5; 6:7, 8, 14; so emph. שָׂבַיָּא 5:9.
vb.
consider, contemplate (v. BH I. שׂכל);—Pt. מִשְׂתַּכַּל Dn 7:8 (ב rei).
(K§ 61, 4)) n.f. insight;—Dn 5:11, 12, 14.
vb. hate (𝔗 סְנָא, Syriac ܣܢܳܐ; v. BH שָׂנֵא);—
Pt. pl. sf. שׂנאיך Kt, שָֽׂנְאָךְ Qr (K§ 53, 2, Anm. b)) Dn 4:16 = thy foes (BH 3, MI4 Sab).
n.m. Dn 3:27 hair, of head (𝔗 ס׳, Syriac ܣܐ; v. BH I. שׂער);—cstr. Dn 3:27; 7:9; sf. שַׁעְרֵהּ 4:30.
vb. ask (v. BH);—
Pf. 3 ms. שׁ׳ Dn 2:10; pl. שְׁאֵ֫לְנָא Ezr 5:9, 10; Impf. 3 ms. sf. יִשְׁאֲלֶנְכוֹן Ezr 7:21; Pt. act. שָׁאֵל Dn 2:11, 27;—
ask for, request, acc. rei Dn 2:10 (ל pers.), v 11, 27 Ezr 7:21 (sf. pers.).
inquire about, for, acc. rei Ezr 5:9 (ל pers.); sq. orat. rect. v 10 (id.).
n.f. affair (weakened from question, inquiry, cf. Dr);—emph. שְׁאֵלְתָּא Dn 4:14.

n.m. Ezr 7:20 rest, remainder (v. BH I. שׁאר; Egyptian Aramaic n. שאר Cooke203, vb. ישתאר be left (outstanding) Cooke404 = S-CL 9, Chr-Pal. ܫܐܪ );—שׁ׳ abs. Ezr 4:10 +, cstr. v 9 +; emph. שְׁאָרָא Dn 7:7, 19;—of a thing, remainder Ezr 7:18, 20; of cities 4:10, 17, of persons v 9, 10, 17; 6:16 Dn 2:18, of beasts 7:7, 12, 19.
(√ of foll.; cf. BH II. שׁבב).
n.[m.] flame;—emph. שְׁבִיבָא דִּי נוּרָא Dn 3:22; pl. abs. שְׁבִבִין דִּי נוּר 7:9.
vb.

laud, praise (𝔗 Syriac; v. BH II. שׁבח (Aramaism));—Pf. 2 ms. שַׁבַּ֑הְתָּ Dn 5:23, 1 s. שַׁבְּחֵת 4:31, 3 mpl. שַׁבַּ֫חוּ 5:4; Pt. act. מְשַׁבַּח 2:23; 4:34;—praise, c. ל dei Dn 2:23; 4:31, 34; ל of idols 5:4, 23.
n.m. tribe (BH שֵׁבֶט, √ שׁבט);—pl. cstr. שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל Ezr 6:17.

only שִׁבְעָה n.f. seven (BH I. שֶׁבַע);—abs. שׁ׳ bef. n.m. pl. Dn 4:13, 20, 22, 29; cstr. שִׁבְעַת bef. n.m. pl. Ezr 7:14; חַד שִׁבְעָה עַל־דִּי Dn 3:19 seven times above what (more than), v. חַד, √ אחד.
vb. leave, let alone (𝔗 שְׁבַק, Syriac ܫܒܰܩ; cf. BH, p. 990);—
Inf. לְמִשְׁבַּק Dn 4:23 leave roots, so Imv. mpl. שְׁבֻ֫קוּ v 12, 20 (both c. ב loc.); Ezr 6:7 let alone, c. ל acc. rei.
Impf. 3 fs. תִּשְׁתִּבִק Dn 2:44 be left (of kingdom, + ל gent.).
vb.

be perplexed (𝔗 id., entangle, beguile, NH שָׁבַשׁ confuse, dis-arrange; cf. Assyrian šabâšu, turn, about; Syriac ܫܰܒܶܫ flatter, allure, SchulthHom. Wurz. 90; so Mand. Pa. שב֘ש NöM 49; cf. Arabic شَوَّشَ (as loan-word Nöl.c.) confuse);—Pt. pl. מִשְׁתַּבְּשִׁין Dn 5:9.
n.f. (royal) consort (cf. BH id.; √ unknown HptGu Ezr-Ne, p. 66 conj. Assyrian šigrêti, harem-women);—pl. sf. שֵֽׁגְלָתָךְ Dn 5:23, שֵֽׁגְלָתֵהּ v 2, 3.
vb.

struggle, strive (𝔗 id. Pa. wrestle, Ithpa. be recalcitrant, also שְׁדַל Ithpa. strive, and so NH שָׁדַל (ל for ר), Syriac ܫܕܰܠ beguile, especially Pa., v. NöZMG xl (1886), 735);—Pt. מִשְׁתַּדַּר Dn 6:15 he was striving, sq. Inf.
n.m. revolt;—abs. Ezr 4:15, 19.
n.pr.m. (cf. BH id.);—Dn 2:49; 3:12 + 11 times 3.
(√ of foll.; BH שׁדשׁ, שֵׁשׁ).
n.m. six;—abs. שִׁ֑ת after n.f. Dn 3:1; שְׁנָת־שֵׁת Ezr 6:15 year six = sixth year.
n. indecl. sixty;—אַמִּין שׁ׳ Ezr 6:3(×2); Dn 3:1; שְׁנִין שׁ׳ וְתַרְתֵּין 6:1.
vb. become like (BH I. שָׁוָה);—
Pf. 3 mpl. שַׁוִּיו Qr (v. וְ foll.; >Peʿîl שְׁוִי Kt, v. K§ 47 Beisp. 3, and p. 175) Dn 5:21, acc. rei, c. עִם.
vb.
be set, made (Pa. שַׁוִּי make, Cappadoc. Aramaic LzbEph. i. 67; cf. BH II. [שָׁוָה]);—Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׁתַּוִּ֑ה Dn 3:29, subj. rei + acc. be made into something (K§ 84, 3).
(√ of following; BH I. שׁוק, שׁוֹק).
n. [m.] lower leg;—pl. sf. שָׁקוֹ֫הִי Dn 2:33.
n.m. wall (cf. BH ii. שׁוּר id.; Egyptian Aramaic שור RÉS361 A 5, B 1);—pl. emph. שׁוּרַיָּה Ezr 4:16, א—ָ v 13; v 12 read שׁוּרַיָּא שׁ׳ Qr, for שׁורי אשׁ׳ Kt.

n. pr. gent. pl. the Susians, people of Susa Ezr 4:9, v. דהוא (DlPa 327; sg. [שׁוּשַׁנָךְ] according to Scheft92, = OP šušana-ka, from Susa, so (as altern.) AndrM 85; cf. (on Elam. god Šušinak) WeissbachAnzanische Inschr. 136 JenVOJ vi. 54 ZimKAT 3, 485, and (on Šušunḳa in Elam. inscr., appar. n.pr.terr.) v. Weissbl.c. JenZMG lv (1901), 229).
vb. corrupt (𝔗J (once), Syriac ܫܰܚܶܛ; BH[שָׁחַת]);—
Pt. pass. fs. שְׁחִיתָה Dn 2:9 corrupt word; as n. = fault 6:5(×2) (cf. 𝔗 ψ 17:3 Ru 4:22).

vb. deliver (prob. Shaph. as loan-word from Assyrian šûzub(u), ušêzib, deliver, √ ezêbu (א4 = עזב), DlPr 140 HptGGN 1883, 91; BAS i. 13 K§ 43, 1, Anm.; 𝔗 שֵׁיזֵב, Syriac ܫܰܘܙܶܒ, Chr-Pal. ܫܘܙܒ SchulthLex. 203, also Nab. שיזב Cooke 255; cf. n.pr. מְשֵׁיזַבְאֵל BH; Old Aramaic צלמשזב SAC 102; v. also foll. art.);—Pf. 3 ms. שֵׁיזִב Dn 3:28; 6:28; Impf. 3 ms. יְשֵׁיזִ֑ב 3:17; sf. יְשֵׁיזְבִנָּךְ 6:17, נְכוֹן—ִ 3:15; Inf. sf. לְשֵׁיזָבוּתָךְ 6:21, -תֵהּ v 15, -תַ֑נָא 3:17;—deliver (usually c. מִן): Dn 3:17b, ל acc. pers. v 28; 6:28b, sf. pers. 3:15, 17a; 6:15, 17, 21, abs. v 28 a. Ptcp. מְשֵׁיזִב 6:28.

Kt, שֵׁיצִי Qr vb. bring out (to an end), finish (prob. Shaph. as loan-word from Assyrian šû-ṣû, û-še-ṣû, bring out, √ aṣû (וצא, BH יצא, = Aramaic יְעָא, cf. NöGGA 1884, 1019), Dl l.c. Hpt l.c. K l.c.; 𝔗 שֵׁיצִי complete, put an end to, also come to an end, pass. be finished, Chr-Pal. ܫܝܨܝ SchulthLex. 205);—finish temple: Pf. 3 ms. שׁ׳ Ezr 6:15, but read prob. 3 mpl. שֵׁיצִיו K§ 43, 1 ad fin. Berthol Gu Hpt (so 𝔊 𝔙); > Pf. pass. Be-Ry
(√ of foll.; BH שָׁכַב, מִשְׁכָּב).
n.[m.] couch, bed;—sf. מִשְׁכְּבִי Dn 4:2, 7, 10; ךְ—ָ 2:28, 29; הּ—ֵ 7:1.
vb.

(K§ 40, 4 NöGGA 1884, 1019) find (𝔗 שְׁכַח find, Syriac ܐܶܫܟܰܚ, Chr-Pal. ܫܟܚ SchulthLex. 205; Egyptian Aramaic השכח S-CE 5, pass. אשתכה RÉS 361 A 2):—Pf. 1 s. הַשְׁכַּ֫חַת Dn 2:25; 3 mpl. הַשְׁכַּ֫חוּ Ezr 4:19 Dn 6:12; Impf. 2 ms. תְּהַשְׁכַּח Ezr 4:15; 7:16; Inf. לְהַשְׁכָּחָה Dn 6:5x2;—find, acc. rei, 6:5 (ל pers.), v 5, 6 (ל pers.), v 6 (עַל pers., acc. rei om.), Ezr 7:16 (ב loc.); sq. cl. דִּי 4:15 (ב loc.), v 19; acc. pers. Dn 2:25; ל pers. 6:12 (+ pt. action.).

Pf. 3 ms. הִשְׁתְּכַח Dn 2:35 +, 2 ms. -כַ֫חַתְּ 5:27, 3 fs. -כַ֫חַת 5:11 +;—be found, subj. rei, ב loc., Ezr 6:2; ב pers. Dn 5:11, 12, 14; 6:24; עַל pers. v 5; ל pers. + קֳדָם pers. v 23; ל rei 2:35 (v. אֲתַר); subj. pers. 5:27 + חַסִּר thou hast been found wanting (K§ 85, 3).
etc., v. כלל.
vb. dwell (BH שָׁכַן, מִשְׁכָּן);—
Impf. 3 fpl. יִשְׁכְּנָן Dn 4:18 dwell, of birds, ב loc.
causat.: Pf. 3 ms. שַׁכִּן שְׁמֵהּ תַּמָּה Ezr 6:12, of God, cause his name to dwell there.
n.[m.] abode, of God;—sf. מִשְׁכְּנֵהּ Ezr 7:15, of Jerusalem.
(√ of foll.; BH I. שׁלה (late)).
adj. at ease (Egyptian Aramaic Cooke 210);—שׁ׳ הֲוֵית בְּ Dn 4:1 I was at ease in my house.—3:29 v. following.
n.f. neglect, remissness (𝔗 id.);—abs. שׁ׳ Ezr 4:22; 6:9 Dn 6:5 + 3:29 Qr; Kt שׁלה usually thought an error for שׁלו; Hi Bev M (perhaps) expl. as שֵׁלָה = שְׁאֵלָה = thing, affair (4:14).
n.f. ease, prosperity;—sf. שְׁלֵוְתָךְ Dn 4:24.
vb. send (BH I. שָׁלַח);—

Pf. 3 ms. שׁ׳ Ezr 4:17 +; 3 mpl. שְׁלַ֫חוּ 4:11 +; 2 mpl. שְׁלַחְתּוּן 4:18; 1 pl. שְׁלַחְנָא 4:14; Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׁלַח 5:17; 6:12; Pt. pass. שְׁלִיחַ 7:14 Dn 5:24;—send, acc. of letter, etc., c. עַל pers. Ezr 4:11, 17, 18; 5:6, 7, 17; abs. 6:13, sq. vb. fin. 4:14, + acc. pers. Dn 3:28; 6:23; sq. Inf. Dn 3:2; put out hand (acc.) to harm (Inf.) Ezr 6:12; pass., be sent, c. מִן־קֳדָם pers.: subj. pers. Ezr 7:14; subj. כַּפָּא Dn 5:24.
vb. have power, rule (𝔗 Syriac; BH (q.v.) late);—

Pf. 3 ms. שׁ׳ Dn 3:27, 3 mpl. שְׁלִ֫טוּ 6:25; Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׁלַ֑ט 5:7, 3 fs. תִּשְׁלַט 2:39, 2 ms. תִּשְׁלַ֑ט 5:16;—have power upon, ב rei, Dn 3:27 (of fire); fall upon, assault (𝔗 = פָּגע בְּ), ב pers. 6:25 (of lions); subj. pers. rule; be ruler, abs., 5:7, 16, subj. kingdom, ב of earth, 2:39.
make ruler: Pf. 3 ms. sf. הַשְׁלְטָךְ 2:38 (ב pers., etc.); הַשְׁלְטֵהּ v 48 (עַל of province).
(K§ 61, 3, Beisp. α)) n.m. Dn 7:6 dominion;—שׁ׳ abs. Dn 7:6, 14, cstr. 6:27 +; emph. שָׁלְטָנָא 7:27; sf. שָׁלְטָנָךְ 4:19, -נֵהּ 3:33 +, -נְהוֹן 7:12; pl. emph. שָׁלְטָנַיָּא 7:27;—
dominion, sovereignty (usually of God): Dn 3:33; 4:19, 31(×2) 6:27b 7:6, 12, 14(×3), 26, 27(×2).
realm 6:27a. שִׁלְטוֹן v. p. 1127.
adj. having mastery, ruling;—abs. שׁ׳ Ezr 7:24 +, emph. א—ָ Dn 2:15; mpl. שְׁלִיטִין Ezr 4:20, -טִן Dn 4:23;—
having, exercising, mastery:
of God, sq. ב, Dn 4:14, 22, 29; 5:21; abs., of heavens 4:23.
of kings Ezr 4:20 (ב).
as n. = ruler Dn 2:10; 5:29, captain Dn 2:15.
having authority to do a thing (Inf.), hence impers. = it is authorized, Ezr 7:24 (so often in Syriac; cf. S-CA 11 + אנת שליט למבנה).
vb. be complete (v. BH; Egyptian Aramaic שלם pay in full Cooke404 = S-CL 5. 7);—
Pt. pass. שְׁלִם Ezr 5:16 finished, of temple.
Pf. 3 ms. sf. הַשְׁלְמַהּ Dn 5:26 God has finished it (the kingdom; brought it to an end); Imv. ms. הַשְׁלֵם Ezr 7:19 render in full, acc. rei (cf. Syriac Aph., Be-Ry Berthol), sq. קֳדָם dei.
n.m.Dn 3:31 welfare, prosperity;—in greetings: abs. Ezr 4:17 prosperity! emph. שְׁלָמָא 5:7; sf. שְׁלָֽמְכוֹן יַשְׂגִּיא Dn 3:31; 6:26.

n.m. name (v. BH שֵׁם);—cstr. שׁ׳ Ezr 5:1 +; sf. שְׁמֵהּ Dn 2:20 +; pl. cstr. שְׁמָהָת Ezr 5:4, sf. -תְהֹם v 10;—name, dei: Dn 2:20; 4:5 Ezr 5:1; 6:12; vir.: Dn 2:26; 4:5, 16; 5:12 (all Dan.), Ezr 5:4, 10(×2) also v 14, with which cf. S-CK 4, 5, 8 f., 12 f.
vb.
destroy (𝔗 Pa. make apostatize; cf. BH);—Inf. לְהַשְׁמָדָה Dn 7:26 (obj. om., = dominion).
n.m. pl. heavens (BH [שָׁמַי], שָׁמַיִם, √ שׁמה);—always emph. שְׁמַיָּא:

visible sky Je 10:11 Dn 4:8, 10, 17, 19, 20, 27, 28; עוֹף שׁ׳ 2:38; צִפְּרֵי שׁ׳ 4:9, 18; טַל שׁ׳ v 12, 20, 22, 30; 5:21; רוּחֵי שׁ׳ 7:2 winds of the sky; עֲנָנֵי שׁ׳ v 13; heavens + earth = universe Je 10:11, where God shews signs Dn 6:28.

heavens as abode of God Dn 2:28; 4:31, hence, fig., as ruling v 23 (שׁ׳ sometimes = God in NH J Aram., DWorte Jesu 179; Eng. Tr. 218 f.); as abode of angels v 32 (Dr); elsewhere in phr. אֱלָהּ שׁ׳ 2:18, 19, 37, 44 Ezr 5:11, 12; 6:9, 10; 7:12, 21, 23(×2) מֶלֶךְ שׁ׳ Dn 4:34, מָרֵא שׁ׳ 5:23.
vb. Ethpôʿal be appalled (𝔗 (rare); v. BH Chr-Pal. ܫܡ, Schulth209);—Pf. 3 ms. אֶשְׁתּוֹמַם (K§ 36) Dn 4:16.
vb. hear (v. BH);—

Pf. 3 ms. שׁ׳ Dn 6:15; 1 s. שִׁמְעֵת 5:14, 16; Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׁמַע 3:10, 2 mpl. תִּשְׁמְעוּן 3:5, 15; Pt. act. שָֽׁמְעִין 3:7; 5:23;—hear: = have sense of hearing Dn 5:23; c. acc. of sound 3:5, 7, 10, 15, word 6:15; c. cl. דִּי + עַל pers. concerning, 5:14, 16.
shew oneself obedient: Impf. 3 mpl. יִשְׁתַּמְעוּן Dn 7:27, c. ל pers. (prob.).
n.pr.loc. (BH שֹׁמְרוֹן, I. שָׁמַר);—Ezr 4:7, 10.
(√ of following; BH שׁמשׁ, שֶׁ֫מֶשׁ).
n.[m. so DWB] sun;—emph. שִׁמְשָׁא Dn 6:15.
vb.

minister (𝔗 Pa. id., תַּשְׁמִישׁ use; Palm. שמש, תשמיש, SAC 114, cf. 122 Lzb 379; Syriac ܫܰܡܶܫ, ܬܶܫܡܶܫܬܳܐ; Chr-Pal. ܫܡܫ Pa, ܬܫܡܫ; NH שִׁמֵּשׁ, תַּשְׁמִישׁ; Egyptian šms, servant, Kopt. šemše, cf. WMM in Buhl 14);—Impf. 3 mpl. sf. יְשַׁמְּשׁוּנֵּהּ Dn 7:10 were ministering to him.
n.pr.m.;—always שׁ׳ סָֽפְרָא: Ezr 4:8, 9, 17, 23 (AndrM 86* conj. OIran. caritative ששמי, conformed to שׁמשׁ, cf. Scheft 92, who, however, prefers OBaktr. simēzhi = simaēzhi, n.pr.).
v. שׁנן.
vb. change (v. BH I. שׁנה);—

Pf. 3 mpl. שְׁנוֹ Dn 3:27, sf. שְׁנוֹ֫הִי 5:6 (read prob. שְׁנוֹ עֲלוֹהִי); Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׁנֵא 7:24, 3 fs. תִּשְׁנֵא 6:18; 7:23; Pt. act. fs. שַׁנְיָא 7:19; mpl. שָׁנַ֫יִן 5:9, fpl. שָֽׁנְיָן 7:3;—intrans. change, be changed: of garment, by fire Dn 3:27, brightness (זִיו) of face 5:6, 9, purpose 6:18; be different from (מִן) 7:3, 19, 23, 24.

Pf. 3 mpl. שַׁנִּיו (K§ 47 e), and Beisp. 3) Dn 3:28; Impf. 3 mpl. יְשַׁנּוֹן 4:13; Pt. pass. fs. מְשַׁנְיָא (Baer) 7:7;—trans. change Dn 4:13 (לִבְבֵהּ מִן־אֲנָשָׁא); = frustrate word of king 3:28; pt. pass. intrans. different 7:7 (מִן). Ithpa. Pf. 3 mpl. אִשְׁתַּנּוֹ Dn 3:19 Kt (K§ 47 Beisp. 4; נִּו—ַ NöGGA 1884, 1019 Str§ 23 d M24*), > 3 ms. אִשְׁתַּנִּי Qr; Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׁתַּנֵּא 2:9, 3 mpl. -נּ֑וֹ (ן om. in pause, K§ 26, 1, but modus apocop. NöGGA 1884, 1018, as יֵאבַ֫דוּ Je 10:11, יְבַהֲלוּךְ Dn 5:10; v. also Cooke 166) 5:10, -נוֹן 7:28;—be changed: of זִיו Dn 5:10; 7:28 (v. Pe.; עַל pers.); צְלֵם אַנְפּוֹהִי 3:19 (id.); of time, conditions 2:9.

Impf. 3 ms. וְהַשְׁנֵא Ezr 6:11; Inf. לְהַשְׁנָיָה v 12 +; Pt. act. מְהַשְׁנֵא Dn 2:21;—trans. change, alter, times, etc. (v. Ithpa.) Dn 2:21; 7:25; acc. om. 6:9, 16 Ezr 6:12; frustrate edict (v. Pa.) 6:11.

n.f. year (v. BH שָׁנָה, √ I. [שָׁנָה]);—cstr. שְׁנַת: שׁ׳ חֲדָה = first year Ezr 5:13; 6:3 Dn 7:1; שׁ׳ תַּרְתֵּין Ezr 4:24 second year; שׁ׳ שֵׁת 6:15; pl. שְׁנִין שִׁתִּין וְת׳ Dn 6:1 62 years; שׁ׳ שַׂגִּיאָן Ezr 5:11.—ii. [שְׁנָה] v. ישׁן.
(√ of following; v. BH [שָׁנַן], שֵׁן).
n.[f.] tooth;—du. (of rows of teeth) abs. שִׁנַּ֫יִן Dn 7:7;—sf. שניה Kt (K§ 53, 2. b)), שִׁנַּהּ Qr, v 5, 19 (all of beasts in vision). שִׁנְּתֵהּ Dn 6:19 v. √ ישן

n.f. brief time, moment (𝔗 id., שָֽׁעֲתָא, NH שָׁעָה time, hour; Syriac ܫܳܥܬܳܐ moment, then hour Brock 369, but Chr-Pal. ܫܥܳܐ moment, hour SchwallyIdiot. 97 SchulthLex. 211; perhaps = Assyrian šattu, duration; TelAm.91, 77 še-ti, time, hour (as Canaanism) WklKAT3. 335; Arabic سِعْوٌ, سَاعَةٌ portion of time, Ethiopic ሳዕ time, ሰዓት hour, time (Buhl calls Arabic Ethiopic loan-words, but v. Wkll.c.); √ unknown: poss. Assyrian loan-word (v. Wkll.c.); DlPr 39 f. conj. שׁיע = שָׁעָה look, hence moment = ‘Augenblick,’ but vb. שׁ׳ rather of steady gaze);—moment: usually emph. בַּהּ־שַׁעֲתָא (read poss. שָֽׁ׳ as 𝔗 Syriac, M86* f. Buhl14 cf. var. in Str) in the same moment, forthwith Dn 3:6, 15; 4:30; 5:5; abs. שָׁעָה חֲדָה 4:16 for a moment.
vb. judge (BH שָׁפַט);—
Pt. as n.pl. abs. שָֽׁפְטִין Ezr 7:25 judges.
v. שׁפר.
vb. be low (v. BH);—

bring low, humble: Pf. 2 ms. הַשְׁפֵּלְתְּ לִבְבָךְ Dn 5:22 thou hast not humbled thine heart: Impf. 3 ms. יְהַשְׁפִּ֑ל 7:24, Inf. לְהַשְׁפָּלָה 4:34, Pt. מַשְׁפִּ֑ל 5:19, all. c. acc. pers. bring low, put down.
adj. low in station;—cstr. שׁ׳ Dn 4:14.
vb. be fair, seemly (𝔗 Syriac; cf. BH (rare and mostly late); Palm. שפר ל merit well of, SAC117; Cappad. Aramaic שפירא LzbEph 160);—
Pf. 3 ms. שׁ׳, c. קֳדָם pers. it seemed good to Dn 3:32; 6:2; Impf. 3 ms. יִשְׁפַּר עַל 4:24 let my counsel be acceptable to thee.
adj. fair, beautiful;—of foliage Dn 4:9, 18.
n.[m.] dawn (𝔗 id.; redupl. (K§ 59, 3) from above √?);—emph. שְׁפַרְפָּרָא Dn 6:20.
v. שׁוק.
vb.
loosen
abide (v. BH I. שׁרה);—
Inf. לְמִשְׁרֵא Dn 5:16; read מִשׁ׳ also v 12, for מְשָׁ׳ (K§ 40 n. M 87* al.);—Pt. pass. שְׁרֵא (K§ 47, Beisp. f)) 2:22; pl. שְׁרַיִן 3:25;—
loosen: lit. pt. pass. loosed Dn 3:25 (opp. bound); fig. loosen knots, i.e. solve difficulties, 5:12, 16.
abide (from loosening girths, loads, at encampment; cf. 𝔗 NH [also on pt. pass.]), fig. 2:22 (עִם pers.).
Pf. 3 mpl. שָׁרִיו Ezr 5:2 begin (v. BH III. [חָלַל Hiph. 2), sq. inf.
Pt. mpl. מִשְׁתָּרַ֫יִן Dn 5:6 joints were loosened (in fear).
(𝔗 שְׁרֵיק, Syriac ܫܪܰܩ, BH שָׁרַק hiss, whistle (onomatop.)).
n.f. pipe (cf. Syriac (rare));—emph. מַשְׁרוֹקִיתָא Dn 3:5, 7, 15, מַשְׁרֹק׳ 3:10.
n.m. Dn 4:12 root (v. BH);—pl. sf. שָׁרְשׁוֹ֫הִי of tree Dn 4:12, 20, 23.
Kt (i.e. שֹׁרְשׁוּ K§ 61, 4, 5), Qr שְׁרשִׁי n.f. uprooting, fig. banishment;—abs. Ezr 7:26.
n.pr.m. Ezr 5:14, 16.
v. שׁדת.
vb. drink (𝔗 שְׁתָא, אִשְׁתִּי, Syriac ܐܶܫܬܻܝ; v. BH ׃שָׁתָה);—
Pf. 3 mpl. אִשְׁתִּיו (K§ 11, 4, α)) Dn 5:3, 4; Impf. 3 mpl. יִשְׁתּוֹן v 2; Pt. act. שָׁתֵה v 1, pl. שָׁתַ֫יִן v 23;—drink, acc. wine Dn 5:1, 4, + ב of vessel v 23 and (acc. om.) v 2, 3.
n.m. feast (as BH מִשְׁתֶּה);—emph. בֵּית מִשְׁתְּיָא Dn 5:10.
sixty, v. שׁדת.

n.pr.m. Pers. official Ezr 5:3, 6; 6:6, 13; Σαθαρβουζανα (αι, ε, ης); 𝔊L Σαθραβωζανης (AndrM 87* proposes מתרב׳, Gk.
